verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:1
verses.text: The Diatessaron of Tatian Introductory Notes:.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:2
verses.text: In the Borgian Ms.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:3
verses.text: In the name of the one God, the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, to him be the glory forever.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:4
verses.text: We shall begin, with the help of God most high, the writing of the pure gospel, the blooming garden, called Diatessaron (a word meaning "fourfold"), the work compiled by Titianus the Greek out of the four evangelistsâ€”Matthew the elect, whose symbol is M, Mark the chosen, whose symbol is R, Luke the approved, whose symbol is K, and John the beloved, whose symbol is H.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:5
verses.text: The work was translated from Syriac into Arabic by the excellent and learned priest Abu'l Faraj 'Abdulla ibn-at-Tayyib, may God grant him his favour.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:6
verses.text: He began with the first of And he said:  The Beginning of the Gospel of Jesus the Son of the living God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:7
verses.text: John:  In the beginning, etc.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:8
verses.text: In the Vatican ms.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:9
verses.text: In the name of the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, giver of life, the God that is one in substance in his essence, and three in persons in his attributes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:10
verses.text: The first of his Gospel is He began the first of his Gospel with Mark.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:11
verses.text: And he said:  The Beginning of the Gospel of Jesus the Son of the living God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 1:12
verses.text: John:  In the beginning, etc.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:1
verses.text: Section I   In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and God is the , Word.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:2
verses.text: This was in the beginning with God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:3
verses.text: Everything was by his hand, and  without him not even one existing thing was made.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:4
verses.text: In him was life, and the life  is the light of men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:5
verses.text: And the light shineth in the darkness, and the darkness apprehended it not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:6
verses.text: There was in the days of Herod the king a priest whose name was Zacharias, of the family of Abijah; and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name  was Elizabeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:7
verses.text: And they were both righteous before God, walking in all his commands,  and in the uprightness of God without reproach.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:8
verses.text: And they had no son, for  Elizabeth was barren, and they had both advanced in age.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:9
verses.text: And while he discharged  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:10
verses.text: the duties of priest in the order of his service before God, according to the custom of the priesthood it was his turn to burn incense; so he entered the  temple of the Lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:11
verses.text: And the whole gathering of the people were praying without at the  time of the incense.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:12
verses.text: And there appeared unto Zacharias the angel of the Lord, standing  at the right of the altar of incense; and Zacharias was troubled when he saw him,  and fear fell upon him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:13
verses.text: But the angel said unto him, Be not agitated, Zacharias, for thy prayer is heard, and thy wife Elizabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt  call his name John; and thou shalt have joy and gladness, and many shall rejoice  at his birth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:14
verses.text: And he shall be great before the Lord, and shall not drink wine nor strong drink, and he shall be filled with the Holy Spirit while he is in his mother's  womb.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:15
verses.text: And he shall turn back many of the children of Israel to the Lord their  God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:16
verses.text: And he shall go before him in the spirit, and in the power of Elijah the prophet, to turn back the heart of the fathers to the sons, and those that obey not to the knowledge of the righteous; and to prepare for the Lord a perfect people.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:17
verses.text: And Zacharias said unto the angel, How shall I know this, since I am an old man  and my wife is advanced in years? And the angel answered and said unto him, I am Gabriel, that standeth before God; and I was sent to speak unto thee, and give  thee tidings of this.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:18
verses.text: Henceforth thou shalt be speechless, and shalt not be able to speak until the day in which this shall come to pass, because thou didst not trust  this my word, which shall be accomplished in its time.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:19
verses.text: And the people were standing Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:20
verses.text: awaiting Zacharias, and they were perplexed at his delaying in the temple.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:21
verses.text: And when Zacharias went out, he was not able to speak unto them: so they knew that he had seen in the temple a vision; and he made signs unto them, and  continued dumb.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:22
verses.text: And when the days of his service were completed, he departed to his dwelling.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:23
verses.text: And after those days Elizabeth his wife conceived; and she hid herself five  months, and said, This hath the Lord done unto me in the days when he looked upon me, to remove my reproach from among men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:24
verses.text: And in the sixth month Gabriel the angel was sent from God to Galilee to a  city called Nazareth, to a virgin given in marriage to a man named Joseph, of the  house of David; and the virgin's name was Mary.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:25
verses.text: And the angel entered unto her and said unto her, Peace be unto thee, thou who art filled with grace.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:26
verses.text: Our Lord  is with thee, thou blessed amongst women.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:27
verses.text: And she, when she beheld, was agitated  at his word, and pondered what this salutation could be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:28
verses.text: And the angel said unto  her, Fear not, Mary, for thou hast found favour with God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:29
verses.text: Thou shalt now conceive,  and bear a son, and call his name Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:30
verses.text: This shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the Most High; and the Lord God will give him the throne of  David his father: and he shall rule over the house of Jacob for ever; and to his  kingdom there shall be no end.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:31
verses.text: Mary said unto the angel, How shall this be to  me when no man hath known me? The angel answered and said unto her, The Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:32
verses.text: Holy Spirit will come, and the power of the Most High shall rest upon thee, and therefore shall he that is born of thee be pure, and shall be called the Son  of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:33
verses.text: And lo, Elizabeth thy kinswoman, she also hath conceived a son in her old  age; and this is the sixth month with her, her that is called barren.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:34
verses.text: For nothing is  difficult for God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:35
verses.text: Mary said, Lo, I am the handmaid of the Lord; let it be unto me according unto thy word.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:36
verses.text: And the angel departed from her.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:37
verses.text: And then Mary arose in those days and went in haste into the hill country, to a  city of Judah; and entered into the house of Zacharias, and asked for the health of  Elizabeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:38
verses.text: And when Elizabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe leaped in  her womb.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:39
verses.text: And Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit; and cried with a loud voice and said unto Mary, Blessed art thou amongst women, and blessed is the  fruit that is in thy womb.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:40
verses.text: Whence have I this privilege, that the mother of my  Lord should come unto me? When the sound of thy salutation reached my ears,  with great joy rejoiced the babe in my womb.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:41
verses.text: And blessed is she who believed  that what was spoken to her from the Lord would be fulfilled.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:42
verses.text: And Mary said,  My soul doth magnify the Lord,   And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour,   Who hath looked upon the low estate of his handmaiden:  Lo, henceforth, all generations shall pronounce blessing on me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:43
verses.text: For he hath done great things for me, who is mighty,  And holy is his name.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:44
verses.text: And his mercy embraceth them who fear him,  Throughout the ages and the times.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:45
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:46
verses.text: He wrought the victory with his arm,  And scattered them that prided themselves in their opinions.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:47
verses.text: He overthrew them that acted haughtily from their thrones,  And raised the lowly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:48
verses.text: He satisfied with good things the hungry,  And left the rich without anything.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:49
verses.text: He helped Israel his servant,  And remembered his mercy   (According as he spake with our fathers)  Unto Abraham and unto his seed for ever.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:50
verses.text: And Mary abode with Elizabeth about three months, and returned unto her house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:51
verses.text: ,  And Elizabeth's time of delivery was come; and she brought forth a son.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:52
verses.text: And her neighbours and kinsfolk heard that God had multiplied his mercy towards her;  and they rejoiced with her.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:53
verses.text: And when it was the eighth day, they came to circumcise the child, and called him Zacharias, calling him by the name of his father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:54
verses.text: And his mother answered and said unto them, Not so; but he shall be called John.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:55
verses.text: And they said unto her, There is no man of thy kindred that is called by this name.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:56
verses.text: ,  And they made signs to his father, saying, How dost thou wish to name him? And he asked for a tablet, and wrote and said, His name is John.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:57
verses.text: And every one wondered.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:58
verses.text: And immediately his mouth was opened, and his tongue, and he spake and  praised God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:59
verses.text: And fear fell on all their neighbours: and this was spoken of in all  the mountains of Judah.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:60
verses.text: And all who heard pondered in their hearts and said, What shall this child be? And the hand of the Lord was with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:61
verses.text: And Zacharias his father was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied and said,   Blessed is the Lord, the God of Israel,  Who hath cared for his people, and wrought for it salvation;   And hath raised for us the horn of salvation  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:62
verses.text: In the house of David his servant   (As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets from eternity),   That he might save us from our enemies,  And from the hand of all them that hate us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:63
verses.text: And he hath performed his mercy towards our fathers,  And remembered his holy covenants,   And the oath which he sware unto Abraham our father,   That he would give us deliverance from the hand of our enemies,  And without fear we shall serve before him   All our days with equity and righteousness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:64
verses.text: And as for thee, O child, prophet of the Most High shalt thou be called.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:65
verses.text: Thou shalt go forth before the face of the Lord to prepare his way,   To give the knowledge of salvation unto his people,  For the forgiveness of their sins,   Through the mercy of the compassion of our God,  With which he careth for us, to appear from on high   To give light to them that sit in darkness and under the shadow of death,  And to set straight our feet in the way of peace.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 2:66
verses.text: And the child grew and became strong in the spirit, and abode in the desert until the time of his appearing unto the children of Israel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:1
verses.text: Section II.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:2
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:3
verses.text: Now the birth of Jesus the Messiah was on this wise: In the time when his mother was given in marriage to Joseph, before they came together,  she was found with child of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:4
verses.text: And Joseph her husband was a just man and did not wish to expose her, and he purposed to put her away secretly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:5
verses.text: But when he thought of this, the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream, and said unto him, Joseph, son of David, fear not to take Mary thy wife, for that  which is begotten in her is of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:6
verses.text: She shall bear a son, and thou shalt  call his name Jesus, and he shall save his people from their sins.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:7
verses.text: And all this was that the saying from the Lord by the prophet might be fulfilled:   Behold, the virgin shall conceive, and bear a son,  And they shall call his name Immanuel,   which is, being interpreted, With us is our God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:8
verses.text: And when Joseph arose from his  sleep, he did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took his wife; and knew her not until she brought forth her firstborn son.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:9
verses.text: And in those days there went forth a decree from Augustus Caesar that all the  people of his dominion should be enrolled.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:10
verses.text: This first enrolment was while Quirinius ,  was governor of Syria.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:11
verses.text: And every man went to be enrolled in his city.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:12
verses.text: And Joseph went up also from Nazareth, a city of Galilee, to Judaea, to the city of David  which is called Bethlehem (for he was of the house of David and of his tribe), with  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:13
verses.text: Mary his betrothed, she being with child, to be enrolled there.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:14
verses.text: And while  she was there the days for her being delivered were accomplished.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:15
verses.text: And she brought forth her firstborn son; and she wrapped him in swaddling cloths and laid him in a manger, because there was no place for them where they were staying.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:16
verses.text: And there were in that region shepherds abiding, keeping their flock in the watch  of the night.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:17
verses.text: And behold, the angel of God came unto them, and the glory of the  Lord shone upon them; and they were greatly terrified.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:18
verses.text: And the angel said unto them, Be not terrified; for I bring you tidings of great joy which shall be to the  whole world; there is born to you this day a Saviour, which is the Lord the Messiah,  in the city of David.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:19
verses.text: And this is a sign for you: ye shall find a babe wrapped  in swaddling cloths and laid in a manger.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:20
verses.text: And there appeared with the angels suddenly many heavenly forces praising God and saying,   Praise be to God in the highest,  And on the earth peace, and good hope to men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:21
verses.text: And when the angels departed from them to heaven, the shepherds spake to one another and said, We will go to Bethlehem and see this word which hath been, as  the Lord made known unto us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:22
verses.text: And they came with haste, and found Mary and  Joseph, and the babe laid in a manger.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:23
verses.text: And when they saw, they reported the word  which was spoken to them about the child.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:24
verses.text: And all that heard wondered at the  description which the shepherds described to them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:25
verses.text: But Mary kept these sayings  and discriminated them in her heart.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:26
verses.text: And those shepherds returned, magnifying and praising God for all that they had seen and heard, according as it was described unto them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:27
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:28
verses.text: And when eight days were fulfilled that the child should be circumcised, his name was called Jesus, being that by which he was called by the angel before his conception in the womb.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:29
verses.text: And when the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were  completed, they took him up to Jerusalem to present him before the Lord (as it is written in the law of the Lord, Every male opening the womb shall be called the  holy thing of the Lord), and to give a sacrificial victim as it is said in the law of  the Lord, A pair of doves or two young pigeons.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:30
verses.text: And there was in Jerusalem a man whose name was Simeon; and this man was upright and pious, and expecting  the consolation of Israel; and the Holy Spirit was upon him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:31
verses.text: And it had been said unto him by the Holy Spirit, that he should not see death till he had seen with  his eyes the Messiah of the Lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:32
verses.text: And this man came by the Spirit to the temple; and at the time when his parents brought in the child Jesus, that they might  present for him a sacrifice, as it is written in the law, he bare him in his arms and praised God and said,   Now loosest thou the bonds of thy servant, O Lord, in peace,  According to thy saying;   For mine eye hath witnessed thy mercy,   Which thou hast made ready because of the whole world;   A light for the unveiling of the nations,  And a glory to thy people Israel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:33
verses.text: And Joseph and his mother were marvelling at the things which were being said  concerning him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:34
verses.text: And Simeon blessed them and said to Mary his mother, Behold, he is set for the overthrow and rising of many in Israel; and for a sign of contention;  and a spear shall pierce through thine own soul; that the thoughts of the  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:35
verses.text: hearts of many may be revealed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:36
verses.text: And Anna the prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher, was also advanced in years (and she dwelt  with her husband seven years from her virginity, and she remained a widow about eighty-four years); and she left not the temple, and served night and day with  fasting and prayer.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:37
verses.text: And she also rose in that hour and thanked the Lord, and she  spake of him with every one who was expecting the deliverance of Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 3:38
verses.text: And when they had accomplished everything according to what is in the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to Nazareth their city.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:1
verses.text: Section III.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:2
verses.text: ,  And after that, the Magi came from the east to Jerusalem, and said, Where is the King of the Jews which was born? We have seen his star in the east, and have  come to worship him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:3
verses.text: And Herod the king heard, and he was troubled, and all  Jerusalem with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:4
verses.text: And he gathered all the chief priests and the scribes of the  people, and asked them in what place the Messiah should be born.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:5
verses.text: They said, In Bethlehem of Judaea: thus it is written in the prophet,   Thou also, Bethlehem of Judah,  Art not contemptible among the kings of Judah:  From thee shall go forth a king,  And he shall be a shepherd to my people Israel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:6
verses.text: Then Herod called the Magi secretly, and inquired of them the time at which  the star appeared to them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:7
verses.text: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said unto them, Go and search about the child diligently; and when ye have found him, come and  make known to me, that I also may go and worship him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:8
verses.text: And they, when they Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:9
verses.text: heard the king, departed; and lo, the star which they had seen in the east went before them, until it came and stood above the place where the child ,  was.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:10
verses.text: And when they beheld the star, they rejoiced with very great joy.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:11
verses.text: And they entered the house and beheld the child with Mary his mother, and fell down worshipping him, and opened their saddle-bags and offered to him offerings, gold and  myrrh and frankincense.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:12
verses.text: And they saw in a dream that they should not return to Herod, and they travelled by another way in going to their country.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:13
verses.text: And when they had departed, the angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph, and said unto him, Rise, take the child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I speak to thee; for Herod is determined to seek the child  to slay him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:14
verses.text: And Joseph arose and took the child and his mother in the night, and  fled into Egypt, and remained in it until the time of the death of Herod: that that might be fulfilled which was said by the Lord in the prophet, which said, From  Egypt did I call my son.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:15
verses.text: And Herod then, when he saw that he was mocked of the Magi, was very angry, and sent and killed all the male children which were in Bethlehem and all its borders, from two years old and under, according to the time  which he had inquired from the Magi.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:16
verses.text: Then was fulfilled the saying in Jeremiah the prophet, which said,   A voice was heard in Ramah,  Weeping and much lamentation;  Rachel weeping for her children,  And not willing to be consoled for their loss.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:17
verses.text: But when Herod the king died, the angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to  Joseph in Egypt, and said unto him, Rise and take the child and his mother, and Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:18
verses.text: go into the land of Israel; for they have died who sought the child's life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:19
verses.text: And Joseph rose and took the child and his mother, and came to the land  of Israel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:20
verses.text: But when he heard that Archelaus had become king over Judaea instead of Herod his father, he feared to go thither; and he saw in a dream that he should  go into the land of Galilee, and that he should abide in a city called Nazareth: that the saying in the prophet might be fulfilled, that he should be called a Nazarene.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:21
verses.text: And the child grew, and became strong in spirit, becoming filled with wisdom; and the grace of God was upon him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:22
verses.text: And his kinsfolk used to go every year to Jerusalem at the feast of the passover.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:23
verses.text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up according to their custom,  to the feast.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:24
verses.text: And when the days were accomplished, they returned; and the child  Jesus remained in Jerusalem, and Joseph and his mother knew not: and they supposed that he was with the children of their company.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:25
verses.text: And when they had gone one day's journey, they sought him beside their people and those who knew them,  and they found him not; so they returned to Jerusalem and sought him again.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:26
verses.text: And after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers,  hearing them and asking them questions; and all who heard him wondered at  his wisdom and his words.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:27
verses.text: And when they saw him they wondered, and his mother said unto him, My son, why hast thou dealt with us thus? behold, I and thy father  have been seeking for thee with much anxiety.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:28
verses.text: And he said unto them, Why were  ye seeking me? know ye not that I must be in the house of my Father? And they  understood not the word which he spake unto them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:29
verses.text: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth; and he was obedient to them: and his mother used to keep all these sayings in her heart.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:30
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:31
verses.text: And Jesus grew in his stature and wisdom, and in grace with God and men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:32
verses.text: And in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was governor in Judaea, and one of the four rulers, Herod, in Galilee; and Philip his brother, one of the four rulers, in Ituraea and in the district of Trachonitis; and  Lysanias, one of the four rulers, in Abilene; in the chief-priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the command of God went forth to John the son of Zacharias in the  desert.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:33
verses.text: And he came into all the region which is about Jordan, proclaiming the  baptism of repentance unto the forgiveness of sins.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:34
verses.text: And he was preaching in the  wilderness of Judaea, and saying, Repent ye; the kingdom of heaven is come near.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:35
verses.text: This is he that was spoken of in Isaiah the prophet,  The voice which crieth in the desert,   Prepare ye the way of the Lord,  And make straight in the plain, paths for our God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:36
verses.text: All the valleys shall become filled,  And all the mountains and hills shall become low;  And the rough shall become plain, And the difficult place, easy;   And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:37
verses.text: This man came to bear witness, that he might bear witness to the light, that  every man might believe through his mediation.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:38
verses.text: He was not the light, but that he  might bear witness to the light, which was the light of truth, that giveth light to  every man coming into the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:39
verses.text: He was in the world, and the world was made  by him, and the world knew  him not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:40
verses.text: He came unto his own, and his own received him not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:41
verses.text: And those who received him, to them gave he the power that they might  be sons of God,â€”those which believe in his name: which were born, not of blood,  nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of a man, but of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:42
verses.text: And the Word became flesh, and took up his abode among us; and we saw his glory as the glory  of the only Son from the Father, which is full of grace and equity.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:43
verses.text: John bare witness Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:44
verses.text: of him, and cried, and said, This is he that I said cometh after me and  was before me, because he was before me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:45
verses.text: And of his fullness received  we all grace for grace.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 4:46
verses.text: For the law was given through the mediation of Moses, but truth and grace were through Jesus Christ.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:1
verses.text: Section IV.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:2
verses.text: No man hath seen God at any time; the only Son, God, which is in the bosom of his Father, he hath told of him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:3
verses.text: And this is the witness of John when the Jews sent to him from Jerusalem priests  and Levites to ask him, Who art thou? And he acknowledged, and denied not;  and he confessed that he was not the Messiah.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:4
verses.text: And they asked him again, What then? Art thou Elijah? And he said, I am not he.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:5
verses.text: Art thou a prophet? He  said, No.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:6
verses.text: They said unto him, Then who art thou? that we may answer them that  sent us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:7
verses.text: What sayest thou of thyself? And he said, I am the voice that crieth in  the desert, Repair ye the way of the Lord, as said Isaiah the prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:8
verses.text: And they  that were sent were from the Pharisees.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:9
verses.text: And they asked him and said unto him, Why baptizest thou now, when thou art not the Messiah, nor Elijah, nor a prophet?  John answered and said unto them, I baptize with water: among you is standing  one whom ye know not: this is he who I said cometh after me and was before  me, the latchets of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:10
verses.text: And that was in Bethany beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:11
verses.text: Now John's raiment was camel's hair, and he was girded with skins, and his food  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:12
verses.text: was of locusts and honey of the wilderness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:13
verses.text: Then went out unto him the people of Jerusalem, and all Judaea, and all the region which is about the ,  Jordan; and they were baptized of him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:14
verses.text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to be baptized, he said unto them, Ye children of vipers, who hath led you to flee from the wrath to come? ,  Do now the fruits which are worthy of repentance; and think and say not within yourselves, We have a father, even Abraham; for I say unto you, that God is able to  raise up of these stones children unto Abraham.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:15
verses.text: Behold, the axe hath been laid at the roots of the trees, and so every tree that beareth not good fruit shall be taken and  cast into the fire.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:16
verses.text: And the multitudes were asking him and saying, What shall we do?  He answered and said unto them, He that hath two tunics shall give to him that  hath not; and he that hath food shall do likewise.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:17
verses.text: And the publicans also came  to be baptized, and they said unto him, Teacher, what shall we do? He said unto  them, Seek not more than what ye are commanded to seek.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:18
verses.text: And the servants of the guard asked him and said, And we also, what shall we do? He said unto them, Do not violence to any man, nor wrong him; and let your allowances satisfy you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:19
verses.text: And when the people were conjecturing about John, and all of them thinking  in their hearts whether he were haply the Messiah, John answered and said unto them, I baptize you with water; there cometh one after me who is stronger than I, the latchets of whose shoes I am not worthy to loosen; he will baptize you with the  Holy Spirit and fire: who taketh the fan in his hand to cleanse his threshing-floors, Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:20
verses.text: and the wheat he gathereth into his garners, while the straw he shall burn in fire which can not be put out.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:21
verses.text: And other things he taught and preached among the people.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:22
verses.text: Then came Jesus from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized of him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:23
verses.text: And Jesus was about thirty years old, and it was supposed that he was the son of  Joseph.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:24
verses.text: And John saw Jesus coming unto him, and said, This is the Lamb of  God, that taketh on itself the burden of the sins of the world! This is he concerning whom I said, There cometh after me a man who was before me, because he was  before me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:25
verses.text: And I knew him not; but that he should be made manifest to Israel,  for this cause came I to baptize with water.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:26
verses.text: And John was hindering him and  saying, I have need of being baptized by thee, and comest thou to me? Jesus answered him and said, Suffer this now: thus it is our duty to fulfill all righteousness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:27
verses.text: Then he suffered him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:28
verses.text: And when all the people were baptized, Jesus also  was baptized.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:29
verses.text: And immediately he went up out of the water, and heaven opened  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:30
verses.text: to him, and the Holy Spirit descended upon him in the similitude of the  body of a dove; and lo, a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved  Son, in whom I am well pleased.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:31
verses.text: And John bare witness and said, I beheld the  Spirit descend from heaven like a dove; and it abode upon him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:32
verses.text: But I knew him not; but he that sent me to baptize with water, he said unto me, Upon whomsoever thou shalt behold the Spirit descending and lighting upon him, the same is he that  baptizeth with the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:33
verses.text: And I have seen and borne witness that this is the Son of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:34
verses.text: ,  And Jesus returned from the Jordan, filled with the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:35
verses.text: And immediately the Spirit took him out into the wilderness, to be tried of the devil; and he  was with the beasts.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:36
verses.text: And he fasted forty days and forty nights.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:37
verses.text: And he ate nothing  in those days, and at the end of them he hungered.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:38
verses.text: And the tempter came and said unto him, If thou art the Son of God, speak, and these stones shall become  bread.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:39
verses.text: He answered and said, It is written, Not by bread alone shall man live, but  by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:40
verses.text: Then the devil brought  him to the holy city, and set him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said unto him, If thou art the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written,  He shall give his angels charge concerning thee:  And they shall take thee on their arms,  So that thy foot shall not stumble against a stone.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:41
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, And it is written also, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy  God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:42
verses.text: And the devil took him up to a high mountain, and shewed him all the kingdoms  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:43
verses.text: of the earth, and their glory, in the least time; and the devil said unto him, To thee will I give all this dominion, and its glory, which is delivered to  me that I may give it to whomsoever I will.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 5:44
verses.text: If then thou wilt worship before me, all of it shall be thine.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:1
verses.text: Section V.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:2
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou  shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him alone shalt thou serve.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:3
verses.text: And when the  devil had completed all his temptations, he departed from him for a season.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:4
verses.text: And behold, the angels drew near and ministered unto him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:5
verses.text: ,  And next day John was standing, and two of his disciples; and he saw Jesus as  he was walking, and said, Behold, the Lamb of God! And his two disciples heard  him saying this, and they followed Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:6
verses.text: And Jesus turned and saw them coming after him, and said unto them, What seek ye? They said unto him, Our master,  where art thou staying? And he said unto them, Come and see.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:7
verses.text: And they came and saw his place, and abode with him that day: and it was about the tenth hour.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:8
verses.text: One of the two which heard from John, and followed Jesus, was Andrew the  brother of Simon.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:9
verses.text: And he saw first Simon his brother, and said unto him, We have  found the Messiah.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:10
verses.text: And he brought him unto Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:11
verses.text: And Jesus looked upon him and said, Thou art Simon, son of Jonah: thou shalt be called Cephas.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:12
verses.text: And on the next day Jesus desired to go forth to Galilee, and he found Philip,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:13
verses.text: and said unto him, Follow me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:14
verses.text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, of the city  of Andrew and Simon.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:15
verses.text: And Philip found Nathanael, and said unto him, He of whom Moses did write in the law and in the prophets, we have found that  he is Jesus the son of Joseph of Nazareth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:16
verses.text: Nathanael said unto him, Is it possible that there can be any good thing from Nazareth? Philip said unto him, Come and  see.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:17
verses.text: And Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and said of him, This is indeed a  son of Israel in whom is no guile.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:18
verses.text: And Nathanael said unto him, Whence knowest thou me? Jesus said unto him, Before Philip called thee, while thou wast under the  fig tree, I saw thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:19
verses.text: Nathanael answered and said unto him, My Master, thou art  the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:20
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, hast thou believed? thou shalt see what is  greater than this.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:21
verses.text: And he said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Henceforth ye shall see the heavens opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:22
verses.text: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:23
verses.text: And on the third day there was a feast in Cana, a city of Galilee; and the  mother of Jesus was there: and Jesus also and his disciples were invited to the  feast.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:24
verses.text: And they lacked wine: and his mother said unto Jesus, They have no wine.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:25
verses.text: And Jesus said unto her, What have I to do with thee, woman? hath not mine  hour come? And his mother said unto the servants, What he saith unto you, do.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:26
verses.text: And there were there six vessels of stone, placed for the Jews' purification, such as  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:27
verses.text: would contain two or three jars.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:28
verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Fill the vessels  with water.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:29
verses.text: And they filled them to the top.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:30
verses.text: He said unto them, Draw  out now, and present to the ruler of the feast.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:31
verses.text: And they did so.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:32
verses.text: And when the ruler of the company tasted that water which had become wine, and knew not whence it was (but the servants knew, because they filled up the water), the ruler of the company called  the bridegroom, and said unto him, Every man presenteth first the good wine, and on intoxication he bringeth what is poor; but thou hast kept the good wine until  now.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:33
verses.text: And this is the first sign which Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and manifested  his glory; and his disciples believed on him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:34
verses.text: And his fame spread in all the country  which was around them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:35
verses.text: And he taught in their synagogues, and was glorified  by every man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:36
verses.text: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and entered, according to his custom, into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood  up to read.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:37
verses.text: And he was given the book of Isaiah the prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:38
verses.text: And Jesus opened the book and found the place where it was written,   The Spirit of the Lord is upon me,  And for this anointed he me, to preach good tidings to the poor;  And he hath sent me to heal the broken-hearted,  And to proclaim forgiveness to the evil-doers, and sight to the blind,  And to bring the broken into forgiveness,   And to proclaim an acceptable year of the Lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:39
verses.text: And he rolled up the book and gave it to the servant, and went and sat down:  and the eyes of all that were in the synagogue were observing him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:40
verses.text: And he began to say unto them, To-day hath this scripture been fulfilled which ye have heard with  your ears.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:41
verses.text: And they all bare him witness, and wondered at the words of grace which were proceeding from his mouth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:42
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:43
verses.text: And from that time began Jesus to proclaim the gospel of the kingdom  of God, and to say, Repent ye, and believe in the gospel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:44
verses.text: The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of heaven hath come near.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:45
verses.text: And while he was walking on the shore of the sea of Galilee, he saw two brethren, Simon who was called Cephas, and Andrew his brother, casting their nets into  the sea; for they were fishers.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:46
verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Follow me, and I will  make you fishers of men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:47
verses.text: And they immediately left their nets there and followed  him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:48
verses.text: And when he went on from thence, he saw other two brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the ship with Zebedee their father, mending  their nets; and Jesus called them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:49
verses.text: And they immediately forsook the ship and their father Zebedee, and followed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:50
verses.text: And when the multitude gathered unto him to hear the word of God, while he  was standing on the shore of the sea of Gennesaret, he saw two boats standing beside the sea, while the two fishers which were gone out of them were washing their  nets.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:51
verses.text: And one of them belonged to Simon Cephas.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:52
verses.text: And Jesus went up and sat down in it, and commanded that they should move away a little from the land into  the water.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:53
verses.text: And he sat down and taught the multitudes from the boat.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:54
verses.text: And when he had left off his speaking, he said unto Simon, Put out into the deep, and cast your  net for a draught.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:55
verses.text: And Simon answered and said unto him, My Master, we toiled  all night and caught nothing; now at thy word I will cast the net.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:56
verses.text: And when they did this, there were enclosed a great many fishes; and their net was on the  point of breaking.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:57
verses.text: And they beckoned to their comrades that were in the other boat, to come and help them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 6:58
verses.text: And when they came, they filled both boats, so that they were on the point of sinking.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:1
verses.text: Section VI.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:2
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:3
verses.text: But when Simon Cephas saw this he fell before the feet of Jesus, and said unto him, My Lord, I beseech of thee to depart from me, for I am  a sinful man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:4
verses.text: And amazement took possession of him, and of all who were with him,  because of the draught of the fishes which they had taken.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:5
verses.text: And thus also were James and John the sons of Zebedee overtaken, who were Simon's partners.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:6
verses.text: And Jesus said  unto Simon, Fear not; henceforth thou shalt be a fisher of men unto life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:7
verses.text: And they brought the boats to the land; and they left everything, and followed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:8
verses.text: And after that came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea; and he went  about there with them, and baptized.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:9
verses.text: And John also was baptizing in aenon, which is beside Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:10
verses.text: ,  And John was not yet come into prison.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:11
verses.text: And there was an inquiry between  one of John's disciples and one of the Jews about purifying.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:12
verses.text: And they came unto John, and said unto him, Our master, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom  thou hast borne witness, behold, he also baptizeth, and many come to him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:13
verses.text: John answered and said unto them, A man can receive nothing of himself, except it be  given him from heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:14
verses.text: Ye are they that bear witness unto me that I said, I am  not the Messiah, but I am one sent before him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:15
verses.text: And he that hath a bride is a bridegroom: and the friend of the bridegroom is he that standeth and listeneth to him, and rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom's voice.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:16
verses.text: Lo now, behold, ,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:17
verses.text: my joy becometh complete.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:18
verses.text: And he must increase and I decrease.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:19
verses.text: For he that is come from above is higher than everything; and he that is of the earth, of the earth he is, and of the earth he speaketh; and he that came down from heaven is  higher than all.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:20
verses.text: And he beareth witness of what he hath seen and heard: and no man  receiveth his witness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:21
verses.text: And he that hath received his witness hath asserted that he is  truly God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:22
verses.text: And he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: God gave  not the Spirit by measure.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:23
verses.text: The Father loveth the Son, and hath put everything in  his hands.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:24
verses.text: Whosoever believeth in the Son hath eternal life; but whosoever obeyeth not the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God cometh upon him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:25
verses.text: And Jesus learned that the Pharisees had heard that he had received many disciples,  and that he was baptizing more than John (not that Jesus was himself baptizing,  but his disciples); and so he left Judaea.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:26
verses.text: And Herod the governor, because he used to be rebuked by John because of Herodias the wife of Philip his brother, and for all the sins which he was committing,  added to all that also this, that he shut up John in prison.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:27
verses.text: And when Jesus heard that John was delivered up, he went away to Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:28
verses.text: And he entered again into Cana, where he had made the water wine.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:29
verses.text: And there  was at Capernaum a king's servant, whose son was sick.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:30
verses.text: And this man heard that Jesus was come from Judaea to Galilee; and he went to him, and besought of him that he would come down and heal his son; for he had come near unto death.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:31
verses.text: ,  Jesus said unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye do not believe.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:32
verses.text: The Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:33
verses.text: king's servant said unto him, My Lord, come down, that the child die not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:34
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Go; for thy son is alive.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:35
verses.text: And that man believed the  word which Jesus spake, and went.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:36
verses.text: And when he went down, his servants met him  and told him, and said unto him, Thy son is alive.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:37
verses.text: And he asked them at what time he recovered.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:38
verses.text: They said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left  him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:39
verses.text: And his father knew that that was at that hour in which Jesus said unto him,  Thy son is alive.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:40
verses.text: And he believed, he and the whole people of his house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:41
verses.text: And this  is the second sign which Jesus did when he returned from Judaea to Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:42
verses.text: And he was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:43
verses.text: And he left Nazareth, and came and dwelt in Capernaum by the sea shore, in the  borders of Zebulun and Naphtali: that it might be fulfilled which was said in Isaiah the prophet, who said,   The land of Zebulun, the land of Naphtali,  The way of the sea, the passage of the Jordan,  Galilee of the nations:   The people sitting in darkness  Saw a great light,  And those sitting in the region and in the shadow of death,  There appeared to them a light.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:44
verses.text: And he taught them on the sabbaths.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:45
verses.text: And they wondered because of his doctrine:  for his word was as if it were authoritative.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:46
verses.text: And there was in the synagogue  a man with an unclean devil, and he cried out with a loud voice, and said, Let me alone; what have I to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come for our  destruction? I know thee who thou art, thou Holy One of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:47
verses.text: And Jesus rebuked him, and said, Stop up thy mouth, and come out of him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:48
verses.text: And the demon threw him  in the midst and came out of him, having done him no harm.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:49
verses.text: And great amazement Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:50
verses.text: took hold upon every man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:51
verses.text: And they talked one with another, and said, What is this word that orders the unclean spirits with power and  authority, and they come out? And the news of him spread abroad in all the region which was around them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:52
verses.text: And when Jesus went out of the synagogue, he saw a man sitting among the publicans, named Matthew: and he said unto him, Come after me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:53
verses.text: And he rose, and followed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:54
verses.text: ,  And Jesus came to the house of Simon and Andrew with James and John.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:55
verses.text: And Simon's wife's mother was oppressed with a great fever, and they besought him for  her.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:56
verses.text: And he stood over her and rebuked her fever, and it left her, and immediately  she rose and ministered to them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:57
verses.text: And at even they brought to him many that had  demons: and he cast out their devils with the word.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:58
verses.text: And all that had sick, their diseases being divers and malignant, brought them unto him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:59
verses.text: And he laid his hand  on them one by one and healed them: that that might be fulfilled which was said  in the prophet Isaiah, who said, He taketh our pains and beareth our diseases.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:60
verses.text: And  all the city was gathered together unto the door of Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:61
verses.text: And he cast out devils also from many, as they were crying out and saying, Thou art the Messiah, the Son of God; and he rebuked them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 7:62
verses.text: And he suffered not the demons to speak, because they knew him that he was the Lord the Messiah.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:1
verses.text: Section VII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:2
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:3
verses.text: And in the morning of that day he went out very early, and went to a  desert place, and was there praying.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:4
verses.text: And Simon and those that were with  him sought him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:5
verses.text: And when they found him, they said unto him, All the people seek for  thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:6
verses.text: He said unto them, Let us go into the adjacent villages and towns, that I may  preach there also; for to this end did I come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:7
verses.text: And the multitudes were seeking him, and came till they reached him; and they took hold of him, that he should not  go away from them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:8
verses.text: But Jesus said unto them, I must preach of the kingdom of  God in other cities also: for because of this gospel was I sent.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:9
verses.text: And Jesus was going about all the cities and the villages, and teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all the diseases and all the sicknesses,  and casting out the devils.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:10
verses.text: And his fame became known that he was teaching in  every place and being glorified by every man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:11
verses.text: And when he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting among the tax-gatherers; and he said unto him, Follow  me: and he rose and followed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:12
verses.text: And the news of him was heard of in all the land of Syria: and they brought unto him all those whom grievous ills had befallen through divers diseases, and those that were enduring torment, and those that were possessed, and lunatics, and paralytics; and he healed them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:13
verses.text: ,  And after some days Jesus entered into Capernaum again.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:14
verses.text: And when they heard that he was in the house, many gathered, so that it could not hold them, even about  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:15
verses.text: the door; and he made known to them the word of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:16
verses.text: And there were there some of the Pharisees and the teachers of the law, sitting, come from all the villages of Galilee, and Judaea, and Jerusalem; and the power of the Lord was  present to heal them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:17
verses.text: And some men brought a bed with a man on it who was paralytic.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:18
verses.text: And they sought to bring him in and lay him before him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:19
verses.text: And when they found no way to bring him in because of the multitude of people, they went up to the roof, and let him down with his bed from the roofing, into the midst before Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:20
verses.text: And when Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the paralytic, My son, thy sins are forgiven  thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:21
verses.text: And the scribes and Pharisees began to think within their hearts, Why doth this man blaspheme? Who is it that is able to forgive sins, but God alone?  And Jesus knew by the spirit that they were thinking this within themselves, and he  said unto them, Why do ye think this within your heart? Which is better, that it should be said to the paralytic, Thy sins are forgiven thee, or that it should be said  to him, Arise, and take thy bed, and walk? That ye may know that the Son of man  is empowered on earth to forgive sins (and he said to the paralytic), I say unto thee,  Arise, take thy bed, and go to thine house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:22
verses.text: And he rose forthwith, and took his bed, and went out in the presence of all.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:23
verses.text: And he went to his house praising God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:24
verses.text: And when those multitudes saw, they feared; and amazement took possession of  them, and they praised God, who had given such power to men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:25
verses.text: And they said, We have seen marvellous things to-day, of which we have never before seen the like.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:26
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:27
verses.text: And after that, Jesus went out, and saw a publican, named Levi, sitting  among the publicans: and he said unto him, Follow me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:28
verses.text: And he left  everything, and rose, and followed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:29
verses.text: And Levi made him a great feast in his house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:30
verses.text: And there was a great multitude of the publicans and others sitting with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:31
verses.text: And the scribes and Pharisees murmured, and said unto his disciples, Why do ye eat  and drink with the publicans and sinners? Jesus answered and said unto them, The physician seeketh not those who are well, but those that are afflicted with grievous ,  sickness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:32
verses.text: I came not to call the righteous, but the sinners, to repentance.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:33
verses.text: And they said unto him, Why do the disciples of John fast always, and pray, and the  Pharisees also, but thy disciples eat and drink? He said unto them, Ye cannot make  the sons of the marriage feast fast, while the bridegroom is with them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:34
verses.text: Days will come, when the bridegroom is taken away from them; then will they fast in those  days.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:35
verses.text: And he spake unto them a parable: No man inserteth a new patch and seweth it in a worn garment, lest the newness of the new take from the worn, and  there occur a great rent.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:36
verses.text: And no man putteth fresh wine into old skins, lest the wine burst the skins, and the skins be destroyed, and the wine spilled; but they put  the fresh wine in the new skins, and both are preserved.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:37
verses.text: And no man drinketh old wine and straightway desireth fresh; for he saith, The old is better.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:38
verses.text: And while Jesus was walking on the sabbath day among the sown fields, his disciples Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:39
verses.text: hungered.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:40
verses.text: And they were rubbing the ears with their hands, and  eating.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:41
verses.text: But some of the Pharisees, when they saw them, said unto him, See,  why do thy disciples on the sabbath day that which is not lawful? But Jesus said unto them, Have ye not read in olden time what David did, when he had need and  hungered, he and those that were with him? how he entered the house of God, when Abiathar was high priest, and ate the bread of the table of the Lord, which it was not lawful that any should eat, save the priests, and gave to them that were with him also?  And he said unto them, The sabbath was created because of man, and man was not  created because of the sabbath.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:42
verses.text: Or have ye not read in the law, that the priests in  the temple profane the sabbath, and yet they are blameless? I say unto you now,  that here is what is greater than the temple.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:43
verses.text: If ye had known this: I love mercy,  not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned those on whom is no blame.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:44
verses.text: The  Lord of the sabbath is the Son of man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:45
verses.text: And his relatives heard, and went out to take him, and said, He hath gone out of his mind.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:46
verses.text: And on the next sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and was teaching.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:47
verses.text: And there was there a man whose right hand was withered.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:48
verses.text: And the scribes and the Pharisees were watching him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day,  that they might find the means of accusing him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:49
verses.text: But he knew their thoughts, and said unto the man whose hand was withered, Rise and come near into the midst of  the synagogue.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:50
verses.text: And when he came and stood, Jesus said unto them, I ask you, which is lawful to be done on the sabbath day, good or evil? shall lives be saved or  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:51
verses.text: destroyed? But they were silent.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:52
verses.text: Regarding them with anger, being grieved because of the hardness of their hearts.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:53
verses.text: And he said unto the man, Stretch out thy hand.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:54
verses.text: And he stretched it out: and his hand became straight.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 8:55
verses.text: Then he said unto them, What man of you shall have one sheep, and if it fall into a  well on the sabbath day, will not take it and lift it out? And how much is man better than a sheep! Wherefore it is lawful on the sabbath to do good.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:1
verses.text: Section VIII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:2
verses.text: And the Pharisees went out, and consulted together concerning him, that they  might destroy him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:3
verses.text: And Jesus perceived, and removed thence: and great multitudes  followed him; and he healed all of them: and he forbade them that they should  not make him known: that the saying in Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which said,   Behold, my servant with whom I am pleased;  My beloved in whom my soul hath delighted:  My spirit have I put upon him,  And he shall proclaim to the nations judgement.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:4
verses.text: He shall not dispute, nor cry out;  And no man shall hear his voice in the marketplace.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:5
verses.text: And a bruised reed shall he not break,  And a smoking lamp shall he not extinguish,  Until he shall bring forth judgement unto victory.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:6
verses.text: And the nations shall rejoice in his name.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:7
verses.text: And in those days Jesus went out to the mountain that he might pray, and he  spent the night there in prayer to God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:8
verses.text: And when the morning was come, he called the disciples.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:9
verses.text: And he went towards the sea: and there followed him much people  from Galilee that he might pray, and from Judaea, and from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea, and from beyond Jordan, and from Tyre, and from Sidon, and from Decapolis;  and great multitudes came unto him, which had heard what he did.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:10
verses.text: And he spake to his disciples to bring him the boat because of the multitudes, that they  might not throng him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:11
verses.text: And he healed many, so that they were almost falling on Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:12
verses.text: him on account of their seeking to get near him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:13
verses.text: And those that had  plagues and unclean spirits, as soon as they beheld him, would fall, and  cry out, and say, Thou art the Son of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:14
verses.text: And he rebuked them much, that they  should not make him known.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:15
verses.text: And those that were under the constraint of unclean  spirits were healed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:16
verses.text: And all of the crowd were seeking to come near him; because power went out from him, and he healed them all.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:17
verses.text: ,  And when Jesus saw the multitudes, he went up to the mountain.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:18
verses.text: And he called his disciples, and chose from them twelve; and they are those whom he named  apostles: Simon, whom he named Cephas, and Andrew his brother, and James and  John, and Philip and Bartholomew, and Matthew and Thomas, and James the son  of Alphaeus, and Simon which was called the Zealot, and Judas the son of James,  and Judas the Iscariot, being he that had betrayed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:19
verses.text: And Jesus went down with them and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and the great  multitude of people.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:20
verses.text: And these twelve he chose to be with him, and that he might  send them to preach, and to have power to heal the sick and to cast out devils.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:21
verses.text: Then he lifted up his eyes unto them, and opened his mouth, and taught them, and said,   Blessed are the poor in spirit: for the kingdom of heaven is theirs.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:22
verses.text: Blessed are the sorrowful: for they shall be comforted.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:23
verses.text: Blessed are the humble: for they shall inherit the earth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:24
verses.text: Blessed are they that hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be satisfied.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:25
verses.text: Blessed are the merciful: for on them shall be mercy.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:26
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:27
verses.text: Blessed are the pure in their hearts: for they shall see God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:28
verses.text: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the sons of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:29
verses.text: Blessed are they that were persecuted for righteousness' sake: for the kingdom of heaven is theirs.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:30
verses.text: Blessed are ye when men shall hate you, and separate you from them, and persecute you, and reproach you, and shall speak against you with all evil talk, for my  sake, falsely.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:31
verses.text: Then rejoice and be glad, for your reward is great in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets before you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:32
verses.text: But woe unto you rich! for ye have received your consolation.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:33
verses.text: Woe unto you that are satisfied! ye shall hunger.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:34
verses.text: Woe unto you that laugh now! ye shall weep and be sad.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:35
verses.text: Woe unto you when men praise you! for so did their fathers use to do to the false prophets.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:36
verses.text: Unto you do I say, ye which hear, Ye are the salt of the earth: if then the salt become tasteless, wherewith shall it be salted? For any purpose it is of no use, but  is thrown outside, and men tread upon it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:37
verses.text: Ye are the light of the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:38
verses.text: It is  impossible that a city built on a mountain should be hid.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:39
verses.text: Neither do they light a lamp and place it under a bushel, but on the lamp-stand, and it giveth light to all  who are in the house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:40
verses.text: So shall your light shine before men, that they may see  your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:41
verses.text: There is nothing  secret that shall not be revealed, or hidden that shall not be known.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:42
verses.text: Whoever hath ears that hear, let him hear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:43
verses.text: Think not that I came to destroy the law or the prophets; I came not to destroy,  but to complete.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:44
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Until heaven and earth shall pass, there Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:45
verses.text: shall not pass one point or one letter of the law, until all of it shall be  accomplished.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:46
verses.text: Every one who shall violate now one of these small commandments, and shall teach men so, shall be called lacking in the kingdom of heaven: every one that shall do and teach shall be called great in the kingdom  of heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:47
verses.text: I say unto you now, unless your righteousness abound more than that of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall not enter the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:48
verses.text: Ye have heard that it was said to the ancients, Do not kill; and every one that  killeth is worthy of the judgement.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:49
verses.text: But I say unto you that every one who is angry with his brother without a cause is worthy of the judgement; and every one that saith to his brother, Thou foul one, is condemned by the synagogue; and whosoever  saith to him, Thou fool, is worthy of the fire of Gehenna.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:50
verses.text: If thou art now offering thy gift at the altar, and rememberest there that thy brother hath conceived  against thee any grudge, leave thy gift at the altar, and go first and satisfy thy  brother, and then return and offer thy gift.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:51
verses.text: Join thine adversary quickly, and while thou art still with him in the way, give a ransom and free thyself from him;  lest thine adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the tax-collector,  and thou fall into prison.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:52
verses.text: And verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt not go out thence until thou payest the last farthing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:53
verses.text: ,  Ye have heard that it was said, Do not commit adultery: but I now say unto you, that every one that looketh at a woman lusting after her hath forthwith already  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:54
verses.text: committed adultery with her in his heart.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:55
verses.text: If thy right eye injure thee, put it out and cast it from thee; for it is preferable for thee that one of thy  members should perish, and not thy whole body go into the fire of hell.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:56
verses.text: And if thy right hand injure thee, cut it off and cast it from thee; and it is better for thee that  one of thy members should perish, and not thy whole body fall into Gehenna.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 9:57
verses.text: It was said that he that putteth away his wife should give her a writing of divorcement:  but I say unto you, that every one that putteth away his wife, except for the cause of adultery, hath made it lawful for her to commit adultery: and whosoever taketh one that is put away committeth adultery.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:1
verses.text: Section IX.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:2
verses.text: Ye have heard also that it was said unto the ancients, Lie not, but perform unto  God in thy oaths: but I say unto you, Swear not at all; neither by heaven, for it  is God's throne; nor by the earth, for it is a footstool under his feet; nor yet by  Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:3
verses.text: Neither shalt thou swear by thy  head, for thou canst not make in it one lock of hair black or white.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:4
verses.text: But your word shall be either Yea or Nay, and what is in excess of this is of the evil one.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:5
verses.text: ,  Ye have heard that it was said, Eye for eye, and tooth for tooth: but I say unto you, Stand not in opposition to the evil; but whosoever smiteth thee on thy right  cheek, turn to him also the other.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:6
verses.text: And he that would sue thee, and take thy tunic,  leave to him also thy wrapper.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:7
verses.text: And whosoever compelleth thee one mile, go with  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:8
verses.text: him twain.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:9
verses.text: And he that asketh thee, give unto him: and he that would borrow of thee, prevent him not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:10
verses.text: And prosecute not him that taketh thy  substance.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:11
verses.text: And as ye desire that men should do to you, so do ye also to them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:12
verses.text: ,  Ye have heard that it was said, Love thy neighbour and hate thine enemy: but I say unto you, Love your enemies, and pray for those that curse you, and deal well with those that hate you, and pray for those who take you with violence and persecute you;  that ye may be sons of your heavenly Father, who maketh his sun to rise on the good and the evil, and sendeth down his rain on the righteous and the  unrighteous.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:13
verses.text: If ye love them that love you, what reward shall ye have? for the publicans  and sinners also love those that love them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:14
verses.text: And if ye do a kindness to those  who treat you well, where is your superiority? for sinners also do likewise.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:15
verses.text: And if ye lend to him of whom ye hope for a reward, where is your superiority? for the  sinners also lend to sinners, seeking recompense from them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:16
verses.text: But love your enemies, and do good to them, and lend, and cut not off the hope of any man; that your reward may be great, and ye may be the children of the Highest: for he is lenient  towards the wicked and the ungrateful.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:17
verses.text: Be ye merciful, even as your Father also is  merciful.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:18
verses.text: And if ye inquire for the good of your brethren only, what more have  ye done than others? is not this the conduct of the publicans also? Be ye now perfect, even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:19
verses.text: Consider your alms; do them not before men to let them see you: and if it be not  so, ye have no reward before your Father which is in the heavens.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:20
verses.text: When then thou givest an alms now, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as do the people of hypocrisy, Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:21
verses.text: in the synagogues and the marketplaces, that men may praise them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:22
verses.text: And  verily say I unto you, They have received their reward.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:23
verses.text: But thou, when  thou doest alms, let thy left hand not know what thy right hand doeth; that thine alms may be concealed: and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:24
verses.text: And whenever thou prayest, be not as the hypocrites, who love to stand in the synagogues and in the corners of the marketplaces for prayers, that men may behold  them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:25
verses.text: And verily say I unto you, They have received their reward.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:26
verses.text: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and fasten thy door, and pray to thy Father in secret, and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:27
verses.text: And whenever ye pray, be not babblers, as the heathen; for they think that by the  abundance of their words they shall be heard.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:28
verses.text: Then be not ye now like unto them:  for your Father knoweth your request before ye ask him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:29
verses.text: One of his disciples said  unto him, Our Lord, teach us to pray, as John taught his disciples.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:30
verses.text: Jesus said unto  them, Thus now pray ye now: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy ,  name.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:31
verses.text: Thy kingdom come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:32
verses.text: Thy will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:33
