verses.text: Give us the  food of to-day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:34
verses.text: And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgave those that trespassed  against us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:35
verses.text: And bring us not into temptations, but deliver us from the evil one.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:36
verses.text: For  thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever and ever.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:37
verses.text: If ye forgive Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:38
verses.text: men their wrong-doing, your Father which is in heaven will forgive you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:39
verses.text: But if ye forgive not men, neither will your Father pardon your wrong-doing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:40
verses.text: When ye fast, do not frown, as the hypocrites; for they make their faces austere, that they may be seen of men that they are fasting.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:41
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, They  have received their reward.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:42
verses.text: But when thou fastest, wash thy face and anoint thy  head; that thou make not an appearance to men of fasting, but to thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:43
verses.text: Be not agitated, little flock; for your Father hath delighted to give you the kingdom.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:44
verses.text: Sell your possessions, and give in alms; take to yourselves purses that wax  not old.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:45
verses.text: Lay not up treasure on earth, where moth and worm corrupt, and where  thieves break through and steal: but lay up for yourselves treasure in heaven, where  moth and worm do not corrupt, nor thieves break through nor steal: for where your  treasure is, there also will your heart be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:46
verses.text: The lamp of the body is the eye: if then  thine eye now be sound, thy whole body also shall be light.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:47
verses.text: But if thine eye be evil, all thy body shall be dark.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:48
verses.text: And if the light which is in thee is darkness, how  great is thy darkness! Be watchful that the light which is in thee be not darkness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 10:49
verses.text: Because that, if thy whole body is light, and have no part dark, it shall all be light, as the lamp giveth light to thee with its flame.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:1
verses.text: Section X.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:2
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:3
verses.text: No man can serve two masters; and that because it is necessary that he hate one of them and love the other, and honour one of them and despise the  other.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:4
verses.text: Ye cannot serve God and possessions.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:5
verses.text: And because of this I say unto you, Be not anxious for yourselves, what ye shall eat and what ye shall drink; neither for your bodies, what ye shall put on.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:6
verses.text: Is not the life better than the food, and the body  than the raiment? Consider the birds of the heaven, which sow not, nor reap, nor store in barns; and yet your Father which is in heaven feedeth them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:7
verses.text: Are not ye  better than they? Who of you when he trieth is able to add to his stature one  cubit? If then ye are not able for a small thing, why are ye anxious about the ,  rest? Consider the wild lily, how it grows, although it toils not, nor spins; and I say unto you that Solomon in the greatness of his glory was not clothed like one of  them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:8
verses.text: And if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to-day is, and to-morrow  is cast into the oven, how much more shall be unto you, O ye of little faith! Be not anxious, so as to say, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, With  what shall we be clothed? Neither let your minds be perplexed in this: all these things the nations of the world seek; and your Father which is in heaven knoweth  your need of all these things.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:9
verses.text: Seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness;  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:10
verses.text: and all these shall come to you as something additional for you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:11
verses.text: Be not anxious for the morrow; for the morrow shall be anxious for what belongs to it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:12
verses.text: Sufficient unto the day is its evil.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:13
verses.text: Judge not, that ye be not judged: condemn not, that ye be not condemned:  forgive, and it shall be forgiven you: release, and ye shall be released: give, that ye may be given unto; with good measure, abundant, full, they shall thrust into your  bosoms.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:14
verses.text: With what measure ye measure it shall be measured to you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:15
verses.text: See to it what ye hear: with what measure ye measure it shall be measured to you; and ye  shall be given more.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:16
verses.text: I say unto those that hear, He that hath shall be given unto; and he that hath not, that which he regards as his shall be taken from him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:17
verses.text: And he spake unto them a parable, Can a blind man haply guide a blind man?  shall they not both fall into a hollow? A disciple is not better than his master;  every perfect man shall be as his master.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:18
verses.text: Why lookest thou at the mote which is in the eye of thy brother, but considerest not the column that is in thine own eye?  Or how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, I will take out the mote from thine eye; and the column which is in thine eye thou seest not? Thou hypocrite, take out first the column from thine eye; and then shalt thou see to take out the mote from the eye of thy brother.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:19
verses.text: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast your pearls before the swine, lest they trample them with their feet, and return and wound you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:20
verses.text: And he said unto them, Who of you, that hath a friend, goeth to him at midnight,  and saith unto him, My friend, lend me three loaves; for a friend hath come  to me from a journey, and I have nothing to offer to him: and that friend shall Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:21
verses.text: answer him from within, and say unto him, Trouble me not; for the door is shut, and my children are with me in bed, and I cannot rise and give thee?  And verily I say unto you, If he will not give him because of friendship, yet because  of his importunity he will rise and give him what he seeketh.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:22
verses.text: And I also say unto you, Ask, and ye shall be given unto; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be  opened unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:23
verses.text: Every one that asketh receiveth, and he that seeketh findeth, and  he that knocketh, it shall be opened to him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:24
verses.text: What father of you, shall his son ask for breadâ€”will he, think you, give him a stone? and if he ask of him a fish, will he,  think you, instead of the fish give him a serpent? and if he ask him for an egg, will  he, think you, extend to him a scorpion? If ye then, although being evil, know the gifts which are good, and give them to your children, how much more shall your  Father which is in heaven give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him? Whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: this is the law and the prophets.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:25
verses.text: Enter ye by the narrow gate; for the wide gate and the broad way lead to destruction,  and many they be which go therein.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:26
verses.text: How narrow is the gate and straitened the way leading to life! and few be they that find it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:27
verses.text: Beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep's clothing, while within  they are ravening wolves.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:28
verses.text: But by their fruits ye shall know them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:29
verses.text: For every tree is known by its fruit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:30
verses.text: For figs are not gathered of thorns, neither are grapes plucked of  briers.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:31
verses.text: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit, but the evil tree bringeth  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:32
verses.text: forth evil fruit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:33
verses.text: The good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither can the  evil tree bring forth good fruit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:34
verses.text: The good man from the good treasures that are in his heart bringeth forth good things; and the evil man from the evil treasures that are in his heart bringeth forth evil things: and from the overflowings of the  heart the lips speak.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:35
verses.text: Every tree that beareth not good fruit is cut down and cast ,  into the fire.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:36
verses.text: Therefore by their fruits ye shall know them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:37
verses.text: Not all that say unto me, My Lord, my Lord, shall enter the kingdom of the heavens; but he that doeth  the will of my Father which is in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:38
verses.text: Many shall say unto me in that day, My Lord, my Lord, did we not prophesy in thy name, and in thy name cast out  devils, and in thy name do many powers? Then shall I say unto them, I never  knew you: depart from me, ye servants of iniquity.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:39
verses.text: Every man that cometh unto  me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth them, I will shew you to what he is like: he is like the wise man which built a house, and digged and went deep, and laid the  foundations on a rock: and the rain came down, and the rivers overflowed, and the winds blew, and shook that house, and it fell not: for its foundation was laid on  rocks.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 11:40
verses.text: And every one that heareth these my words, and doeth them not, is like  the foolish man which built his house on sand, without foundation: and the rain descended, and the rivers overflowed, and the winds blew, and smote upon that house, and it fell: and the fall of it was great.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:1
verses.text: Section XI.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:2
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:3
verses.text: And when Jesus finished these sayings, the multitudes were astonished  at his teaching; and that because he was teaching them as one having authority, not as their scribes and the Pharisees.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:4
verses.text: And when he descended from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:5
verses.text: And when Jesus entered Capernaum, the servant of one of the chiefs was in an  evil case, and he was precious to him, and he was at the point of death.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:6
verses.text: And he  heard of Jesus, and came to him with the elders of the Jews; and he besought him, and said, My Lord, my boy is laid in the house paralysed, and he is suffering grievous  torment.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:7
verses.text: And the elders urgently requested of him, and said, He is worthy that  this should be done unto him: for he loveth our people, and he also built the synagogue ,  for us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:8
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, I will come and heal him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:9
verses.text: That chief answered and said, My Lord, I am not worthy that my roof should shade thee; but it sufficeth  that thou speak a word, and my lad shall be healed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:10
verses.text: And I also am a man in obedience to authority, having under my hand soldiers: and I say to this one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant that he do this,  and he doeth it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:11
verses.text: And when Jesus heard that, he marvelled at him, and turned and said unto the multitude that were coming with him, Verily I say unto you, I have  not found in Israel the like of this faith.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:12
verses.text: I say unto you, that many shall come from the east and the west, and shall recline with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:13
verses.text: in the kingdom of heaven: but the children of the kingdom shall be cast  forth into the outer darkness: and there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:14
verses.text: And Jesus said to that chief, Go thy way; as thou hast believed, so shall it be unto thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:15
verses.text: And his lad was healed in that hour.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:16
verses.text: And that chief returned to the house and found that sick servant healed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:17
verses.text: And the day after, he was going to a city called Nain, and his disciples with him,  and a great multitude.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:18
verses.text: And when he was come near the gate of the city, he saw a crowd accompanying one that was dead, the only son of his mother; and his mother was a widow: and there was with her a great multitude of the people of the  city.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:19
verses.text: And when Jesus saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep  not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:20
verses.text: And he went and advanced to the bier, and the bearers of it stood still; and  he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:21
verses.text: And that dead man sat up and began  to speak; and he gave him to his mother.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:22
verses.text: And fear came on all the people: and they praised God, and said, There hath risen among us a great prophet: and, God  hath had regard to his people.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:23
verses.text: And this news concerning him spread in all Judaea, and in all the region which was about them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:24
verses.text: And when Jesus saw great multitudes surrounding him, he commanded them to  depart to the other side.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:25
verses.text: And while they were going in the way, there came one of the scribes and said unto him, My Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou  goest.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:26
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the heaven have  nests; but the Son of man hath not a place in which to lay his head.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:27
verses.text: And he said unto another, Follow me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:28
verses.text: And he said unto him, My Lord, suffer me first to go and  bury my father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:29
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Leave the dead to bury their dead; but thou,  follow me and preach the kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:30
verses.text: And another said unto him, I will follow Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:31
verses.text: thee, my Lord; but first suffer me to go and salute my household and  come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:32
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, There is no one who putteth his hand to the plough and looketh behind him, and yet is fit for the kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:33
verses.text: And he said to them on that day in the evening, Let us go over to the other side  of the lake; and he left the multitudes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:34
verses.text: And Jesus went up and sat in the ship,  he and his disciples, and there were with them other ships.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:35
verses.text: And there occurred on the sea a great tempest of whirlwind and wind,  and the ship was on the point of  sinking from the greatness of the waves.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:36
verses.text: But Jesus was sleeping on a cushion in the stern of the ship; and his disciples came and awoke him, and said unto him, Our  Lord, save us; lo, we perish.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:37
verses.text: And he rose, and rebuked the winds and the turbulence of the water, and said to the sea, Be still, for thou art rebuked; and the wind  was still, and there was a great calm.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:38
verses.text: And he said unto them, Why are ye thus  afraid? and why have ye no faith? And they feared greatly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:39
verses.text: And they marvelled, and said one to another, Who, think you, is this, who commandeth also the wind and the waves and the sea, and they obey him?   And they departed and came to the country of the Gadarenes, which is on the  other side, opposite the land of Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:40
verses.text: And when he went out of the ship to the land, there met him from among the tombs a man who had a devil for a long time,  and wore no clothes, neither dwelt in a house, but among the tombs.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:41
verses.text: And no man was Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:42
verses.text: able to bind him with chains, because any time that he was bound with chains  and fetters he cut the chains and loosened the fetters; and he was snatched  away of the devil into the desert, and no man was able to quiet him; and at all times, in the night and in the day, he would be among the tombs and in the mountains; and no man was able to pass by that way; and he would cry out and wound himself  with stones.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:43
verses.text: And when he saw Jesus at a distance, he hastened and worshipped  him, and cried with a loud voice and said, What have we to do with thee, Jesus,  Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, torment me not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:44
verses.text: And Jesus commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man: and he had suffered a long  time since the time when he came into captivity to it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:45
verses.text: And Jesus asked him, What is thy name? He said unto him, Legion; for there had entered into him many  devils.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:46
verses.text: And they besought him that he would not command them to depart into  the depths.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:47
verses.text: And there was there a herd of many swine, feeding in the mountain, and those devils besought him to give them leave to enter the swine; and he gave  them leave.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:48
verses.text: And the devils went out of the man and entered into the swine.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:49
verses.text: And that herd hastened to the summit and fell down into the midst of the sea, about two  thousand, and they were choked in the water.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:50
verses.text: And when the keepers saw what  happened, they fled, and told those in the cities and villages.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:51
verses.text: And the people went out to see what had happened; and they came to Jesus, and found the man whose Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:52
verses.text: devils had gone out, clothed, modest, seated at the feet of Jesus; and they  feared.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 12:53
verses.text: And they reported what they saw, and how the man was healed who had a devil, and concerning those swine also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:1
verses.text: Section XII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:2
verses.text: And all the multitude of the Gadarenes entreated him to depart from them, because that great fear took hold upon them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:3
verses.text: ,  But Jesus went up into the ship, and crossed, and came to his city.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:4
verses.text: And that man from whom the devils went out entreated that he might stay with him; but  Jesus sent him away, and said unto him, Return to thy house, and make known what  God hath done for thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:5
verses.text: And he went, and began to publish in Decapolis what Jesus had done for him; and they all marvelled.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:6
verses.text: And when Jesus had crossed in the ship to that side, a great multitude received  him; and they were all looking for him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:7
verses.text: And a man named Jairus, the chief of the  synagogue, fell before the feet of Jesus, and besought him much, and said unto him, I have an only daughter, and she is come nigh unto death; but come and lay thy  hand upon her, and she shall live.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:8
verses.text: And Jesus rose, and his disciples, and they followed  him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:9
verses.text: And there joined him a great multitude, and they pressed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:10
verses.text: ,  And a woman, which had a flow of blood for twelve years, had suffered much of many physicians, and spent all that she had, and was not benefited at all, but her  trouble increased further.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:11
verses.text: And when she heard of Jesus, she came in the thronging of  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:12
verses.text: the crowd behind him, and touched his garments; and she thought within  herself, If I could reach to touch his garments, I should live.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:13
verses.text: And immediately the fountain of her blood was dried; and she felt in her body that she was healed  of her plague.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:14
verses.text: And Jesus straightway knew within himself that power had gone out of him; and he turned to the crowd, and said, Who approached unto my garments?  And on their denying, all of them, Simon Cephas and those with him said unto him, Our Master, the multitudes throng thee and press thee, and sayest thou, Who approached  unto me? And he said, Some one approached unto me; and I knew that  power went forth from me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:15
verses.text: And that woman, when she saw that she was not hid  from him, came fearing and agitated (for she knew what had happened to her), and fell down and worshipped him, and told, in the presence of all the people, for what  reason she touched him, and how she was healed immediately.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:16
verses.text: And Jesus said unto her, Be of good courage, daughter; thy faith hath made thee alive; depart in peace, and be whole from thy plague.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:17
verses.text: And while he was yet speaking, there came a man from the house of the chief of the synagogue, and said unto him, Thy daughter hath died; so trouble not the  teacher.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:18
verses.text: But Jesus heard, and said unto the father of the maid, Fear not: but believe  only, and she shall live.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:19
verses.text: And he suffered no man to go with him, except  Simon Cephas, and James, and John the brother of James.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:20
verses.text: And they reached the house of the chief of the synagogue; and he saw them agitated, weeping and wailing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:21
verses.text: And he entered, and said unto them, Why are ye agitated and weeping? the  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:22
verses.text: maid hath not died, but she is sleeping.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:23
verses.text: And they laughed at him, for  they knew that she had died.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:24
verses.text: And he put every man forth without, and took the father of the maid, and her mother, and Simon, and James, and John, and  entered into the place where the maid was laid.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:25
verses.text: And he took hold of the hand of the maid, and said unto her, Maid, arise.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:26
verses.text: And her spirit returned, and straightway  she arose and walked: and she was about twelve years of age.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:27
verses.text: And he commanded  that there should be given to her something to eat.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:28
verses.text: And her father wondered greatly:  and he warned them that they should tell no man what had happened.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:29
verses.text: And this report spread in all that land.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:30
verses.text: And when Jesus crossed over from there, there joined him two blind men, crying  out, and saying, Have mercy on us, thou son of David.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:31
verses.text: And when he came to the house, those two blind men came to him: and Jesus said unto them, Believe ye  that I am able to do this? They said unto him, Yea, our Lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:32
verses.text: Then he touched  their eyes, and said, As ye have believed, it shall be unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:33
verses.text: And immediately their eyes were opened.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:34
verses.text: And Jesus forbade them, and said, See that no man know.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:35
verses.text: But they went out and published the news in all that land.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:36
verses.text: And when Jesus went out, they brought to him a dumb man having a devil.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:37
verses.text: And on the going out of the devil that dumb man spake.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:38
verses.text: And the multitudes marvelled, and said, It was never so seen in Israel   And Jesus was going about in all the cities and in the villages, and teaching in their synagogues, and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom, and healing every disease  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:39
verses.text: and sickness; and many followed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:40
verses.text: And when Jesus saw the multitudes, he had compassion on them, for they were wearied and scattered, as sheep  that have no shepherd.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:41
verses.text: And he called his twelve disciples, and gave them power and  much authority over all devils and diseases; and sent them two and two, that they  might proclaim the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:42
verses.text: And he charged them, and said, Walk not in the way of the heathen, nor enter into the cities of the Samaritans.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:43
verses.text: ,  Go especially unto the sheep that are lost of the sons of Israel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:44
verses.text: And  when ye go, proclaim and say, The kingdom of heaven is come near.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:45
verses.text: And heal the sick, and cleanse the lepers, and cast out the devils: freely ye have received, freely ,  give.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:46
verses.text: Get you not gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses; and take nothing for the way, except a staff only; nor bag, nor bread; neither shall ye have two tunics,  nor shoes, nor staff, but be shod with sandals; for the labourer is worthy of his food.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:47
verses.text: And whatever city or village ye enter, inquire who is worthy in it, and there be until ,  ye go out.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:48
verses.text: And when ye enter into the house, ask for the peace of the house: and if the house is worthy, your peace shall come upon it; but if it is not worthy, your  peace shall return unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:49
verses.text: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your sayings, when ye go out from that house, or from that village, shake off the dust  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:50
verses.text: that is under your feet against them for a testimony.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 13:51
verses.text: And verily I say unto you, To the land of Sodom and Gomorrah there shall be rest in the day of judgement, rather than to that city.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:1
verses.text: Section XIII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:2
verses.text: I am sending you as lambs among wolves: be ye now wise as serpents, and  harmless as doves.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:3
verses.text: Beware of men: they shall deliver you to the councils of the  magistrates, and scourge you in their synagogues; and shall bring you before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them and against the nations.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:4
verses.text: And when they deliver you up, be not anxious, nor consider beforehand, what ye  shall say; but ye shall be given in that hour what ye ought to speak.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:5
verses.text: Ye do not  speak, but the Spirit of your Father speaketh in you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:6
verses.text: The brother shall deliver up his brother to death, and the father his son; and the sons shall rise against their  parents, and put them to death.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:7
verses.text: And ye shall be hated of every man because of  my name; but he that endureth unto the end of the matter shall be saved.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:8
verses.text: When they expel you from this city, flee to another.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:9
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Ye shall not finish all the cities of the people of Israel, until the Son of man come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:10
verses.text: ,  A disciple is not superior to his lord, nor a servant to his master.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:11
verses.text: For it is enough then for the disciple that he be as his lord, and the servant as his master.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:12
verses.text: If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much more the people  of his house! Fear them not therefore: for there is nothing covered, that shall  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:13
verses.text: not be revealed; nor hid, that shall not be disclosed and published.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:14
verses.text: What I say unto you in the darkness, speak ye in the light; and what ye have told  secretly in the ears in closets, let it be proclaimed on the housetops.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:15
verses.text: I say unto you now, my beloved, Be not agitated at those who kill the body, but have no power to  kill the soul.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:16
verses.text: I will inform you whom ye shall fear: him which is able to destroy  soul and body in hell.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:17
verses.text: Yea, I say unto you, Be afraid of him especially.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:18
verses.text: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing in a bond? and one of them shall not fall on the  ground without your Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:19
verses.text: But what concerns you: even the hair of your heads ,  also is numbered.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:20
verses.text: Fear not therefore; ye are better than many sparrows.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:21
verses.text: Every man who confesseth me now before men, I also will confess him before my Father  which is in heaven; but whosoever denieth me before men, I also will deny him before my Father which is in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:22
verses.text: Think ye that I am come to cast peace into the earth? I came not to cast peace,  but to cast dissension.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:23
verses.text: Henceforth there shall be five in one house, three of them  disagreeing with two, and the two with the three.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:24
verses.text: The father shall become hostile to his son, and the son to his father; and the mother to her daughter, and the daughter to her mother; and the mother in law to her daughter in law, and the daughter  in law to her mother in law: and a man's enemies shall be the people of his house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:25
verses.text: Whosoever loveth father or mother better than me is not worthy of me; and whosoever Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:26
verses.text: loveth son or daughter more than his love of me is not worthy of me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:27
verses.text: And every one that doth not take his cross and follow me is not worthy of  me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:28
verses.text: Whosoever findeth his life shall lose it; and whosoever loseth his life for my sake shall find it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:29
verses.text: And whosoever receiveth you receiveth me; and whosoever receiveth me receiveth  him that sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:30
verses.text: And whosoever receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall take a prophet's reward; and whosoever shall receive a righteous man  in the name of a righteous man shall take a righteous man's reward.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:31
verses.text: And every one that shall give to drink to one of these least ones a drink of water only, in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:32
verses.text: And when Jesus finished charging his twelve disciples, he removed thence to  teach and preach in their cities.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:33
verses.text: And while they were going in the way they entered into a certain village; and a woman named Martha entertained him in her house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:34
verses.text: And she had a sister named Mary, and she came and sat at the feet of our Lord,  and heard his sayings.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:35
verses.text: But Martha was disquieted by much serving; and she came and said unto him, My Lord, givest thou no heed that my sister left me alone to  serve? speak to her that she help me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:36
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto her, Martha,  Martha, thou art solicitous and impatient on account of many things: but what is sought is one thing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:37
verses.text: But Mary hath chosen for herself a good portion, and that which shall not be taken from her.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:38
verses.text: And the apostles went forth, and preached to the people that they might repent.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:39
verses.text: And they cast out many devils, and anointed many sick with oil, and healed them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:40
verses.text: ,  And the disciples of John told him of all these things.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:41
verses.text: And when John heard in Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:42
verses.text: the prison of the doings of the Messiah, he called two of his disciples, and sent them to Jesus, and said, Art thou he that cometh, or look we for  another? And they came to Jesus, and said unto him, John the Baptist hath sent  us unto thee, and said, Art thou he that cometh, or look we for another? And in that hour he cured many of diseases, and of plagues of an evil spirit; and he gave sight  to many blind.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:43
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and tell John everything ye have seen and heard: the blind see, and the lame walk, and the lepers are cleansed, and the blind hear, and the dead rise, and the poor have the gospel preached to  them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:44
verses.text: And blessed is he who doubteth not in me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:45
verses.text: And when John's disciples departed, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to see? a reed shaken with the  winds? And if not, then what went ye out to see? a man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they that are in magnificent garments and in voluptuousness are in the abode  of kings.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:46
verses.text: And if not, then what went ye out to see? a prophet? Yea, I say unto  you, and more than a prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 14:47
verses.text: This is he of whom it is written,  I am sending my messenger before thy face  To prepare the way before thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:1
verses.text: Section XIV.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:2
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, There hath not arisen among those whom women have borne a greater than John the Baptist; but he that is little now in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:3
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:4
verses.text: And all the people which heard, and the publicans, justified God, for  they had been baptized with the baptism of John.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:5
verses.text: But the Pharisees and the scribes wronged the purpose of God in themselves, in that they were not baptized of  him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:6
verses.text: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven is  snatched away by violence.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:7
verses.text: The law and the prophets were until John; and after that, the kingdom of God is preached, and all press to enter it: and they that exert themselves ,  snatch it away.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:8
verses.text: All the prophets and the law until John prophesied.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:9
verses.text: And if ye  will, then receive it, that he is Elijah, which is to come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:10
verses.text: Whosoever hath ears that hear  let him hear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:11
verses.text: Easier is the perishing of heaven and earth, than the passing away of  one point of the law.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:12
verses.text: To whom then shall I liken the people of this generation, and  to whom are they like? They are like the children sitting in the market, which call to their companions, and say, We sang to you, and ye danced not; we wailed to you,  and ye wept not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:13
verses.text: John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine;  and ye said, He hath demons: and the Son of man came eating and drinking; and ye said, Behold, a gluttonous man, and a drinker of wine, and an associate of publicans ,  and sinners! And wisdom was justified of all her children.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:14
verses.text: And when he said that, they came to the house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:15
verses.text: And there gathered unto him again multitudes,  so that they found not bread to eat.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:16
verses.text: And while he was casting out a devil which was dumb, when he cast out that devil, that dumb man spake.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:17
verses.text: And the multitudes  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:18
verses.text: marvelled.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:19
verses.text: And the Pharisees, when they heard, said, This man doth not cast out the devils, except by Beelzebul the chief of the demons, which is in him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:20
verses.text: ,  And others requested of him a sign from heaven, to tempt him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:21
verses.text: And Jesus knew their thoughts, and said unto them in parables, Every kingdom that withstandeth itself shall become desolate; and every house or city that disagreeth with itself shall not  stand: and if a devil cast out a devil, he withstandeth himself; neither shall he be  able to stand, but his end shall be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:22
verses.text: Then how now shall his kingdom stand? for ye  said that I cast out devils by Beelzebul.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:23
verses.text: And if I by Beelzebul cast out the devils, then your children, by what do they cast them out? And for this cause they shall  be judges against you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:24
verses.text: But if I by the Spirit of God cast out devils, then the kingdom  of God is come near unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:25
verses.text: Or how can a man enter into the house of a valiant man, and seize his garments, if he do not beforehand secure himself from  that valiant man? and then will he cut off his house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:26
verses.text: But when the valiant man is  armed, guarding his house, his possessions are in peace.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:27
verses.text: But if one come who is more valiant than he, he overcometh him, and taketh his whole armour, on which  he relieth, and divideth his spoil.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:28
verses.text: Whosoever is not with me is against me; and  whosoever gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:29
verses.text: For this reason I say unto you, Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:30
verses.text: that all sins and blasphemies with which men blaspheme shall be forgiven  them: but whosoever shall blaspheme against the Holy Spirit, there is no  forgiveness for him for ever, but he is deserving of eternal punishment: because they  said that he had an unclean spirit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:31
verses.text: And he said also, Every one that speaketh a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him; but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Spirit, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, nor in the world to  come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:32
verses.text: Either ye must make a good tree and its fruit good; or ye must make an evil  tree and its fruit evil: for the tree is known by its fruit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:33
verses.text: Ye children of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? from the overflowings of the heart the mouth  speaketh.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:34
verses.text: The good man from the good treasures which are in his heart bringeth forth good things; and the wicked man from the evil treasures which are in his  heart bringeth forth evils.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:35
verses.text: I say unto you, that every idle word which men shall  speak, they shall give an answer for in the day of judgement: for by thy sayings thou shalt be justified, and by thy sayings thou shalt be judged.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:36
verses.text: And he said to the multitudes, When ye see the clouds appear from the west,  straightway ye say that there cometh rain; and so it cometh to pass.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:37
verses.text: And when  the south wind bloweth, ye say that there will be heat; and it cometh to pass.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:38
verses.text: And when the evening is come, ye say, It will be fair weather, for the heaven has become  red.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:39
verses.text: And in the morning ye say, To-day there will be severe weather, for the redness Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:40
verses.text: of the heaven is paling.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:41
verses.text: Ye hypocrites, ye know to examine the face of the heaven and the earth; but the signs of this time ye know not to discern.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:42
verses.text: Then they brought to him one possessed of a demon, dumb and blind; and he  healed him, so that the dumb and blind began to speak and see.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:43
verses.text: And all the multitudes wondered, and said, Is this, think you, the son of David?   And the apostles returned unto Jesus, and told him everything that they had  done and wrought.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:44
verses.text: And he said unto them, Come, let us go into the desert alone, and rest ye a little.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:45
verses.text: And many were going and returning, and they had not leisure, not even to eat bread.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:46
verses.text: And after that, there came to him one of the Pharisees, and besought him that he would eat bread with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:47
verses.text: And he entered into the house of that Pharisee, and  reclined.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:48
verses.text: And there was in that city a woman that was a sinner; and when she knew that he was sitting in the house of that Pharisee, she took a box of sweet ointment,  and stood behind him, towards his feet, weeping, and began to wet his feet with her tears, and to wipe them with the hair of her head, and to kiss his feet, and  anoint them with the sweet ointment.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 15:49
verses.text: And when that Pharisee saw it, who invited him, he thought within himself, and said, This man, if he were a prophet, would know who she is and what is her history: for the woman which touched him was a sinner.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:1
verses.text: Section XV.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:2
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Simon, I have something to say unto thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:3
verses.text: And  he said unto him, Say on, my Master.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:4
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, There were two debtors Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:5
verses.text: to one creditor; and one of them owed five hundred pence, and the other  owed fifty pence.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:6
verses.text: And because they had not wherewith to pay, he forgave  them both.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:7
verses.text: Which of them ought to love him more? Simon answered and said, I suppose, he to whom he forgave most.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:8
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Thou hast judged rightly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:9
verses.text: And he turned to that woman, and said to Simon, Dost thou see this woman? I entered into thy dwelling, and thou gavest me not water to wash my feet: but this  woman hath bathed my feet with her tears, and dried them with her hair.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:10
verses.text: And thou kissedst me not: but this woman, since she entered, hath not ceased to kiss my  feet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:11
verses.text: And thou anointedst not my head with oil: but this woman hath anointed  my feet with sweet ointment.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:12
verses.text: And for this, I say unto thee, Her many sins are forgiven her, because she loved much; for he to whom little is forgiven loveth little.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:13
verses.text: ,  And he said unto that woman, Thy sins are forgiven thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:14
verses.text: And those that were invited  began to say within themselves, Who is this that forgiveth sins also? And Jesus said to that woman, Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:15
verses.text: And many believed in him when they saw the signs which he was doing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:16
verses.text: ,  But Jesus did not trust himself to them, for he knew every man, and he needed not any man to testify to him concerning every man; for he knew what was in man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:17
verses.text: And after that, Jesus set apart from his disciples other seventy, and sent them two and two before his face to every region and city whither he was purposing to  go.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:18
verses.text: And he said unto them, The harvest is abundant, and the labourers are few:  entreat now the Lord of the harvest, that he send forth labourers into his harvest.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:19
verses.text: Go  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:20
verses.text: ye: and lo, I am sending you as lambs among wolves.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:21
verses.text: Take not with you  purses, nor a wallet, nor shoes; neither salute any man in the way.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:22
verses.text: And  whatsoever house ye enter, first salute that house: and if there be there a son of peace,  let your peace rest upon him; but if there be not, your peace shall return to you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:23
verses.text: And be ye in that house eating and drinking what they have: for the labourer is worthy of  his hire.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:24
verses.text: And remove not from house to house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:25
verses.text: And into whatsoever city ye enter,  and they receive you, eat what is presented to you: and heal the sick that are  therein, and say unto them, The kingdom of God is come near unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:26
verses.text: But whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you not, go out into the market, and say,  Even the dust that clave to our feet from your city, we shake off against you; but  know this, that the kingdom of God is come near unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:27
verses.text: I say unto you, that for Sodom there shall be quiet in the day of judgement, but there shall not be for  that city.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:28
verses.text: Then began Jesus to rebuke the cities in which there had been many  mighty works, and they repented not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:29
verses.text: And he said, Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! if there had been in Tyre and Sidon the signs which were in  thee, it may be that they would have repented in sackcloth and ashes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:30
verses.text: Howbeit I say unto you, that for Tyre and Sidon there shall be rest in the day of judgement,  more than for you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:31
verses.text: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt sink down unto Hades; for if there had been in Sodom the wonders which were  in thee, it would have remained until this day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:32
verses.text: And now I say unto thee, that for the land of Sodom there shall be quiet in the day of judgement, more than for thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:33
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:34
verses.text: And he said again unto his apostles, Whosoever heareth you heareth me; and whosoever heareth me heareth him that sent me: and whosoever wrongeth you wrongeth me; and whosoever wrongeth me wrongeth him that sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:35
verses.text: And those seventy returned with great joy, and said unto him, Our Lord, even  the devils also are subject unto us in thy name.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:36
verses.text: He said unto them, I beheld  Satan fallen like lightning from heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:37
verses.text: Behold, I am giving you authority to tread upon serpents and scorpions, and the whole race of the enemy; and nothing shall  hurt you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:38
verses.text: Only ye must not rejoice that the devils are subject unto you; but be glad that your names are written in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:39
verses.text: And in that hour Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit, and said, I acknowledge thee, my Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou didst hide these things from the wise and understanding, and didst reveal them unto children: yea, my Father; so  was thy will.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:40
verses.text: And he turned to his disciples, and said unto them, Everything hath been delivered to me of my Father: and no man knoweth who the Son is, save the Father; and who the Father is, save the Son, and to whomsoever the Son willeth  to reveal him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:41
verses.text: Come unto me, all of you, ye that are wearied and bearers of burdens,  and I will give you rest.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:42
verses.text: Bear my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I  am gentle and lowly in my heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:43
verses.text: For my yoke is pleasant, and my burden is light.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:44
verses.text: And while great multitudes were going with him, he turned, and said unto them,  Whosoever cometh unto me, and hateth not his father, and his mother, and his brethren, and his sisters, and his wife, and his children, and himself also, cannot  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:45
verses.text: be a disciple to me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:46
verses.text: And whosoever doth not take his cross, and follow  me, cannot be a disciple to me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:47
verses.text: Which of you desireth to build a tower, and doth not sit down first and reckon his expenses and whether he hath enough to  complete it? lest when he hath laid the foundations, and is not able to finish, all that  behold him laugh at him, and say, This man began to build, and was not able to  finish.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:48
verses.text: Or what king goeth to the battle to fight with another king, and doth not consider first whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh to him  with twenty thousand? And if he is not able, he sendeth unto him while he is afar  off, and seeketh peace.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 16:49
verses.text: So shall every man of you consider, that desireth to be a disciple to me; for if he renounceth not all that he hath, he cannot be a disciple to me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:1
verses.text: Section XVI.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:2
verses.text: Then answered certain of the scribes and Pharisees, that they might tempt him,  and said, Teacher, we desire to see a sign from thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:3
verses.text: He answered and said, This evil and adulterous generation seeketh a sign; and it shall not be given a sign,  except the sign of Jonah the prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:4
verses.text: And as Jonah was a sign to the inhabitants  of Nineveh, so shall the Son of man also be to this generation.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:5
verses.text: And as Jonah was in the belly of the great fish three days and three nights, so shall the Son of man  be in the heart of the earth three days and three nights.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:6
verses.text: The queen of the south shall rise in the judgement with the people of this generation, and condemn them: for she came from the ends of the earth that she might hear the wisdom of Solomon;  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:7
verses.text: and behold, here is a better than Solomon.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:8
verses.text: The men of Nineveh shall stand in the judgement with this generation, and condemn it: for they repented at  the preaching of Jonah; and behold, here is a greater than Jonah.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:9
verses.text: The unclean spirit, when he goeth out of the man, departeth, and goeth about through places wherein are no waters, that he may find rest for himself; and when he findeth it not, he  saith, I will return to my house whence I came out.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:10
verses.text: And if he come and find it  adorned and set in order, then he goeth, and associateth with himself seven other spirits worse than himself; and they enter and dwell in it: and the end of that man  shall be worse than his beginning.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:11
verses.text: Thus shall it be unto this evil generation.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:12
verses.text: And while he was saying that, a woman from the multitude lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed is the womb that bare thee, and the breasts that nursed  thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:13
verses.text: But he said unto her, Blessed is he that heareth the word of God, and keepeth it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:14
verses.text: And while he was speaking unto the multitude, there came unto him his mother  and his brethren, and sought to speak with him; and they were not able, because of  the multitude; and they stood without and sent, calling him unto them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:15
verses.text: A man said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren are standing without, and seek to  speak with thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:16
verses.text: But he answered unto him that spake unto him, Who is my  mother? and who are my brethren? And he beckoned with his hand, stretching it out towards his disciples, and said, Behold, my mother! and behold, my brethren!  And every man that shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven is my brother, and my sister, and my mother.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:17
verses.text: And after that, Jesus was going about in the cities and in the villages, and proclaiming Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:18
verses.text: and preaching the kingdom of God, and his twelve with him,  and the women which had been healed of diseases and of evil spirits, Mary  that was called Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven devils, and Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod's steward, and Susanna, and many others, who were ministering to them of their substance.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:19
verses.text: And after that, Jesus went out of the house, and sat on the sea shore.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:20
verses.text: And there  gathered unto him great multitudes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:21
verses.text: And when the press of the people was great upon him, he went up and sat in the boat; and all the multitude was standing on the  shore of the sea.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:22
verses.text: And he spake to them much in parables, and said, The sower  went forth to sow: and when he sowed, some fell on the beaten highway; and it was  trodden upon, and the birds ate it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:23
verses.text: And other fell on the rocks: and some, where there was not much earth; and straightway it sprang up, because it had no depth in  the earth: and when the sun rose, it withered; and because it had no root, it dried  up.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:24
verses.text: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up with it, and choked it;  and it yielded no fruit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:25
verses.text: And other fell into excellent and good ground; and it came up, and grew, and brought forth fruit, some thirty, and some sixty, and some  a hundred.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:26
verses.text: And when he said that, he cried, He that hath ears that hear, let him  hear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:27
verses.text: And when they were alone, his disciples came, and asked him, and said unto  him, What is this parable? and why spakest thou unto them in parables? He Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:28
verses.text: answered and said unto them, Unto you is given the knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of God; but it is not given unto them that are  without.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:29
verses.text: He that hath shall be given unto, and there shall be added; and he that  hath not, that which he hath shall be taken from him also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:30
verses.text: For this cause therefore I speak unto them in parables; because they see, and see not; and hear, and hear  not, nor understand.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:31
verses.text: And in them is being fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah, who said,  Hearing they shall hear, and shall not understand;  And seeing they shall see, and shall not perceive:   The heart of this people is waxed gross,  And their hearing with their ears is become heavy,  And they have closed their eyes;  Lest they should see with their eyes,  And hear with their ears,  And understand with their hearts,  And should return,  And I should heal them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:32
verses.text: ,  But ye, blessed are your eyes, which see; and your ears, which hear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:33
verses.text: Blessed  are the eyes which see what ye see.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:34
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Many of the prophets and the righteous longed to see what ye see, and saw not; and to hear what ye  hear, and heard not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:35
verses.text: When ye know not this parable, how shall ye know all parables? ,  Hear ye the parable of the sower.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:36
verses.text: The sower which sowed, sowed the word  of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:37
verses.text: Every one who heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandeth it not, the evil one cometh and snatcheth away the word that hath been sown in his  heart: and this is that which was sown on the middle of the highway.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:38
verses.text: But that which was sown on the rocks is he that heareth the word, and straightway receiveth ,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:39
verses.text: it with joy; only, it hath no root in his soul, but his belief in it is for a time; and whenever there is distress or persecution because of a word, he  stumbleth quickly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:40
verses.text: And that which was sown among the thorns is he that heareth the word; and the care of this world, and the error of riches, and the rest of the  other lusts enter, and choke the word, and it becometh without fruit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:41
verses.text: And that which was sown in good ground is he that heareth my word in a pure and good heart, and understandeth it, and holdeth to it, and bringeth forth fruit with patience, and produceth either a hundredfold or sixtyfold or thirty.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:42
verses.text: And he said, So is the kingdom of God, like a man who casteth seed into the  earth, and sleepeth and riseth by night and day, and the seed groweth and cometh  up, whence he knoweth not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 17:43
verses.text: And the earth bringeth it to the fruit; and first it  will be blade, and after it ear, and at last perfect wheat in the ear: and whenever the fruit ripeneth, he bringeth immediately the sickle, for the harvest hath come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:1
verses.text: Section XVII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:2
verses.text: And he set forth to them another parable, and said, The kingdom of heaven is  like a man who sowed good seed in his field; but when men slept, his enemy came  and sowed tares among the wheat, and went away.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:3
verses.text: And when the blade sprang up  and brought forth fruit, there were noticed the tares also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:4
verses.text: And the servants of the master of the house came, and said unto him, Our lord, didst thou not sow good  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:5
verses.text: seed in thy field? whence are there tares in it? He said unto them, An enemy hath done this.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:6
verses.text: His servants said unto him, Wilt thou that we go  and separate it? He said unto them, Perhaps, when ye separate the tares, ye would  root up with them wheat also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:7
verses.text: Leave them to grow both together until the harvest: and in the time of the harvest I will say unto the reapers, Separate the tares first, and bind them in bundles to be burned with fire; and gather the wheat into my barns.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:8
verses.text: ,  And he set forth to them another parable, and said, To what is the kingdom of  God like? and to what shall I liken it? and in what parable shall I set it forth? It  is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and planted in his field: and of the number of the things that are sown in the earth it is smaller than all of the things  which are sown, which are upon the earth; but when it is grown, it is greater than all the herbs, and produceth large branches, so that the birds of heaven make their nests in its branches.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:9
verses.text: ,  And he set forth to them another parable: To what shall I liken the kingdom of  God? It is like the leaven which a woman took, and kneaded into three measures of flour, until the whole of it was leavened.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:10
verses.text: And Jesus spake all that to the multitudes by way of parables, according as they  were able to hear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:11
verses.text: And without parables spake he not unto them; that the saying of the Lord through the prophet might be fulfilled:  I will open my mouth in parables;  And I will utter secrets which were before the foundations of the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:12
verses.text: But he explained to his disciples privately everything.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:13
verses.text: Then Jesus left the multitudes, and came to the house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:14
verses.text: And his disciples came unto him, and said unto him, Explain unto us that parable about the tares  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:15
verses.text: and the field.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:16
verses.text: He answered and said unto them, He that sowed good seed is  the Son of man; and the field is the world; and the good seed are the children of the  kingdom; and the tares are the children of the evil one; and the enemy that sowed them is Satan; and the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:17
verses.text: And as the tares are separated and burned in the fire, so shall it be in the end of  this world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:18
verses.text: The Son of man shall send his angels, and separate from his kingdom  all things that injure, and all the doers of iniquity, and they shall cast them into the  furnace of fire: and there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:19
verses.text: Then the righteous shall shine as the sun in the kingdom of their Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:20
verses.text: Whosoever hath ears that hear, let him hear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:21
verses.text: And again the kingdom of heaven is like treasure hid in a field: that which a man found and hid; and, for his pleasure in it, went and sold all that he had, and bought that field.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:22
verses.text: And again the kingdom of heaven is like a man that is a merchant seeking excellent  pearls; and when he found one pearl of great price, he went and sold everything that he had, and bought it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:23
verses.text: And again the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was cast into the sea, and  gathered of every kind: and when it was filled, they drew it up on to the shore of the sea, and sat down to select; and the good of them they threw into the vessels,  and the bad they threw outside.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:24
verses.text: Thus shall it be in the end of the world: the angels  shall go forth, and separate the wicked from among the good, and shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:25
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Have ye understood all these things? They said unto  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:26
verses.text: him, Yea, our Lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:27
verses.text: He said unto them, Therefore every scribe that becometh a disciple of the kingdom of heaven is like a man that is a householder, who bringeth out of his treasures the new and the old.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:28
verses.text: ,  And when Jesus had finished all these parables, he removed thence, and came to his city; and he taught them in their synagogues, so that they were perplexed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:29
verses.text: And when the sabbath came, Jesus began to teach in the synagogue; and many of  those that heard marvelled, and said, Whence came these things to this man? And many envied him and gave no heed to him, but said, What is this wisdom that is given to this man, that there should happen at his hands such as these mighty works?  Is not this a carpenter, son of a carpenter? and is not his mother called Mary? and  his brethren, James, and Joses, and Simon, and Judas? And his sisters, all of them,  lo, are they not all with us? Whence hath this man all these things? And they were in doubt concerning him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:30
verses.text: And Jesus knew their opinion, and said unto them, Will ye haply say unto me this proverb, Physician, heal first thyself: and all that  we have heard that thou didst in Capernaum, do here also in thine own city? And he said, Verily I say unto you, A prophet is not received in his own city, nor among  his brethren: for a prophet is not despised, save in his own city, and among his own  kin, and in his own house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:31
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, In the days of Elijah the prophet, there were many widows among the children of Israel, when the heaven held back  three years and six months, and there was a great famine in all the land; and Elijah Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:32
verses.text: was not sent to one of them, save to Zarephath of Sidon, to a woman that was  a widow.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:33
verses.text: And many lepers were among the children of Israel in the days of Elisha the prophet; but not one of them was cleansed, save Naaman the Nabathaean.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:34
verses.text: And he was not able to do there many mighty works, because of their unbelief;  except that he laid his hand upon a few of the sick, and healed them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:35
verses.text: And he marvelled  at their lack of faith.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:36
verses.text: And when those who were in the synagogue heard,  they were all filled with wrath; and they rose up, and brought him forth outside the city, and brought him to the brow of the hill upon which their city was built, that  they might cast him from its summit: but he passed through among them and went away.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 18:37
verses.text: And he went about in the villages which were around Nazareth, and taught in their synagogues.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:1
verses.text: Section XVIII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:2
verses.text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus, and all the things which came to pass at his hand; and he marvelled, for he had obtained excellent  information concerning him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:3
verses.text: And some men said that John the Baptist was risen  from among the dead; and others said that Elijah had appeared; and others, Jeremiah;  and others, that a prophet of the old prophets was risen; and others said that he  was a prophet like one of the prophets.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:4
verses.text: Herod said to his servants, This is John the Baptist, he whom I beheaded; he is risen from among the dead: therefore mighty  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:5
verses.text: works result from him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:6
verses.text: For Herod himself had sent and taken John, and cast him into prison, for the sake of Herodias his brother Philip's wife, whom he  had taken.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:7
verses.text: And John said to Herod, Thou hast no authority to take the wife of thy  brother.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:8
verses.text: And Herodias avoided him and wished to kill him; and she could not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:9
verses.text: But Herod feared John, for he knew that he was a righteous man and a holy; and  he guarded him, and heard him much, and did, and obeyed him with gladness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:10
verses.text: And he wished to kill him; but he feared the people, for they adhered to him as the  prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:11
verses.text: And there was a celebrated day, and Herod had made a feast for his great men on the day of his anniversary, and for the officers and for the chief men  of Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:12
verses.text: And the daughter of Herodias came in and danced in the midst of the company, and pleased Herod and those that sat with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:13
verses.text: And the king said to the  damsel, Ask of me what thou wilt, and I will give it thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:14
verses.text: And he sware unto her,  Whatsoever thou shalt ask, I will give it thee, to the half of my kingdom.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:15
verses.text: And she went out, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask him? She said unto her, The  head of John the Baptist.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:16
verses.text: And immediately she came in hastily to the king, and said unto him, I desire in this hour that thou give me on a dish the head of John  the Baptist.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:17
verses.text: And the king was exceeding sorry; but because of the oath and the  guests he did not wish to refuse her.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:18
verses.text: But immediately the king sent an executioner, and commanded that he should bring the head of John: and he went and cut off  the head of John in the prison, and brought it on a dish, and delivered it to the  damsel; and the damsel gave it to her mother.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:19
verses.text: And his disciples heard, and came Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:20
verses.text: and took his body, and buried it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:21
verses.text: And they came and told Jesus what  had happened.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:22
verses.text: And for this cause Herod said, I beheaded John: who  is this, of whom I hear these things.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:23
verses.text: And he desired to see him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:24
verses.text: And Jesus, when he heard, removed thence in a boat to a waste place alone, to the other side of the sea of the Galilee of Tiberias.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:25
verses.text: And many saw them going, and knew them, and hastened by land from all the cities, and came thither beforehand; for they saw the signs which he was doing on the ,  sick.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:26
verses.text: And Jesus went up into the mountain, and sat there with his disciples.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:27
verses.text: And  the feast of the passover of the Jews was near.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:28
verses.text: And Jesus lifted up his eyes, and saw great multitudes coming to him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:29
verses.text: And he was moved with compassion for them, for  they were like sheep that were without a shepherd.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:30
verses.text: And he received them, and spake to them concerning the kingdom of God, and healed those who had need of healing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:31
verses.text: And when the evening approached, his disciples came to him, and said unto  him, The place is desert, and the time is past; send away the multitudes of the people, that they may go to the towns and villages which are around us, and buy for  themselves bread; for they have nothing to eat.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:32
verses.text: But he said unto them, They have  no need to go away; give ye them what may be eaten.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:33
verses.text: They said unto him, We have not here enough.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:34
verses.text: He said unto Philip, Whence shall we buy bread that these may eat? ,  And he said that proving him; and he knew what he was resolved to do.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:35
verses.text: Philip said Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:36
verses.text: unto him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread would not suffice them after  every one of them hath taken a small amount.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:37
verses.text: One of his disciples said unto  him (namely, Andrew the brother of Simon Cephas), Here is a lad having five loaves  of barley and two fishes: but this amount, what is it for all these? But wilt thou that we go and buy for all the people what may be eaten? for we have no more  than these five loaves and the two fishes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:38
verses.text: And the grass was plentiful in that place.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:39
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Arrange all the people that they may sit down on the grass,  fifty people in a company.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:40
verses.text: And the disciples did so.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:41
verses.text: And all the people sat down  by companies, by hundreds and fifties.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:42
verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, Bring hither  those five loaves and the two fishes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:43
verses.text: And when they brought him that, Jesus took the bread and the fish, and looked to heaven, and blessed, and divided, and gave to  his disciples to set before them; and the disciples set for the multitudes the bread  and the fish; and they ate, all of them, and were satisfied.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:44
verses.text: And when they were satisfied, he said unto his disciples, Gather the fragments that remain over, that nothing  be lost.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:45
verses.text: And they gathered, and filled twelve baskets with fragments, being those that remained over from those which ate of the five barley loaves and the two  fishes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:46
verses.text: And those people who ate were five thousand, besides the women and children.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:47
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:48
verses.text: And straightway he pressed his disciples to go up into the ship, and that they should go before him unto the other side to Bethsaida, while he  himself should send away the multitudes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:49
verses.text: And those people who saw the sign which  Jesus did, said, Of a truth this is a prophet who hath come into the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:50
verses.text: And Jesus knew their purpose to come and take him, and make him a king; and he left them, and went up into the mountain alone for prayer.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:51
verses.text: ,  And when the nightfall was near, his disciples went down unto the sea, and sat in a boat, and came to the side of Capernaum.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:52
verses.text: And the darkness came on, and Jesus  had not come to them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:53
verses.text: And the sea was stirred up against them by reason of a violent  wind that blew.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 19:54
verses.text: And the boat was distant from the land many furlongs, and they were much damaged by the waves, and the wind was against them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:1
verses.text: Section XIX.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:2
verses.text: And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus came unto them, walking upon the  water, after they had rowed with difficulty about twenty-five or thirty furlongs.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:3
verses.text: And when he drew near unto their boat, his disciples saw him walking on the water; and they were troubled, and supposed that it was a false appearance; and they cried  out from their fear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:4
verses.text: But Jesus straightway spoke unto them, and said, Take courage,  for it is I; fear not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:5
verses.text: Then Cephas answered and said unto him, My Lord, if it be thou,  bid me to come unto thee on the water.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:6
verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, Come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:7
