verses.text: And  Cephas went down out of the boat, and walked on the water to come unto Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:8
verses.text: But Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:9
verses.text: when he saw the wind strong, he feared, and was on the point of sinking;  and he lifted up his voice, and said, My Lord, save me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:10
verses.text: And immediately our Lord stretched out his hand and took hold of him, and said unto him,  Thou of little faith, why didst thou doubt? And when Jesus came near, he went up  unto them into the boat, he and Simon, and immediately the wind ceased.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:11
verses.text: And those that were in the ship came and worshipped him, and said, Truly thou art the  Son of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:12
verses.text: And straightway that ship arrived at the land which they made for.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:13
verses.text: And when they came out of the ship to the land, they marvelled greatly and were  perplexed in themselves: and they had not understood by means of that bread, because their heart was gross.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:14
verses.text: And when the people of that region knew of the arrival of Jesus, they made haste in all that land, and began to bring those that were diseased, borne in their  beds to the place where they heard that he was.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:15
verses.text: And wheresoever the place might be which he entered, of the villages or the cities, they laid the sick in the markets, and sought of him that they might touch were it only the edge of his garment: and all that touched him were healed and lived.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:16
verses.text: And on the day after that, the multitude which was standing on the shore of the sea saw that there was there no other ship save that into which the disciples had  gone up, and that Jesus went not up into the ship with his disciples (but there were other ships from Tiberias near the place where they ate the bread when Jesus blessed  it): and when that multitude saw that Jesus was not there, nor yet his disciples, they  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:17
verses.text: went up into those ships, and came to Capernaum, and sought Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:18
verses.text: And when they found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Our  Master, when camest thou hither? Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye have not sought me because of your seeing the signs, but because of  your eating the bread and being satisfied.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:19
verses.text: Serve not the food which perisheth, but the food which abideth in eternal life, which the Son of man will give unto you: him  hath God the Father sealed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:20
verses.text: They said unto him, What shall we do that we may  work the work of God? Jesus answered and said unto them, This is the work of  God, that ye believe in him whom he hath sent.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:21
verses.text: They said unto him, What sign hast thou done, that we may see, and believe in thee? what hast thou wrought?  Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness; as it was written, Bread from heaven  gave he them to eat.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:22
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Moses gave you not bread from  heaven; but my Father gave you the bread of truth from heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:23
verses.text: The bread of God is that which came down from heaven and gave the ,  world life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:24
verses.text: They said unto him, Our Lord, give us at all times this bread.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:25
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life: whosoever cometh unto me shall not hunger,  and whosoever believeth in me shall not thirst for ever.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:26
verses.text: But I said unto you,  Ye have seen me, and have not believed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:27
verses.text: And all that my Father hath given to me cometh unto me; and whosoever cometh unto me I shall not cast him forth without.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:28
verses.text: I came down from heaven, not to do my own will, but to do the will of him  that sent me; and this is the will of him that sent me, that I should lose nothing of  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:29
verses.text: that which he gave me, but raise it up in the last day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:30
verses.text: This is the will of my Father, that every one that seeth the Son, and believeth in him, should have eternal life; and I will raise him up in the last day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:31
verses.text: The Jews therefore murmured against him because of his saying, I am the bread  which came down from heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:32
verses.text: And they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? then how saith this man, I came down from ,  heaven? Jesus answered and said unto them, Murmur not one with another.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:33
verses.text: No man is able to come unto me, except the Father which sent me draw him; and I will  raise him up in the last day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:34
verses.text: It is written in the prophet, They shall all be the taught of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:35
verses.text: Every one who heareth from the Father now, and learneth of him, cometh  unto me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:36
verses.text: No man now seeth the Father; but he that is from God, he it is that seeth  the Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:37
verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever believeth in me hath eternal ,  life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:38
verses.text: I am the bread of life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:39
verses.text: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and  they died.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:40
verses.text: This is the bread which came down from heaven, that a man may eat  of it, and not die.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:41
verses.text: I am the bread of life which came down from heaven: and if a man eat of this bread he shall live for ever: and the bread which I shall give is my body, which I give for the life of the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:42
verses.text: The Jews therefore quarrelled one with another, and said, How can he give us  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:43
verses.text: his body that we may eat it? Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, If ye do not eat the body of the Son of man and drink his blood, ye shall  not have life in yourselves.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:44
verses.text: Whosoever eateth of my body and drinketh of my blood  hath eternal life; and I will raise him up in the last day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:45
verses.text: My body truly is meat, and  my blood truly is drink.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:46
verses.text: Whosoever eateth my body and drinketh my blood abideth  in me, and I in himâ€”as the living Father sent me, and I am alive because of the  Father; and whosoever eateth me, he also shall live because of me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:47
verses.text: This is the bread which came down from heaven: and not according as your fathers ate the  manna, and died: whosoever eateth of this bread shall live for ever.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:48
verses.text: This he said in  the synagogue, when he was teaching in Capernaum.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 20:49
verses.text: And many of his disciples, when they heard, said, This word is hard; who is he that can hear it?.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:1
verses.text: Section XX.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:2
verses.text: And Jesus knew within himself that his disciples were murmuring because of  that, and he said unto them, Doth this trouble you? What if ye should see the Son  of man then ascend to the place where he was of old? It is the spirit that quickeneth, and the body profiteth nothing: the words that I speak unto you are spirit  and life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:3
verses.text: But there are some of you that do not believe.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:4
verses.text: And Jesus knew beforehand who they were who should not believe, and who it was that should betray  him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:5
verses.text: And he said unto them, Therefore I said unto you, No man can come unto me, if that hath not been given him by the Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:6
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:7
verses.text: And because of this word many of his disciples turned back and walked  not with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:8
verses.text: And Jesus said unto the twelve, Do ye haply also wish to  go away? Simon Cephas answered and said, My Lord, to whom shall we go? thou  hast the words of eternal life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:9
verses.text: And we have believed and known that thou art the  Messiah, the Son of the living God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:10
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Did not I choose you,  ye company of the twelve, and of you one is a devil? He said that because of Judas the son of Simon Iscariot; for he, being of the twelve, was purposed to betray him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:11
verses.text: And while he was speaking, one of the Pharisees came asking of him that he  would eat with him: and he went in, and reclined to meat.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:12
verses.text: And that Pharisee, when  he saw it, marvelled that he had not first cleansed himself before his eating.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:13
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Now do ye Pharisees wash the outside of the cup and the dish, and ye think that ye are cleansed; but your inside is full of injustice and wickedness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:14
verses.text: ,  Ye of little mind, did not he that made the outside make the inside? Now give what ye have in alms, and everything shall be clean unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:15
verses.text: ,  And there came to him Pharisees and scribes, come from Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:16
verses.text: And when they saw some of his disciples eating bread while they had not washed their hands,  they found fault.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:17
verses.text: For all of the Jews and the Pharisees, if they wash not their  hands thoroughly, eat not; for they held to the ordinance of the elders.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:18
verses.text: And they ate not what was bought from the market, except they washed it; and many other things did they keep of what they had received, such as the washing of cups, and  measures, and vessels of brass, and couches.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:19
verses.text: And scribes and Pharisees asked him, Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:20
verses.text: Why do thy disciples not walk according to the ordinances of the elders, but  eat bread without washing their hands? Jesus answered and said unto them, Why do ye also overstep the command of God by reason of your ordinance?  God said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, Whosoever revileth his father and  his mother shall surely die.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:21
verses.text: But ye say, If a man say to his father or to his mother,  What thou receivest from me is an offering,â€”and ye suffer him not to do anything  for his father or his mother; and ye make void and reject the word of God by reason of the ordinance that ye have ordained and commanded, such as the washing  of cups and measures, and what resembles that ye do much.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:22
verses.text: And ye forsook  the command of God, and held to the ordinance of men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:23
verses.text: Do ye well to wrong  the command of God in order that ye may establish your ordinance? Ye hypocrites, well did Isaiah the prophet prophesy concerning you, and say,   This people honoureth me with its lips;  But their heart is very far from me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:24
verses.text: But in vain do they fear me,  In that they teach the commands of men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:25
verses.text: And Jesus called all the multitude, and said unto them, Hear me, all of you, and  understand: nothing without the man, which then enters him, is able to defile him;  but what goeth out of him, that it is which defileth the man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:26
verses.text: He that hath ears  that hear, let him hear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:27
verses.text: Then his disciples drew near, and said unto him, Knowest  thou that the Pharisees which heard this word were angry? He answered and said unto them, Every plant which my Father which is in heaven planted not shall be  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:28
verses.text: uprooted.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:29
verses.text: Let them alone; for they are blind leading blind.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:30
verses.text: And if the blind lead the blind, both of them shall fall into a hollow.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:31
verses.text: And when Jesus entered the house from the multitude, Simon Cephas asked him,  and said unto him, My Lord, explain to us that parable.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:32
verses.text: He said unto them, Do ye also thus not understand? Know ye not that everything that entereth into the  man from without cannot defile him; because it entereth not into his heart; it entereth into his stomach only, and thence is cast forth in the cleansing which maketh  clean all the food? The thing which goeth forth from the mouth of the man proceedeth  from his heart, and it is that which defileth the man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:33
verses.text: From within the  heart of men proceed evil thoughts, fornication, adultery, theft, false witness, murder, injustice, wickedness, deceit, stupidity, evil eye, calumny, pride, foolishness:  these evils all of them from within proceed from the heart, and they are the things  which defile the man: but if a man eat while he washeth not his hands, he is not defiled.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:34
verses.text: And Jesus went out thence, and came to the borders of Tyre and Sidon.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:35
verses.text: And he entered into a certain house, and desired that no man should know it; and  he could not be hid.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:36
verses.text: But straightway a Canaanitish woman, whose daughter had an ,  unclean spirit, heard of him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:37
verses.text: And that woman was a Gentile of Emesa of Syria.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:38
verses.text: And she came out after him, crying out, and saying, Have mercy upon me, my Lord, thou  son of David; for my daughter is seized in an evil way by Satan.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:39
verses.text: And he answered Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:40
verses.text: her not a word.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:41
verses.text: And his disciples came and besought him, and said, Send  her away: for she crieth after us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:42
verses.text: He answered and said unto them, I was  not sent except to the sheep that are gone astray of the house of Israel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:43
verses.text: But she came and worshipped him, and said, My Lord, help me, have mercy upon me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:44
verses.text: Jesus said unto her, It is not seemly that the children's bread should be taken and  thrown to the dogs.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:45
verses.text: But she said, Yea, my Lord: the dogs also eat of the crumbs  that fall from their masters' tables, and live.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:46
verses.text: Then said Jesus unto her, O woman,  great is thy faith: it shall be unto thee as thou hast desired.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:47
verses.text: Go then thy way; and  because of this word, the devil is gone out of thy daughter.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:48
verses.text: And her daughter was  healed in that hour.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 21:49
verses.text: And that woman went away to her house, and found her daughter laid upon the bed, and the devil gone out of her.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:1
verses.text: Section XXI.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:2
verses.text: And Jesus went out again from the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and came to the  sea of Galilee, towards the borders of Decapolis.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:3
verses.text: And they brought unto him one dumb and deaf, and entreated him that he would lay his hand upon him and heal  him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:4
verses.text: And he drew him away from the multitude, and went away alone, and spat  upon his fingers, and thrust them into his ears, and touched his tongue; and looked  to heaven, and sighed, and said unto him, Be opened.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:5
verses.text: And in that hour his ears  were opened, and the bond of his tongue was loosed, and he spake with ease.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:6
verses.text: And Jesus charged them much that they should not tell this to any man: but the more  he charged them, the more they increased in publishing, and marvelled much, and Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:7
verses.text: said, This man doeth everything well: he made the deaf to hear, and those that lacked speech to speak.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:8
verses.text: ,  And while he was passing through the land of Samaria, he came to one of the cities of the Samaritans, called Sychar, beside the field which Jacob gave to Joseph to  his son.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:9
verses.text: And there was there a spring of water of Jacob's.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:10
verses.text: And Jesus was fatigued from the exertion of the way, and sat at the spring.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:11
verses.text: And the time was about the  sixth hour.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:12
verses.text: And a woman of Samaria came to draw water; and Jesus said unto  her, Give me water, that I may drink.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:13
verses.text: And his disciples had entered into the city  to buy for themselves food.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:14
verses.text: And that Samaritan woman said unto him, How dost thou, being a Jew, ask me to give thee to drink, while I am a Samaritan woman?  (And the Jews mingle not with the Samaritans.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:15
verses.text: ) Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who this is that said unto thee, Give me  to drink; thou wouldest ask him, and he would give thee the water of life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:16
verses.text: That woman said unto him, My Lord, thou hast no bucket, and the well is deep: from  whence hast thou the water of life? Can it be that thou art greater than our father Jacob, who gave us this well, and drank from it, and his children, and his sheep?  Jesus answered and said unto her, Every one that drinketh of this water shall thirst  again: but whosoever drinketh of the water which I shall give him shall not thirst for ever: but the water which I shall give him shall be in him a spring of water springing  up unto eternal life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:17
verses.text: That woman said unto him, My Lord, give me of this water, that  I may not thirst again, neither come and draw water from here.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:18
verses.text: Jesus said unto her,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:19
verses.text: Go and call thy husband, and come hither.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:20
verses.text: She said unto him, I have no  husband.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:21
verses.text: Jesus said unto her, Thou saidst well, I have no husband: five husbands hast thou had, and this man whom thou hast now is not thy husband; and  in this thou saidst truly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:22
verses.text: That woman said unto him, My Lord, I perceive thee to  be a prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:23
verses.text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say that in Jerusalem  is the place in which worship must be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:24
verses.text: Jesus said unto her, Woman, believe me, an hour cometh, when neither in this mountain, nor yet in Jerusalem, shall ye worship  the Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:25
verses.text: Ye worship that which ye know not: but we worship that which  we know: for salvation is of the Jews.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:26
verses.text: But an hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and truth: and the Father also  seeketh such as these worshippers.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:27
verses.text: For God is a Spirit: and they that worship him  must worship him in spirit and in truth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:28
verses.text: That woman said unto him, I know that  the Messiah cometh: and when he is come, he will teach us everything.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:29
verses.text: Jesus said unto her, I that speak unto thee am he.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:30
verses.text: And while he was speaking, his disciples came; and they wondered how he would speak with a woman; but not one of them said unto him, What seekest thou? or,  What speakest thou with her? And the woman left her waterpot, and went to the  city, and said to the people, Come, and see a man who told me all that ever I did:  perhaps then he is the Messiah.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:31
verses.text: And people went out from the city, and came to  him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:32
verses.text: And in the mean while his disciples besought him, and said unto him, Our ,  master, eat.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:33
verses.text: And he said unto them, I have food to eat that ye know not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:34
verses.text: And the disciples said amongst themselves, Can any one have brought him aught to eat?  Jesus said unto them, My food is to do the will of him that sent me, and to accomplish  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:35
verses.text: his work.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:36
verses.text: Said ye not that after four months cometh the harvest? behold, I therefore say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and behold the lands,  that they have become white, and the harvest is already come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:37
verses.text: And he that reapeth receiveth his wages, and gathereth the fruit of eternal life; and the sower and  the reaper rejoice together.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:38
verses.text: For in this is found the word of truth, One soweth, and  another reapeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:39
verses.text: And I sent you to reap that in which ye have not laboured: others laboured, and ye have entered on their labour.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:40
verses.text: And from that city many of the Samaritans believed in him because of the words  of that woman, who testified and said, He told me all that ever I did.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:41
verses.text: And when those Samaritans came unto him, they besought him to abide with them; and he ,  abode with them two days.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:42
verses.text: And many believed in him because of his word; and they said to that woman, Now not because of thy saying have we believed in him: we have heard and known that this truly is the Messiah, the Saviour of the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:43
verses.text: ,  And after two days Jesus went out thence and departed to Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:44
verses.text: And Jesus  testified that a prophet is not honoured in his own city.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 22:45
verses.text: And when he came to Galilee, the Galilaeans received him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:1
verses.text: Section XXII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:2
verses.text: And when Jesus came to a certain village, there drew near to him a leper, and fell at his feet, and besought him, and said unto him, If thou wilt, thou art able to  cleanse me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:3
verses.text: And Jesus had mercy upon him, and stretched forth his hand, and  touched him, and said, I will cleanse thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:4
verses.text: And immediately his leprosy departed  from him, and he was cleansed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:5
verses.text: And he sternly charged him, and sent him out,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:6
verses.text: and said unto him, See that thou tell not any man: but go and shew thyself to the priests, and offer an offering for thy cleansing as Moses commanded  for their testimony.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:7
verses.text: But he, when he went out, began to publish much, and spread abroad the news, so that Jesus could not enter into any of the cities openly, for the extent to which the report of him spread, but he remained without in a desert  place.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:8
verses.text: And much people came unto him from one place and another, to hear  his word, and that they might be healed of their pains.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:9
verses.text: And he used to withdraw from them into the desert, and pray.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:10
verses.text: And after that, was the feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:11
verses.text: And there was in Jerusalem a place prepared for bathing, which was called in  Hebrew the House of Mercy, having five porches.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:12
verses.text: And there were laid in them much people of the sick, and blind, and lame, and paralysed, waiting for the moving  of the water.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:13
verses.text: And the angel from time to time went down into the place of bathing, and moved the water; and the first that went down after the moving  of the water, every pain that he had was healed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:14
verses.text: And a man was there who had a  disease for thirty-eight years.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:15
verses.text: And Jesus saw this man laid, and knew that he had  been thus a long time; and he said unto him, Wouldest thou be made whole? That diseased one answered and said, Yea, my Lord, I have no man, when the water moveth, to put me into the bathing-place; but when I come, another goeth down before ,  me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:16
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Rise, take thy bed, and walk.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:17
verses.text: And immediately that man was healed; and he rose, and carried his bed, and walked.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:18
verses.text: And that day was a sabbath.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:19
verses.text: And when the Jews saw that healed one, they said  unto him, It is a sabbath: thou hast no authority to carry thy bed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:20
verses.text: And he answered and said unto them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take thy bed,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:21
verses.text: and walk.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:22
verses.text: They asked him therefore, Who is this man that said unto thee,  Take thy bed, and walk? But he that was healed knew not who it was; for Jesus had removed from that place to another, because of the press of the great multitude  which was in that place.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:23
verses.text: And after two days Jesus happened upon him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold, thou art whole: sin not again, lest there come upon  thee what is worse than the first.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:24
verses.text: And that man went, and said to the Jews that it  was Jesus that had healed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:25
verses.text: And because of that the Jews persecuted Jesus and  sought to kill him, because he was doing this on the sabbath.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:26
verses.text: And Jesus said unto  them, My Father worketh until now, and I also work.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:27
verses.text: And because of this especially the Jews sought to kill him, not because he profaned the sabbath only; but for his saying also that God was his Father, and his making himself equal with God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:28
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son cannot do anything of himself, but what he seeth the Father do; what the Father doeth,  that the Son also doeth like him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:29
verses.text: The Father loveth his Son, and everything that he doeth he sheweth him: and more than these works will he shew him, that ye  may marvel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:30
verses.text: And as the Father raiseth the dead and giveth them life, so the Son  also giveth life to whomsoever he will.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:31
verses.text: And the Father judgeth no man, but hath  given all judgement unto the Son; that every man may honour the Son, as he honoureth the Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:32
verses.text: And he that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which  sent him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:33
verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever heareth my word, and believeth in him that sent me, hath eternal life, and cometh not into judgement, but passeth from  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:34
verses.text: death unto life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:35
verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, An hour shall come, and now is also, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God; and those  which hear shall live.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:36
verses.text: And as the Father hath life in himself, likewise he gave to  the Son also that he might have life in himself, and authority to do judgement also,  because he is the Son of man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:37
verses.text: Marvel not then at that: I mean the coming of the hour when all that are in the tombs shall hear his voice, and shall come forth:  those that have done good, to the resurrection of life; and those that have done evil deeds, to the resurrection of judgement.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:38
verses.text: I am not able of myself to do anything; but as I hear, I judge: and my judgement  is just; I seek not my own will, but the will of him that sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:39
verses.text: I bear witness  of myself, and so my witness is not true.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:40
verses.text: It is another that beareth witness  of me; and I know that the witness which he beareth of me is true.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:41
verses.text: Ye have sent  unto John, and he hath borne witness of the truth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:42
verses.text: But not from man do I seek  witness; but I say that ye may live.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:43
verses.text: That was a lamp which shineth and  giveth light: and ye were pleased to glory now in his light.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:44
verses.text: But I have witness greater than that of John: the works which my Father hath given me to accomplish,  those works which I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:45
verses.text: And the Father which sent me, he hath borne witness of me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:46
verses.text: Ye have neither heard his  voice at any time, nor seen his appearance.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:47
verses.text: And his word abideth not in you; because  in him whom he hath sent ye do not believe.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:48
verses.text: Search the scriptures, in which ye rejoice  that ye have eternal life; and they bear witness of me; and ye do not wish to come to ,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:49
verses.text: me, that ye may have eternal life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:50
verses.text: I seek not praise of men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:51
verses.text: But I know  you, that the love of God is not in you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:52
verses.text: I am come in the name of my Father, and ye received me not; but if another come in his own name, that one will  ye receive.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:53
verses.text: And how can ye believe, while ye receive praise one from another, and  praise from God, the One, ye seek not? Can it be that ye think that I will accuse you before the Father? Ye have one that accuseth you, Moses, in whom ye have  rejoiced.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:54
verses.text: If ye believed Moses, ye would believe me also; Moses wrote of me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 23:55
verses.text: And if ye believed not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:1
verses.text: Section XXIII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:2
verses.text: And Jesus departed thence, and came to the side of the sea of Galilee, and went  up into the mountain, and sat there.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:3
verses.text: And there came unto him great multitudes, having with them lame, and blind, and dumb, and maimed, and many others, and  they cast them at the feet of Jesus: for they had seen all the signs which he did in  Jerusalem, when they were gathered at the feast.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:4
verses.text: And he healed them all.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:5
verses.text: And those multitudes marvelled when they saw dumb men speak, and maimed men healed, and lame men walk, and blind men see; and they praised the God of Israel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:6
verses.text: And Jesus called his disciples, and said unto them, I have compassion on this multitude, because of their continuing with me three days, having nothing to eat; and to send them away fasting I am not willing, lest they faint in the way, some of them having  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:7
verses.text: come from far.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:8
verses.text: His disciples said unto him, Whence have we in the desert  bread wherewith to satisfy all this multitude? Jesus said unto them, How  many loaves have ye? They said unto him, Seven, and a few small fishes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:9
verses.text: And he  commanded the multitudes to sit down upon the ground; and he took those seven loaves and the fish, and blessed, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set before  them; and the disciples set before the multitudes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:10
verses.text: And they all ate, and were satisfied: and they took that which remained over of the fragments, seven basketfuls.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:11
verses.text: And the people that ate were four thousand men, besides the women and children.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:12
verses.text: And when the multitudes departed, he went up into the boat, and came to the borders of Magada.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:13
verses.text: And the Pharisees and Sadducees came to him, and began to seek a discussion with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:14
verses.text: And they asked him to shew them a sign from heaven, tempting him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:15
verses.text: And Jesus sighed within himself, and said, What sign seeketh this evil and adulterous generation? It seeketh a sign, and it shall not be given a sign, except the sign  of Jonah the prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:16
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not be given a  sign.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:17
verses.text: And he left them, and went up into the boat, and went away to that side.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:18
verses.text: And his disciples forgot to take with them bread, and there was not with them  in the boat, not even one loaf.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:19
verses.text: And Jesus charged them, and said, Take heed, and guard yourselves from the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees, and from the  leaven of Herod.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:20
verses.text: And they reflected within themselves that they had taken with them  no bread.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:21
verses.text: And Jesus knew, and said unto them, Why think ye within yourselves, O ye of little faith, and are anxious, because ye have no bread? until now do ye not perceive,  neither understand? is your heart yet hard? And have ye eyes, and yet see not?  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:22
verses.text: and have ye ears, and yet hear not? and do ye not remember when I brake those five loaves for five thousand? and how many baskets full of broken  pieces took ye up? They said, Twelve.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:23
verses.text: He said unto them, And the seven also for four thousand: how many baskets full of broken pieces took ye up? They  said, Seven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:24
verses.text: He said unto them, How have ye not understood that I spake not to you because of the bread, but that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees  and Sadducees? Then they understood that he spake, not that they should beware of the leaven of the bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and Sadducees, which he called leaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:25
verses.text: And after that, he came to Bethsaida.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:26
verses.text: And they brought to him a certain blind  man, and besought him that he would touch him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:27
verses.text: And he took the hand of that blind man, and led him out without the village, and spat in his eyes, and laid his  hand on him, and asked him, What seest thou? And that blind man looked intently,  and said unto him, I see men as trees walking.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:28
verses.text: And he placed his hand  again on his eyes; and they were restored, and he saw everything clearly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:29
verses.text: And he sent him to his house, and said, Do not enter even into the village, nor tell any man in the village.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:30
verses.text: And Jesus went forth, and his disciples, to the villages of Caesarea Philippi.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:31
verses.text: And while he was going in the way, and his disciples alone, he asked his disciples,  and said, What do men say of me that I am, the Son of man? They said unto him, Some say, John the Baptist; and others, Elijah; and others, Jeremiah, or one of the ,  prophets.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:32
verses.text: He said unto them, And ye, what say ye that I am? Simon Cephas answered  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:33
verses.text: and said, Thou art the Messiah, the Son of the living God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:34
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Blessed art thou, Simon son of Jonah: flesh and  blood hath not revealed it unto thee, but my Father which is in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:35
verses.text: And I say unto thee also, that thou art Cephas, and on this rock will I build my church; and the  gates of Hades shall not prevail against it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:36
verses.text: To thee will I give the keys of the kingdom of heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven; and  whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:37
verses.text: And he sternly charged his disciples, and warned them that they should not tell any man concerning him,  that he was the Messiah.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:38
verses.text: And henceforth began Jesus to shew to his disciples  that he was determined to go to Jerusalem, and suffer much, and be rejected of the elders, and of the chief priests, and of the scribes, and be killed, and on the  third day rise.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:39
verses.text: And he was speaking plainly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:40
verses.text: And Simon Cephas, as one grieved  for him, said, Far be thou, my Lord, from that.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:41
verses.text: And he turned, and looked upon  his disciples, and rebuked Simon, and said, Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou art a stumblingblock unto me: for thou thinkest not of what pertains to God, but of what pertains to men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:42
verses.text: And Jesus called the multitudes with his disciples, and said unto them, Whosoever would come after me, let him deny himself, and take his cross every day, and  come after me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:43
verses.text: And whosoever would save his life shall lose it; and whosoever  loseth his life for my sake, and for the sake of my gospel, shall save it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:44
verses.text: What shall  a man profit, if he gain all the world, and destroy his own life, or lose it? or what  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:45
verses.text: will a man give in ransom for his life? Whosoever shall deny me and my sayings in this sinful and adulterous generation, the Son of man also will  deny him, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with his holy angels.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 24:46
verses.text: For the Son of man is about to come in the glory of his Father with his holy angels; and then shall he reward each man according to his works.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:1
verses.text: Section XXIV.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:2
verses.text: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There be here now some standing that shall not taste death, until they see the kingdom of God come with strength, and the Son of man who cometh in his kingdom.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:3
verses.text: And after six days Jesus took Simon Cephas, and James, and John his brother,  and brought them up into a high mountain, the three of them only.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:4
verses.text: And while they  were praying, Jesus changed, and became after the fashion of another person; and his face shone like the sun, and his raiment was very white like the snow, and as  the light of lightning, so that nothing on earth can whiten like it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:5
verses.text: And there appeared  unto him Moses and Elijah talking to Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:6
verses.text: And they thought that the time  of his decease which was to be accomplished at Jerusalem was come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:7
verses.text: And Simon and those that were with him were heavy in the drowsiness of sleep; and with effort they roused themselves, and saw his glory, and those two men that were standing with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:8
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:9
verses.text: And when they began to depart from him, Simon said unto Jesus, My  Master, it is good for us to be here: and if thou wilt, we will make here three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah; not knowing  what he said, because of the fear which took possession of them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:10
verses.text: And while he  was yet saying that, a bright cloud overshadowed them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:11
verses.text: And when they saw Moses  and Elijah that they had entered into that cloud, they feared again.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:12
verses.text: And a voice was heard out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son, whom I have chosen;  hear ye therefore him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:13
verses.text: And when this voice was heard, Jesus was found alone.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:14
verses.text: And the disciples, when they heard the voice, fell on their faces from the fear which  took hold of them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:15
verses.text: And Jesus came and touched them and said, Arise, be not  afraid.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:16
verses.text: And they lifted up their eyes, and saw Jesus as he was.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:17
verses.text: And when they went down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, and said unto them, Tell not what ye have seen to any man, until the Son of man rise from  among the dead.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:18
verses.text: And they kept the word within themselves, and told no man in  those days what they had seen.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:19
verses.text: And they reflected among themselves, What is this  word which he spake unto us, I, when I am risen from among the dead? And his disciples asked him, and said, What is that which the scribes say, then, that Elijah  must first come? He said unto them, Elijah cometh first to set in order everything, Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:20
verses.text: and as it was written of the Son of man, that he should suffer many things,  and be rejected.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:21
verses.text: But I say unto you, that Elijah is come, and they knew him not, and have done unto him whatsoever they desired, as it was written of him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:22
verses.text: ,  In like manner the Son of man is to suffer of them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:23
verses.text: Then understood the disciples that he spake unto them concerning John the Baptist.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:24
verses.text: And on that day whereon they came down from the mountain, there met him a multitude of many people standing with his disciples, and the scribes were discussing  with them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:25
verses.text: And the people, when they saw Jesus, were perplexed, and in the  midst of their joy hastened and saluted him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:26
verses.text: And on that day came certain of the Pharisees, and said unto him, Get thee out, and go hence; for Herod seeketh  to kill thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:27
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Go ye and say to this fox, Behold, I am casting out demons, and I heal to-day and to-morrow, and on the third day I am perfected.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:28
verses.text: Nevertheless I must be watchful to-day and to-morrow, and on the last day I shall depart; for it cannot be that a prophet perish outside of Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:29
verses.text: And after that, there came to him a man from that multitude, and fell upon his knees, and said unto him, I beseech thee, my Lord, look upon my son; he is my  only child: and the spirit cometh upon him suddenly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:30
verses.text: A lunacy hath come upon  him, and he meeteth with evils.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:31
verses.text: And when it cometh upon him, it beateth him about;  and he foameth, and gnasheth his teeth, and wasteth; and many times it hath thrown him into the water and into the fire to destroy him, and it hardly leaveth him after  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:32
verses.text: bruising him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:33
verses.text: And I brought him near to thy disciples, and they could  not heal him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:34
verses.text: Jesus answered and said, O faithless and perverse generation, till when shall I be with you? and till when shall I bear with you? bring thy son  hither.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:35
verses.text: And he brought him unto him: and when the spirit saw him, immediately  it beat him about; and he fell upon the ground, and was raging and foaming.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:36
verses.text: And Jesus asked his father, How long is the time during which he hath been thus? He  said unto him, From his youth until now.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:37
verses.text: But, my Lord, help me wherein thou  canst, and have mercy upon me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:38
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe! All  things are possible to him that believeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:39
verses.text: And immediately the father of the child  cried out, weeping, and said, I believe, my Lord; help my lack of faith.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:40
verses.text: And when Jesus saw the hastening of the people, and their coming at the sound, he rebuked that unclean spirit, and said to it, Thou dumb spirit that speakest not, I command  thee, come out of him, and enter not again into him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:41
verses.text: And that spirit, devil, cried out much, and bruised him, and came out; and that child fell as one dead, and  many thought that he had died.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:42
verses.text: But Jesus took him by his hand, and raised him  up, and gave him to his father; and that child was healed from that hour.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:43
verses.text: And the people all marvelled at the greatness of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:44
verses.text: And when Jesus entered into the house, his disciples came, and asked him  privately, and said unto him, Why were we not able to heal him? Jesus said unto Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:45
verses.text: them, Because of your unbelief.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:46
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say to this mountain, Remove hence;  and it shall remove; and nothing shall overcome you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:47
verses.text: But it is impossible to cast out this kind by anything except by fasting and prayer.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:48
verses.text: And when he went forth thence, they passed through Galilee: and he would not  that any man should know it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:49
verses.text: And he taught his disciples, and said unto them,  Keep ye these sayings in your ears and your hearts: for the Son of man is to be delivered into the hands of men, and they shall kill him; and when he is killed, he  shall rise on the third day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:50
verses.text: But they knew not the word which he spake unto them, for it was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it; and they feared to  ask him about this word.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 25:51
verses.text: And they were exceeding sorrowful.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:1
verses.text: Section XXV.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:2
verses.text: And in that day this thought presented itself to his disciples, and they said, which  haply should be the greatest among them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:3
verses.text: And when they came to Capernaum, and entered into the house, Jesus said unto them, What were ye considering in the  way among yourselves? And they were silent because they had considered that matter.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:4
verses.text: And when Simon went forth without, those that received two dirhams for the tribute came to Cephas, and said unto him, Doth your master not give his two  dirhams? He said unto them, Yea.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:5
verses.text: And when Cephas entered the house, Jesus anticipated him, and said unto him, What thinkest thou, Simon? the kings of the earth, from whom do they receive custom and tribute? from their sons, or from  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:6
verses.text: strangers? Simon said unto him, From strangers.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:7
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Children then are free.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:8
verses.text: Simon said unto him, Yea.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:9
verses.text: Jesus said unto him,  Give thou also unto them, like the stranger.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:10
verses.text: But, lest it trouble them, go thou to the sea, and cast a hook; and the first fish that cometh up, open its mouth, and thou shalt find a stater: take therefore that, and give for me and thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:11
verses.text: And in that hour came the disciples to Jesus, and said unto him, Who, thinkest  thou, is greater in the kingdom of heaven? And Jesus knew the thought of their heart, and called a child, and set him in the midst, and took him in his arms, and  said unto them, Verily I say unto you, If ye do not return, and become as children,  ye shall not enter the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:12
verses.text: Every one that shall receive in my name such as this child hath received me: and whosoever receiveth me receiveth  not me, but him that sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:13
verses.text: And he who is little in your company, the same  shall be great.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:14
verses.text: But whosoever shall injure one of these little ones that believe in me, it were better for him that a great millstone should be hanged about his neck, and he should be drowned in the depths of the sea.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:15
verses.text: John answered and said, Our Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name;  and we prevented him, because he followed not thee with us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:16
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Prevent him not; for no man doeth powers in my name, and can hasten to speak evil ,  of me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:17
verses.text: Every one who is not in opposition to you is with you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:18
verses.text: Woe unto the world Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:19
verses.text: because of trials! but woe unto that man by whose hand the trials come!  If thy hand or thy foot injure thee, cut it off, and cast it from thee; for it is better for thee to enter into life being halt or maimed, and not that thou shouldest have two hands or two feet, and fall into the hell of fire that burneth for ever; ,  where their worm dieth not, and their fire is not quenched.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:20
verses.text: And if thine eye seduce  thee, pluck it out, and cast it from thee; for it is better for thee to enter the kingdom of God with one eye, than that thou shouldest have two eyes, and fall into the ,  fire of Gehenna; where their worm dieth not, and their fire is not quenched.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:21
verses.text: Every  one shall be salted with fire, and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:22
verses.text: How good  is salt! but if the salt also be tasteless, wherewith shall it be salted? It is fit neither for the land nor for dung, but they cast it out.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:23
verses.text: He that hath ears to hear, let him  hear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:24
verses.text: Have ye salt in yourselves, and be in peace one with another.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:25
verses.text: And he arose from thence, and came to the borders of Judaea beyond Jordan: and there went unto him thither great multitudes, and he healed them; and he taught  them also, according to his custom.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:26
verses.text: And the Pharisees came unto him, tempting  him, and asking him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife? He said, What  did Moses command you? They said, Moses made it allowable for us, saying, Whosoever  will, let him write a writing of divorcement, and put away his wife.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:27
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Have ye not read, He that made them from the beginning  made them male and female, and said, For this reason shall the man leave his father Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:28
verses.text: and his mother, and cleave to his wife; and they both shall be one body?  So then they are not twain, but one body; the thing, then, which God hath  joined together, let no man put asunder.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:29
verses.text: And those Pharisees said unto him, Why did Moses consent that a man should give a writing of divorcement and put her away?  Jesus said unto them, Moses because of the hardness of your hearts gave you leave  to divorce your wives; but in the beginning it was not so.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:30
verses.text: I say unto you, Whosoever putteth away his wife without fornication, and marrieth another, hath exposed  her to adultery.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:31
verses.text: And his disciples, when he entered the house, asked him again  about that.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:32
verses.text: And he said unto them, Every one who putteth away his wife, and  marrieth another, hath exposed her to adultery.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:33
verses.text: And any woman that leaveth her husband, and becometh another's, hath committed adultery.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:34
verses.text: And whosoever marrieth  her that is divorced hath committed adultery.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:35
verses.text: And his disciples said unto him, If there be between the man and the woman such a case as this, it is not good for  a man to marry.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:36
verses.text: He said unto them, Not every man can endure this saying, except  him to whom it is given.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:37
verses.text: There are eunuchs which from their mother's womb were born so; and there are eunuchs which through men became eunuchs; and there are eunuchs which made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:38
verses.text: He that is able to be content, let him be content.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:39
verses.text: Then they brought to him children, that he should lay his hand upon them, and  pray: and his disciples were rebuking those that were bringing them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:40
verses.text: And Jesus saw, and it was distressing to him; and he said unto them, Suffer the children to Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:41
verses.text: come unto me, and prevent them not; for those that are like these have  the kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:42
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever receiveth not the  kingdom of God as this child, shall not enter it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 26:43
verses.text: And he took them in his arms, and laid his hand upon them, and blessed them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:1
verses.text: Section XXVI.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:2
verses.text: ,  And there came unto him publicans and sinners to hear his word.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:3
verses.text: And the scribes and the Pharisees murmured, and said, This man receiveth sinners, and  eateth with them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:4
verses.text: And Jesus, when he beheld their murmuring, spake unto them  this parable: What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if one of them were lost, would not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go and seek the straying one  till he found it? Verily I say unto you, When he findeth it, he will rejoice over it  more than over the ninety-nine that went not astray; and bear it on his shoulders, and bring it to his house, and call his friends and neighbours, and say unto them,  Rejoice with me, since I have found my straying sheep.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:5
verses.text: So your Father which is in heaven willeth not that one of these little ones that have strayed should perish,  and he seeketh for them repentance.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:6
verses.text: I say unto you, Thus there shall be rejoicing in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety-nine righteous persons that do not need repentance.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:7
verses.text: And what woman having ten drachmas would lose one of them, and not light a  lamp, and sweep the house, and seek it with care till she found it; and when she found it, call her friends and neighbours, and say unto them, Rejoice with me, as I  have found my drachma that was lost? I say unto you, Thus there shall be joy Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:8
verses.text: before the angels of God over the one sinner that repenteth, more than over the ninety-nine righteous persons that do not need repentance.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:9
verses.text: ,  And Jesus spake unto them also another parable: A man had two sons: and the younger son said unto him, My father, give me my portion that belongeth to  me of thy goods.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:10
verses.text: And he divided between them his property.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:11
verses.text: And after a few days the younger son gathered everything that belonged to him, and went into a  far country, and there squandered his property by living prodigally.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:12
verses.text: And when he had exhausted everything he had, there occurred a great dearth in that country.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:13
verses.text: And when he was in want, he went and joined himself to one of the people of a city  of that country; and that man sent him into the field to feed the swine.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:14
verses.text: And he used to long to fill his belly with the carob that those swine were eating: and no man  gave him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:15
verses.text: And when he returned unto himself, he said, How many hired servants now in my father's house have bread enough and to spare, while I here perish with  hunger! I will arise and go to my father's house, and say unto him, My father, I  have sinned in heaven and before thee, and am not worthy now to be called thy  son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:16
verses.text: And he arose, and came to his father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:17
verses.text: But his father saw him while he was at a distance, and was moved with compassion  for him, and ran, and fell on his breast, and kissed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:18
verses.text: And his son said unto him, My father, I have sinned in heaven and before thee, and am not worthy to be  called thy son.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:19
verses.text: His father said unto his servants, Bring forth a stately robe, and put  it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and put on him shoes on his feet: and bring and  slay a fatted ox, that we may eat and make merry: for this my son was dead, and is  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:20
verses.text: alive; and was lost, and is found.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:21
verses.text: And they began to be merry.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:22
verses.text: Now his elder son was in the field; and when he came and drew near to the house,  he heard the sound of many singing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:23
verses.text: And he called one of the lads, and asked him  what this was.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:24
verses.text: He said unto him, Thy brother hath arrived; and thy father hath  slain a fatted ox, since he hath received him safe and sound.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:25
verses.text: And he was angry,  and would not enter; so his father went out, and besought him to enter.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:26
verses.text: And he said to his father, How many years do I serve thee in bondage, and I never transgressed a commandment of thine; and thou hast never given me a kid, that I might  make merry with my friends? but this thy son, when he had squandered thy  property with harlots, and come, thou hast slain for him a fatted ox.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:27
verses.text: His father said unto him, My son, thou art at all times with me, and everything I have is  thine.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:28
verses.text: It behoveth thee to rejoice and make merry, since this thy brother was dead, and is alive; and was lost, and is found.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:29
verses.text: And he spake a parable unto his disciples: There was a rich man, and he had  a steward; and he was accused to him that he had squandered his property.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:30
verses.text: So his lord called him, and said unto him, What is this that I hear regarding thee? Give me the account of thy stewardship; for it is now impossible that thou shouldest  be a steward for me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:31
verses.text: The steward said within himself, What shall I do, seeing that my lord taketh from me the stewardship? To dig I am not able; and to beg I  am ashamed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:32
verses.text: I know what I will do, that, when I go out of the stewardship, they  may receive me into their houses.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:33
verses.text: And he called one after another of his lord's  debtors, and said to the first, How much owest thou my lord? He said unto him, An hundred portions of oil.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:34
verses.text: He said unto him, Take thy writing, and sit down, and write  quickly fifty portions.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:35
verses.text: And he said to the next, And thou, how much owest thou my lord? He said unto him, An hundred cors of wheat.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:36
verses.text: He said unto him, Take  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:37
verses.text: thy writing, and sit down, and write eighty cors.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:38
verses.text: And our lord commended the sinful steward because he had done a wise deed; for the children  of this world are wiser than the children of the light in this their age.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:39
verses.text: And I also say unto you, Make unto yourselves friends with the wealth of this unrighteousness;  so that, when it is exhausted, they may receive you into their tents for ever.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:40
verses.text: He who is faithful in a little is faithful also in much: and he who is unrighteous in a  little is unrighteous also in much.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 27:41
verses.text: If then in the wealth of unrighteousness ye were  not trustworthy, who will intrust you with the truth? If ye are not found faithful in what does not belong to you, who will give you what belongeth to you?.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:1
verses.text: Section XXVII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:2
verses.text: Therefore the kingdom of heaven is like a certain king, who would make a  reckoning with his servants.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:3
verses.text: And when he began to make it, they brought to him one who  owed him ten talents.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:4
verses.text: And because he had not wherewith to pay, his lord ordered that he should be sold, he, and his wife, and children, and all that he  had, and payment be made.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:5
verses.text: So that servant fell down and worshipped him, and said unto him, My lord, have patience with me, and I shall pay thee everything.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:6
verses.text: And the lord of that servant had compassion, and released him, and forgave him his  debt.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:7
verses.text: And that servant went out, and found one of his fellow-servants, who owed him Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:8
verses.text: a hundred pence; and he took him, and dealt severely with him, and said  unto him, Give me what thou owest.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:9
verses.text: So the fellow-servant fell down at his  feet, and besought him, and said, Grant me respite, and I will pay thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:10
verses.text: And he would not; but took him, and cast him into prison, till he should give him his debt.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:11
verses.text: And when their fellow-servants saw what happened, it distressed them much; and  they came and told their lord of all that had taken place.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:12
verses.text: Then his lord called him, and said unto him, Thou wicked servant, all that debt I forgave thee, because  thou besoughtest me: was it not then incumbent on thee also to have mercy on thy  fellow-servant, as I had mercy on thee? And his lord became wroth, and delivered  him to the scourgers, till he should pay all that he owed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:13
verses.text: So shall my Father which is in heaven do unto you, if one forgive not his brother his wrong conduct from  his heart.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:14
verses.text: Take heed within yourselves: if thy brother sin, rebuke him; and if he  repent, forgive him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:15
verses.text: And if he act wrongly towards thee seven times in a day, and on that day return seven times unto thee, and say, I repent towards thee; forgive him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:16
verses.text: And if thy brother act wrongly towards thee, go and reprove him between thee and  him alone: if he hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:17
verses.text: But if he hear thee not, take with thee one or two, and so at the mouth of two or three every saying shall  be established.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:18
verses.text: And if he listen not to these also, tell the congregation; and if he listen not even to the congregation, let him be unto thee as a publican and a Gentile.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:19
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, All that ye bind on earth shall be bound in heaven:  and what ye loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:20
verses.text: I say unto you also, If two of you agree on earth to ask, everything shall be granted them from my Father  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:21
verses.text: which is in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:22
verses.text: For where two or three are gathered in my name, there  am I amongst them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:23
verses.text: Then Cephas drew near to him, and said unto him, My Lord, how many times, if my brother act wrongly towards me, should I forgive him?  until seven times? Jesus said unto him, I say not unto thee, Until seven; but, Until seventy  times seven, seven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:24
verses.text: And the servant that knoweth his lord's will, and maketh not  ready for him according to his will, shall meet with much punishment; but he that knoweth not, and doeth something for which he meriteth punishment, shall meet with slight punishment.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:25
verses.text: Every one to whom much hath been given, much shall be asked of him; and he that hath had much committed to him, much shall be  required at his hand.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:26
verses.text: I came to cast fire upon the earth; and I would that it had  been kindled already.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:27
verses.text: And I have a baptism to be baptized with, and greatly am  I straitened till it be accomplished.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:28
verses.text: See that ye despise not one of these little ones that believe in me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:29
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Their angels at all times see the  face of my Father which is in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:30
verses.text: The Son of man came to save the thing which was lost.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:31
verses.text: And after that, Jesus walked in Galilee; and he did not like to walk in Judaea,  because the Jews sought to kill him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:32
verses.text: And there came people who told him of  the Galilaeans, those whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:33
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Do ye imagine that those Galilaeans were sinners  more than all the Galilaeans, so that this thing has come upon them? Nay.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:34
verses.text: Verily I say unto you now, that ye shall all also, if ye repent not, likewise perish.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:35
verses.text: Or perchance those eighteen on whom the palace fell in Siloam, and slew them, do ye imagine that they were to be condemned more than all the people that dwell  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:36
verses.text: in Jerusalem? Nay.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:37
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, If ye do not all repent, ye shall perish like them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:38
verses.text: And he spake unto them this parable: A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard;  and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:39
verses.text: So he said to the husbandman, Lo, three years do I come and seek fruit on this fig tree, and find  none: cut it down; why doth it render the ground unoccupied? The husbandman said unto him, My lord, leave it this year also, that I may dig about it, and dung  it; then if it bear fruitâ€”! and if not, then cut it down in the coming year.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:40
verses.text: And when Jesus was teaching on the sabbath day in one of the synagogues,  there was there a woman that had a spirit of disease eighteen years; and she was  bowed down, and could not straighten herself at all.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:41
verses.text: And Jesus saw her, and called  her, and said unto her, Woman, be loosed from thy disease.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:42
verses.text: And he put his hand  upon her; and immediately she was straightened, and praised God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:43
verses.text: And the chief of the synagogue answered with anger, because Jesus had healed on a sabbath, and said unto the multitudes, There are six days in which work ought to be done;  come in them and be healed, and not on the sabbath day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 28:44
verses.text: But Jesus answered and said unto him, Ye hypocrites, doth not each of you on the sabbath day loose  his ox or his ass from the manger, and go and water it? Ought not this woman, who is a daughter of Abraham, and whom the devil hath bound eighteen years,  to be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day? And when he said this, they were all put to shame, those standing, who were opposing him: and all the people were pleased with all the wonders that proceeded from his hand.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:1
verses.text: Section XXVIII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:2
verses.text: ,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:3
verses.text: And at that time the feast of tabernacles of the Jews drew near.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:4
verses.text: So the brethren of Jesus said unto him, Remove now hence, and go to Judaea, that  thy disciples may see the deeds that thou doest.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:5
verses.text: For no man doeth a thing secretly  and wisheth to be apparent.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:6
verses.text: If thou doest this, shew thyself to the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:7
verses.text: For  up to this time not even the brethren of Jesus believed on him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:8
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, My time till now has not arrived; but as for you, your time is alway ready.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:9
verses.text: It is not possible for the world to hate you; but me it hateth, for I bear witness  against it, that its deeds are evil.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:10
verses.text: As for you, go ye up unto this feast: but I go  not up now to this feast; for my time has not yet been completed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:11
verses.text: He said this, and remained behind in Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:12
verses.text: But when his brethren went up unto the feast, he journeyed from Galilee, and  came to the borders of Judaea, to the country beyond Jordan; and there came after  him great multitudes, and he healed them all there.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:13
verses.text: And he went out, and proceeded  to the feast, not openly, but as one that conceals himself.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:14
verses.text: And the Jews sought him  at the feast, and said, In what place is this man? And there occurred much murmuring there in the great multitude that came to the feast, on his account.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:15
verses.text: For  some said, He is good: and others said, Nay, but he leadeth the people astray.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:16
verses.text: But no man spake of him openly for fear of the Jews.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:17
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:18
verses.text: But when the days of the feast of tabernacles were half over, Jesus went  up to the temple, and taught.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:19
verses.text: And the Jews wondered, and said, How doth  this man know writing, seeing he hath not learned? Jesus answered and said, My doctrine  is not mine, but his that sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:20
verses.text: Whoever wisheth to do his will understandeth my doctrine, whether it be from God, or whether I speak of mine own accord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:21
verses.text: Whosoever speaketh of his own accord seeketh praise for himself; but whosoever seeketh praise for him that sent him, he is true, and unrighteousness in his heart  there is none.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:22
verses.text: Did not Moses give you the law, and no man of you keepeth the  law? Why seek ye to kill me? The multitude answered and said unto him, Thou  hast demons: who seeketh to kill thee? Jesus answered and said unto them, I did  one deed, and ye all marvel because of this.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:23
verses.text: Moses hath given you circumcision (not because it is from Moses, but it is from the fathers); and ye on the sabbath  circumcise a man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:24
verses.text: And if a man is circumcised on the sabbath day, that the law of Moses may not be broken; are ye angry at me, because I healed on the sabbath  day the whole man? Judge not with hypocrisy, but judge righteous judgement.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:25
verses.text: And some people from Jerusalem said, Is not this he whom they seek to slay?  And lo, he discourseth with them openly, and they say nothing unto him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:26
verses.text: Think  you that our elders have learned that this is the Messiah indeed? But this man is known whence he is; and the Messiah, when he cometh, no man knoweth whence  he is.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:27
verses.text: So Jesus lifted up his voice as he taught in the temple, and said, Ye both know me, and know whence I am; and of my own accord am I not come, but he  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:28
verses.text: that sent me is true, he whom ye know not: but I know him; for I am  from him, and he sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:29
verses.text: And they sought to seize him: and no man  laid a hand on him, because his hour had not yet come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:30
verses.text: But many of the multitude believed on him; and they said, The Messiah, when he cometh, can it be that he will do more than these signs that this man doeth?   And a man of that multitude said unto our Lord, Teacher, say to my brother  that he divide with me the inheritance.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:31
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Man, who is it that  appointed me over you as a judge and divider? And he said unto his disciples, Take heed within yourselves of all inordinate desire; for it is not in abundance of  possessions that life shall be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:32
verses.text: And he gave them this parable: The ground of a  rich man brought forth abundant produce: and he pondered within himself, and  said, What shall I do, since I have no place to store my produce? And he said, I will do this: I will pull down the buildings of my barns, and build them, and make  them greater; and store there all my wheat and my goods.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:33
