verses.text: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid by for many years; take thine ease, eat,  drink, enjoy thyself.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:34
verses.text: God said unto him, O thou of little intelligence, this night shall thy soul be taken from thee; and this that thou hast prepared, whose shall it  be? So is he that layeth up treasures for himself, and is not rich in God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:35
verses.text: And while Jesus was going in the way, there came near to him a young man of the rulers, and fell on his knees, and asked him, and said, Good Teacher, what is  it that I must do that I may have eternal life? Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou  me good, while there is none good but the one, even God? Thou knowest the commandments.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:36
verses.text: If thou wouldest enter into life, keep the commandments.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:37
verses.text: The young Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:38
verses.text: man said unto him, Which of the commandments? Jesus said unto him,  Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not bear false witness, Thou shalt not do injury, Honour thy father  and thy mother: and, Love thy neighbour as thyself.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:39
verses.text: That young man said unto  him, All these have I kept from my youth: what then is it that I lack? And Jesus  looked intently at him, and loved him, and said unto him, If thou wouldest be perfect, what thou lackest is one thing: go away and sell everything that thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and take thy  cross, and follow me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:40
verses.text: And that young man frowned at this word, and went away  feeling sad; for he was very rich.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 29:41
verses.text: And when Jesus saw his sadness, he looked towards his disciples, and said unto them, How hard it is for them that have possessions to enter the kingdom of God!.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:1
verses.text: Section XXIX.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:2
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, It is difficult for a rich man to enter the kingdom of  heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:3
verses.text: And I say unto you also, that it is easier for a camel to enter the eye of  a needle, than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:4
verses.text: And the disciples were wondering at these sayings.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:5
verses.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them again, My children, how hard it is for those that rely on their possessions to enter the  kingdom of God! And those that were listening wondered more, and said amongst  themselves, being agitated, Who, thinkest thou, can be saved? And Jesus looked at them intently, and said unto them, With men this is not possible, but with God it is:  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:6
verses.text: it is possible for God to do everything.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:7
verses.text: Simon Cephas said unto him, Lo, we have left everything, and followed thee; what is it, thinkest thou, that we  shall have? Jesus said unto them, Verily I say unto you, Ye that have followed me, in the new world, when the Son of man shall sit on the throne of his glory, ye also  shall sit on twelve thrones, and shall judge the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:8
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, No man leaveth houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or kinsfolk, or lands, because of the kingdom of God, or for  my sake, and the sake of my gospel, who shall not obtain many times as much in this  time, and in the world to come inherit eternal life: and now in this time, houses, and brothers, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecution;  and in the world to come everlasting life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:9
verses.text: Many that are first shall be last, and that are last shall be first.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:10
verses.text: And when the Pharisees heard all this, because of their love for wealth they  scoffed at him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:11
verses.text: And Jesus knew what was in their hearts, and said unto them, Ye are they that justify yourselves before men; while God knows your hearts: the thing that is lofty with men is base before God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:12
verses.text: And he began to say, A certain man was rich, and wore silk and purple, and enjoyed  himself every day in splendour: and there was a poor man named Lazarus, and  he was cast down at the door of the rich man, afflicted with sores, and he longed to fill Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:13
verses.text: his belly with the crumbs that fell from the table of that rich man; yea,  even the dogs used to come and lick his sores.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:14
verses.text: And it happened that that poor man died, and the angels conveyed him into the bosom of Abraham: and the  rich man also died, and was buried.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:15
verses.text: And while he was being tormented in Hades,  he lifted up his eyes from afar, and saw Abraham with Lazarus in his bosom.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:16
verses.text: And he called with a loud voice, and said, My father Abraham, have mercy upon me, and send Lazarus to wet the tip of his finger with water, and moisten my tongue  for me; for, behold, I am burned in this flame.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:17
verses.text: Abraham said unto him, My son, remember that thou receivedst thy good things in thy life, and Lazarus his afflictions:  but now, behold, he is at rest here, and thou art tormented.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:18
verses.text: And in addition to all this, there is between us and you a great abyss placed, so that they that would cross unto you from hence cannot, nor yet from thence do they cross unto  us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:19
verses.text: He said unto him, Then I beseech thee, my father, to send him to my father's  house; for I have five brethren; let him go, that they also sin not, and come to  the abode of this torment.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:20
verses.text: Abraham said unto him, They have Moses and the  prophets; let them hear them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:21
verses.text: He said unto him, Nay, my father Abraham: but  let a man from the dead go unto them, and they will repent.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:22
verses.text: Abraham said unto him, If they listen neither to Moses nor to the prophets, neither if a man from the dead rose would they believe him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:23
verses.text: The kingdom of heaven is like a man that is a householder, which went out early  in the morning to hire labourers for his vineyard.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:24
verses.text: And he agreed with the labourers on  one penny a day for each labourer, and he sent them into his vineyard.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:25
verses.text: And he went  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:26
verses.text: out in three hours, and saw others standing in the market idle.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:27
verses.text: He said unto them, Go ye also into my vineyard, and what is right I will pay you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:28
verses.text: And they went.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:29
verses.text: And he went out also at the sixth and the ninth hour, and did likewise,  and sent them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:30
verses.text: And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:31
verses.text: He said unto them, Why are ye standing the whole day idle?  They said unto him, Because no one hath hired us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:32
verses.text: He said unto them, Go ye  also into the vineyard, and what is right ye shall receive.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:33
verses.text: So when evening came, the lord of the vineyard said unto his steward, Call the labourers, and pay them  their wages; and begin with the later ones, and end with the former ones.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:34
verses.text: And  those of eleven hours came, and received each a penny.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:35
verses.text: When therefore the first came, they supposed that they should receive something more; and they also  received each a penny.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:36
verses.text: And when they received it, they spake angrily against the  householder, and said, These last worked one hour, and thou hast made them equal  with us, who have suffered the heat of the day, and its burden.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:37
verses.text: He answered and said unto one of them, My friend, I do thee no wrong: was it not for a penny that  thou didst bargain with me? Take what is thine, and go thy way; for I wish to  give this last as I have given thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:38
verses.text: Or am I not entitled to do with what is mine  what I choose? Or is thine eye perchance evil, because I am good? Thus shall the last ones be first, and the first last.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:39
verses.text: The called are many, and the chosen are few.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:40
verses.text: And when Jesus entered into the house of one of the chiefs of the Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day, and they were watching him to see what he would ,  do, and there was before him a man which had the dropsy, Jesus answered and  said unto the scribes and the Pharisees, Is it lawful on the sabbath to heal? But Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:41
verses.text: they were silent.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:42
verses.text: So he took him, and healed him, and sent him away.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 30:43
verses.text: And he said unto them, Which of you shall have his son or his ox fall on the sabbath day into a well, and not lift him up straightway, and draw water for  him? And they were not able to answer him a word to that.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:1
verses.text: Section XXX.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:2
verses.text: And he spake a parable unto those which were bidden there, because he saw  them choose the places that were in the highest part of the sitting room: When a man invites thee to a feast, do not go and sit at the head of the room; lest there  be there a man more honourable than thou, and he that invited you come and say unto thee, Give the place to this man: and thou be ashamed when thou risest and  takest another place.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:3
verses.text: But when thou art invited, go and sit last; so that when he that invited thee cometh, he may say unto thee, My friend, go up higher: and  thou shalt have praise before all that were invited with thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:4
verses.text: For every one that exalteth himself shall be abased; and every one that abaseth himself shall be exalted.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:5
verses.text: And he said also to him that had invited him, When thou makest a feast or a banquet, do not invite thy friends, nor even thy brethren, nor thy kinsmen, nor thy  rich neighbours; lest haply they also invite thee, and thou have this reward.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:6
verses.text: But when thou makest a feast, invite the poor, and those with withered hand, and the  lame, and the blind: and blessed art thou, since they have not the means to reward  thee; that thy reward may be at the rising of the righteous.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:7
verses.text: And when one of them that were invited heard that, he said unto him, Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:8
verses.text: ,  Jesus answered again in parables, and said, The kingdom of heaven hath been likened Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:9
verses.text: to a certain king, which made a feast for his son, and prepared a  great banquet, and invited many: and he sent his servants at the time of the feast to inform them that were invited, Everything is made ready for you; come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:10
verses.text: And  they would not come, but began all of them with one voice to make excuse.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:11
verses.text: And the first said unto them, Say to him, I have bought a field, and I must needs go out  to see it: I pray thee to release me, for I ask to be excused.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:12
verses.text: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going to examine them: I pray thee  to release me, for I ask to be excused.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:13
verses.text: And another said, I have married a wife,  and therefore I cannot come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:14
verses.text: And the king sent also other servants, and said, Say to those that were invited, that my feast is ready, and my oxen and my fatlings are  slain, and everything is ready: come to the feast.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:15
verses.text: But they made light of it, and  went, one to his field, and another to his merchandise: and the rest took his  servants, and entreated them shamefully, and killed them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:16
verses.text: And one of the servants  came, and informed his lord of what had happened.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:17
verses.text: And when the king heard, he became angry, and sent his armies; and they destroyed those murderers, and  burned their cities.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:18
verses.text: Then he said to his servants, The feast is prepared, but those  that were invited were not worthy.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:19
verses.text: Go out quickly into the markets and into the partings of the ways of the city, and bring in hither the poor, and those with pains, and the lame, and the blind.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:20
verses.text: And the servants did as the king commanded them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:21
verses.text: And they came, and said unto him, Our lord, we have done all that thou commandedst  us, and there is here still room.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:22
verses.text: So the lord said unto his servants, Go out into the roads, and the ways, and the paths, and every one that ye find, invite  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:23
verses.text: to the feast, and constrain them to enter, till my house is filled.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:24
verses.text: I say unto you, that no one of those people that were invited shall taste of my feast.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:25
verses.text: And those servants went out into the roads, and gathered all that they found, good and  bad: and the banquet-house was filled with guests.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:26
verses.text: And the king entered to see those  who were seated, and he saw there a man not wearing a festive garment: and he said unto him, My friend, how didst thou come in here not having on festive garments?  And he was silent.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:27
verses.text: Then the king said to the servants, Bind his hands and his feet, and put him forth into the outer darkness; there shall be weeping and  gnashing of teeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:28
verses.text: The called are many; and the chosen, few.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:29
verses.text: And after that, the time of the feast of unleavened bread of the Jews arrived,  and Jesus went out to go to Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:30
verses.text: And as he went in the way, there met him  ten persons who were lepers, and stood afar off: and they lifted up their voice, and  said, Our Master, Jesus, have mercy upon us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:31
verses.text: And when he saw them, he said unto them, Go and shew yourselves unto the priests.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:32
verses.text: And when they went, they  were cleansed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:33
verses.text: And one of them, when he saw himself cleansed, returned, and  was praising God with a loud voice; and he fell on his face before the feet of  Jesus, giving him thanks: and this man was a Samaritan.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:34
verses.text: Jesus answered and said,  Were not those that were cleansed ten? where then are the nine? Not one of them turned aside to come and praise God, but this man who is of a strange  people.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:35
verses.text: He said unto him, Arise, and go thy way; for thy faith hath given thee life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:36
verses.text: And while they were going up in the way to Jerusalem, Jesus went in front of them; and they wondered, and followed him fearing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:37
verses.text: And he took his twelve disciples apart,  and began to tell them privately what was about to befall him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:38
verses.text: And he said unto Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:39
verses.text: them, We are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things shall be fulfilled  that are written in the prophets concerning the Son of man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:40
verses.text: He shall be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death,  and deliver him to the peoples; and they shall treat him shamefully, and scourge  him, and spit in his face, and humble him,and crucify him, and slay him: and on  the third day he shall rise.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:41
verses.text: But they understood not one thing of this; but this word was hidden from them, and they did not perceive these things that were addressed to them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:42
verses.text: Then came near to him the mother of the (two) sons of Zebedee, she and her (two) sons, and worshipped him, and asked of him a certain thing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:43
verses.text: And he said  unto her, What wouldest thou? And James and John, her two sons, came forward, and said unto him, Teacher, we would that all that we ask thou wouldest  do unto us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:44
verses.text: He said unto them, What would ye that I should do unto you?  They said unto him, Grant us that we may sit, the one on thy right, and the other  on thy left, in thy kingdom and thy glory.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:45
verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:46
verses.text: Are ye able to drink the cup that I am to drink? and with the  baptism that I am to be baptized with, will ye be baptized? And they said unto him, We are able.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 31:47
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, The cup that I drink ye shall drink; and  with the baptism wherewith I am baptized ye shall be baptized: but that ye should sit on my right and on my left is not mine to give; but it is for him for whom my Father hath prepared it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:1
verses.text: Section XXXI.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:2
verses.text: And when the ten heard, they were moved with anger against James and John.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:3
verses.text: And Jesus called them, and said unto them, Ye know that the rulers of the nations  are their lords; and their great men are set in authority over them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:4
verses.text: Not thus shall it Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:5
verses.text: be amongst you: but he amongst you that would be great, let him be to you a  servant; and whoever of you would be first, let him be to every man a  bond-servant: even as the Son of man also came not to be served, but to serve, and  to give himself a ransom in place of the many.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:6
verses.text: He said this, and was going about  the villages and the cities, and teaching; and he went to Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:7
verses.text: And a man asked him, Are those that shall be saved few? Jesus answered and said unto  them, Strive ye to enter at the narrow door: I say unto you now, that many shall  seek to enter, and shall not be ableâ€”from the time when the master of the house riseth, and closeth the door, and ye shall be standing without, and shall knock at the door, and shall begin to say, Our lord, open unto us; and he shall answer and  say, I say unto you, I know you not whence ye are: and ye shall begin to say,  Before thee we did eat and drink, and in our markets didst thou teach; and he shall say unto you, I know you not whence ye are; depart from me, ye servants  of untruth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:8
verses.text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, while ye are  put forth without.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:9
verses.text: And they shall come from the east and the west, and from the  north and the south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:10
verses.text: And there shall then be last that have become first, and first that have become last.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:11
verses.text: ,  And when Jesus entered and passed through Jericho, there was a man named Zacchaeus,  rich, and chief of the publicans.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:12
verses.text: And he desired to see Jesus who he was; and he was not able for the pressure of the crowd, because Zacchaeus was little of stature.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:13
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:14
verses.text: And he hastened, and went before Jesus, and went up into an unripe fig  tree to see Jesus: for he was to pass thus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:15
verses.text: And when Jesus came to that place, he saw him, and said unto him, Make haste, and come down, Zacchaeus:  to-day I must be in thy house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:16
verses.text: And he hastened, and came down, and received  him joyfully.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:17
verses.text: And when they all saw, they murmured, and said, He hath gone in  and lodged with a man that is a sinner.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:18
verses.text: So Zacchaeus stood, and said unto Jesus, My Lord, now half of my possessions I give to the poor, and what I have unjustly  taken from every man I give him fourfold.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:19
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Today is salvation  come to this house, because this man also is a son of Abraham.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:20
verses.text: For the Son of man came to seek and save the thing that was lost.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:21
verses.text: And when Jesus went out of Jericho, he and his disciples, there came after him  a great multitude.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:22
verses.text: And there was a blind man sitting by the way side begging.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:23
verses.text: And his name was Timaeus, the son of Timaeus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:24
verses.text: And he heard the sound of the  multitude passing, and asked, Who is this? They said unto him, Jesus the Nazarene  passeth by.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:25
verses.text: And when he heard that it was Jesus, he called out with a loud  voice, and said, Jesus, son of David, have mercy on me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:26
verses.text: And those that went before Jesus were rebuking him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried the  more, and said, Son of David, have mercy on me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:27
verses.text: And Jesus stood, and commanded that they should call him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:28
verses.text: And they called the blind man, and said unto  him, Be of good courage, and rise; for, behold, he calleth thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:29
verses.text: And the blind  man threw away his garment, and rose, and came to Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:30
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, What dost thou wish that I should do unto thee? And that blind man said unto him, My Lord and Master, that my eyes may be opened, so that I may see thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:31
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:32
verses.text: And Jesus had compassion on him, and touched his eyes, and said unto  him, See; for thy faith hath saved thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:33
verses.text: And immediately he received his sight, and came after him, and praised God; and all the people that saw praised God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:34
verses.text: And he spake a parable because he was nearing Jerusalem, and they supposed  that at that time the kingdom of God was about to appear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:35
verses.text: He said unto them, A man, a son of a great race, went into a far country, to receive a kingdom, and  return.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:36
verses.text: And he called his ten servants, and gave them ten shares, and said unto  them, Trade till the time of my coming.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:37
verses.text: But the people of his city hated him, and  sent messengers after him, and said, We will not that this man reign over us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:38
verses.text: And when he had received a kingdom, and returned, he said that the servants to whom he had given the money should be called unto him, that he might know what each  of them had traded.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:39
verses.text: And the first came, and said, My lord, thy share hath gained  ten shares.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:40
verses.text: The king said unto him, Thou good and faithful servant, who hast  been found faithful in a little, be thou set over ten districts.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:41
verses.text: And the second came,  and said, My lord, thy portion hath gained five portions.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:42
verses.text: And he said unto him  also, And thou shalt be set over five districts.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:43
verses.text: And another came, and said, My  lord, here is thy portion, which was with me laid by in a napkin: I feared thee, because thou art a hard man, and takest what thou didst not leave, and seekest  what thou didst not give, and reapest what thou didst not sow.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:44
verses.text: His lord said unto him, From thy mouth shall I judge thee, thou wicked and idle servant, who wast untrustworthy.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:45
verses.text: Thou knewest that I am a hard man, and take what I did not  leave, and reap what I did not sow: why didst thou not put my money at usury,  and so I might come and seek it, with its gains? And he said unto those that were standing in front of him, Take from him the share, and give it to him that hath ,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:46
verses.text: ten shares.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:47
verses.text: They said unto him, Our lord, he hath ten shares.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:48
verses.text: He said unto them, I say unto you, Every one that hath shall be given unto; and  he that hath not, that which he hath also shall be taken from him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 32:49
verses.text: And those mine enemies who would not that I should reign over them, bring them, and slay them before me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:1
verses.text: Section XXXII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:2
verses.text: And when Jesus entered Jerusalem, he went up to the temple of God, and found  there oxen and sheep and doves.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:3
verses.text: And when he beheld those that sold and those that bought, and the money-changers sitting, he made for himself a scourge of rope, and drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep and the oxen, and the money-changers; and he threw down their money, and upset their tables, and the seats of  them that sold the doves; and he was teaching, and saying unto them, Is it not written, My house is a house of prayer for all peoples? and ye have made it a den  for robbers.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:4
verses.text: And he said unto those that sold the doves, Take this hence, and  make not my Father's house a house of merchandise.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:5
verses.text: And he suffered not any  one to carry vessels inside the temple.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:6
verses.text: And his disciples remembered the scripture,  The zeal of thy house hath eaten me up.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:7
verses.text: The Jews answered and said unto him,  What sign hast thou shewn us, that thou doest this? Jesus answered and said unto  them, Destroy this temple, and I shall raise it in three days.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:8
verses.text: The Jews said unto him, This temple was built in forty-six years, and wilt thou raise it in three days?  But he spake unto them of the temple of his body, that when they destroyed it, he  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:9
verses.text: would raise it in three days.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:10
verses.text: When therefore he rose from among the dead, his disciples remembered that he said this; and they believed the scriptures, and the word that Jesus spake.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:11
verses.text: And when Jesus sat down over against the treasury, he observed how the multitudes were casting their offerings into the treasury: and many rich men were ,  throwing in much.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:12
verses.text: And there came a poor widow, and cast in two mites.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:13
verses.text: And Jesus called his disciples, and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, This poor  widow cast into the treasury more than all the people: and all of these cast into the place of the offering of God of the superfluity of their wealth; while this woman of her want threw in all that she possessed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:14
verses.text: And he spake unto them this parable, concerning people who trusted in themselves  that they are righteous, and despised every man: Two men went up to the  temple to pray; one of them a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:15
verses.text: And the Pharisee stood apart, and prayed thus, O Lord, I thank thee, since I am not like the rest of men, the unjust, the profligate, the extortioners, or even like this publican;  but I fast two days a week, and tithe all my possessions.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:16
verses.text: And the publican was  standing at a distance, and he would not even lift up his eyes to heaven, but was  beating upon his breast, and saying, O Lord, have mercy on me, me the sinner.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:17
verses.text: I say unto you, that this man went down justified to his house more than the Pharisee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:18
verses.text: Every one that exalteth himself shall be abased; and every one that abaseth himself shall be exalted.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:19
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:20
verses.text: And when eventide was come, he left all the people, and went outside the  city to Bethany, he and his twelve, and he remained there.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:21
verses.text: And all the people, because they knew the place, came to him, and he received them; and them that  had need of healing he healed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:22
verses.text: And on the morning of the next day, when he returned  to the city from Bethany, he hungered.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:23
verses.text: And he saw a fig tree at a distance on the beaten highway, having on it leaves.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:24
verses.text: And he came unto it, expecting to find something on it; and when he came, he found nothing on it but the leavesâ€”it was not  the season of figsâ€”and he said unto it, Henceforward for ever let no man eat fruit of thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:25
verses.text: And his disciples heard.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:26
verses.text: And they came to Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:27
verses.text: And there was there a man of the Pharisees,  named Nicodemus, ruler of the Jews.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:28
verses.text: This man came unto Jesus by night, and said unto him, My Master, we know that thou hast been sent from God as a teacher; and no man can do these signs that thou doest, except him whom God is  with.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:29
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, If a man  be not born a second time, he cannot see the kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:30
verses.text: Nicodemus said unto him, How can a man who is old be born? can he, think you, return again to  his mother's womb a second time, to enter and be born? Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, If a man be not born of water and the Spirit,  he cannot enter the kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:31
verses.text: For he that is born of flesh is flesh; and he that  is born of Spirit is spirit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:32
verses.text: Wonder not that I said unto thee that ye must be born a  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:33
verses.text: second time.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:34
verses.text: The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest its voice, but thou knowest not from what place it cometh, nor whither it goeth: so  is every man that is born of the Spirit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:35
verses.text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him,  How can that be? Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou teaching Israel,  and yet knowest not these things? Verily, verily, I say unto thee, What we know  we say, and what we have seen we witness: and ye receive not our witness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:36
verses.text: If I said unto you what is on earth, and ye believed not, how then, if I say unto you  what is in heaven, will ye believe? And no man hath ascended up into heaven, except him that descended from heaven, the Son of man, which is in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:37
verses.text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so is the Son of man to be  lifted up; so that every man who may believe in him may not perish, but have  eternal life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:38
verses.text: God so loved the world, that he should give his only Son; and so every one that believeth on him should not perish, but should have eternal life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:39
verses.text: God sent not his Son into the world to judge the world; but that the world might  be saved by his hand.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:40
verses.text: He that believeth in him shall not be judged: but he that believeth not is condemned beforehand, because he hath not believed in the name  of the only Son, the Son of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:41
verses.text: This is the judgement, that the light came into the world, and men loved the darkness more than the light; because their deeds  were evil.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:42
verses.text: Whosoever doeth evil deeds hateth the light, and cometh not to the  light, lest his deeds be reproved.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 33:43
verses.text: But he that doeth the truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be known, that they have been done in God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:1
verses.text: Section XXXIII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:2
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:3
verses.text: And when evening came, Jesus went forth outside of the city, he and his  disciples.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:4
verses.text: And as they passed in the morning, the disciples saw that fig tree  withered away from its root.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:5
verses.text: And they passed by, and said, How did the fig tree dry  up immediately? And Simon remembered, and said unto him, My Master, behold,  that fig tree which thou didst curse hath dried up.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:6
verses.text: And Jesus answered and said  unto them, Let there be in you the faith of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:7
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, if ye believe, and doubt not in your hearts, and assure yourselves that that will be which  ye say, ye shall have what ye say.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:8
verses.text: And if ye say to this mountain, Remove, and  fall into the sea, it shall be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:9
verses.text: And all that ye ask God in prayer, and believe, he ,  will give you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:10
verses.text: And the apostles said unto our Lord, Increase our faith.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:11
verses.text: He said unto them, If there be in you faith like a grain of mustard, ye shall say to this fig tree, Be thou torn up, and be thou planted in the sea; and it will obey you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:12
verses.text: Who of you hath a servant driving a yoke of oxen or tending sheep, and if he  come from the field, will say unto him straightway, Go and sit down? Nay, he will say unto him, Make ready for me wherewith I may sup, and gird thy waist, and serve me, till I eat and drink; and afterwards thou shalt eat and drink also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:13
verses.text: Doth that servant haply, who did what he was bid, receive his praise? I think  not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:14
verses.text: So ye also, when ye have done all that ye were bid, say, We are idle servants; what it was our duty to do, we have done.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:15
verses.text: For this reason I say unto you, Whatever ye pray and ask, believe that ye  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:16
verses.text: receive, and ye shall have.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:17
verses.text: And when ye stand to pray, forgive what is in your heart against any man; and your Father which is in heaven will  forgive you also your wrong-doings.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:18
verses.text: But if ye forgive not men their wrong-doings, neither will your Father forgive you also your wrong-doings.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:19
verses.text: And he spake unto them a parable also, that they should pray at all times, and  not be slothful: There was a judge in a city, who feared not God, nor was ashamed  for men: and there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, and said,  Avenge me of mine adversary.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:20
verses.text: And he would not for a long time: but afterwards he said within himself, If of God I have no fear, and before men I have no shame;  yet because this widow vexeth me, I will avenge her, that she come not at all times ,  and annoy me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:21
verses.text: And our Lord said, Hear ye what the judge of injustice said.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:22
verses.text: And shall not God still more do vengeance for his elect, who call upon him in the night  and in the day, and grant them respite? I say unto you, He will do vengeance for them speedily.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:23
verses.text: Thinkest thou the Son of man will come and find faith on the earth?  ,  And they came again to Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:24
verses.text: And it came to pass, on one of the days, as Jesus was walking in the temple, and teaching the people, and preaching the  gospel, that the chief priests and the scribes with the elders came upon him, and said unto him, Tell us: By what power doest thou this? and who gave thee this  power to do that? And Jesus said unto them, I also will ask you one word, and if  ye tell me, I also shall tell you by what power I do that.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:25
verses.text: The baptism of John, from  what place is it? from heaven or of men? Tell me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:26
verses.text: And they reflected within themselves, Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:27
verses.text: and said, If we shall say unto him, From heaven; he will say unto  us, For what reason did ye not believe him? But if we shall say, Of men;  we fear that the people will stone us, all of them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:28
verses.text: And all of them were holding  to John, that he was a true prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:29
verses.text: They answered and said unto him, We know  not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:30
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you also by what power I work.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:31
verses.text: What think ye? A man had two sons; and he went to the first, and said unto him, My  son, go to-day, and till in the vineyard.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:32
verses.text: And he answered and said, I do not wish  to: but finally he repented, and went.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:33
verses.text: And he went to the other, and said unto  him likewise.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:34
verses.text: And he answered and said, Yea, my lord: and went not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:35
verses.text: Which of these two did the will of his father? They said unto him, The first.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:36
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Verily I say unto you, The publicans and harlots go before you into  the kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:37
verses.text: John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not; but the publicans and harlots believed him; and ye, not even when ye saw, did ye repent at last, that ye might believe in him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:38
verses.text: Hear another parable: A man was a householder, and planted a vineyard, and surrounded it with a hedge, and digged in it a winepress, and built in it a tower, ,  and gave it to husbandmen, and went to a distance for a long time.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:39
verses.text: So when the time of the fruits came, he sent his servants unto the husbandmen, that they might  send him of the produce of his vineyard.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:40
verses.text: And those husbandmen beat him, and  sent him away empty.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:41
verses.text: And he sent unto them another servant also; and they  stoned him, and wounded him, and sent him away with shameful handling.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:42
verses.text: And he sent again another; and they slew him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:43
verses.text: And he sent many other servants unto  them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:44
verses.text: And the husbandmen took his servants, and one they beat, and another they  stoned, and another they slew.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:45
verses.text: So he sent again other servants more than the first; and  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:46
verses.text: they did likewise with them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:47
verses.text: So the owner of the vineyard said, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: it may be they will see him and be ,  ashamed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:48
verses.text: So at last he sent unto them his beloved son that he had.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:49
verses.text: But the husbandmen, when they saw the son, said amongst themselves, This is the heir.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:50
verses.text: ,  And they said, We will slay him, and so the inheritance will be ours.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:51
verses.text: So they took  him, and put him forth without the vineyard, and slew him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:52
verses.text: When then the lord  of the vineyard shall come, what will he do with those husbandmen? They said unto him, He will destroy them in the worst of ways, and give the vineyard to  other husbandmen, who will give him fruit in its season.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:53
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Have ye never read in the scripture,  The stone which the builders declared to be base,  The same came to be at the head of the corner:   From God was this,  And it is wonderful in our eyes?   Therefore I say unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and  given to a people that will produce fruit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:54
verses.text: And whosoever falleth on this stone shall be broken in pieces: but on whomsoever it falleth, it will grind him to  powder.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:55
verses.text: And when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they  perceived that it was concerning them he spake.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 34:56
verses.text: And they sought to seize him; and they feared the multitude, because they were holding to him as the prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:1
verses.text: Section XXXIV.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:2
verses.text: Then went the Pharisees and considered how they might ensnare him in a word,  and deliver him into the power of the judge, and into the power of the ruler.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:3
verses.text: And they sent unto him their disciples, with the kinsfolk of Herod; and they said unto him, Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:4
verses.text: Teacher, we know that thou speakest the truth, and teachest the way of God with equity, and art not lifted up by any man: for thou actest not so as to  be seen of any man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:5
verses.text: Tell us now, What is thy opinion? Is it lawful that we should  pay the tribute to Caesar, or not? shall we give, or shall we not give? But Jesus knew  their deceit, and said unto them, Why tempt ye me, ye hypocrites? Shew me the  penny of the tribute.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:6
verses.text: So they brought unto him a penny.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:7
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, To whom belongeth this image and inscription? They said unto him, To Caesar.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:8
verses.text: ,  He said unto them, Give what is Caesar's to Caesar, and what is God's to God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:9
verses.text: And they could not make him slip in a single word before the people; and they marvelled at his word, and refrained.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:10
verses.text: And on that day came the Sadducees, and said unto him, There is no life for  the dead.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:11
verses.text: And they asked him, and said unto him, Teacher, Moses said unto us, If a man die, not having children, let his brother take his wife, and raise up seed  for his brother.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:12
verses.text: Now there were with us seven brethren: and the first took a wife,  and died without children; and the second took his wife, and died without children;  and the third also took her; and in like manner the seven of them also, and they ,  died without leaving children.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:13
verses.text: And last of them all the woman died also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:14
verses.text: At the resurrection, then, which of these seven shall have this woman? for all of them took  her.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:15
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Is it not for this that ye have erred,  because ye know not the scriptures, nor the power of God? And the sons of this  world take wives, and the women become the men's; but those that have become worthy of that world, and the resurrection from among the dead, do not take  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:16
verses.text: wives, and the women also do not become the men's.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:17
verses.text: Nor is it possible that they should die; but they are like the angels, and are the children of  God, because they have become the children of the resurrection.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:18
verses.text: For in the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read in the book of Moses, how from the bush God said unto him, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?  And God is not the God of the dead, but of the living: for all of them are alive with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:19
verses.text: And ye have erred greatly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:20
verses.text: ,  And when the multitudes heard, they were wondering at his teaching.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:21
verses.text: And  some of the scribes answered and said unto him, Teacher, thou hast well said.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:22
verses.text: But the rest of the Pharisees, when they saw his silencing the Sadducees on this point, gathered against him to contend with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:23
verses.text: And one of the scribes, of those that knew the law, when he saw the excellence  of his answer to them, desired to try him, and said unto him, What shall I do to inherit eternal life? and, Which of the commandments is greater, and has precedence  in the law? Jesus said unto him, The first of all the commandments is, Hear, O  Israel; The Lord our God, the Lord is one: and thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy thought, and with all thy ,  strength.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:24
verses.text: This is the great and preÃ«minent commandment.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:25
verses.text: And the second, which is like it, is, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:26
verses.text: And another commandment  greater than these two there is not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:27
verses.text: On these two commandments, then, are hung the  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:28
verses.text: law and the prophets.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:29
verses.text: That scribe said unto him, Excellent! my Master; thou hast said truly that he is one, and there is no other outside of him:  and that a man should love him with all his heart, and with all his thought, and with all his soul, and with all his strength, and that he should love his neighbour as  himself, is better than all savours and sacrifices.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:30
verses.text: And Jesus saw him that he had answered wisely; and he answered and said unto him, Thou art not far from the ,  kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:31
verses.text: Thou hast spoken rightly: do this, and thou shalt live.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:32
verses.text: And he, as his desire was to justify himself, said unto him, And who is my neighbour?  Jesus said unto him, A man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho; and the robbers fell upon him, and stripped him, and beat him, his life remaining in him but little,  and went away.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:33
verses.text: And it happened that there came down a certain priest that way;  and he saw him, and passed by.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:34
verses.text: And likewise a Levite also came and reached  that place, and saw him, and passed by.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:35
verses.text: And a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed,  came to the place where he was, and saw him, and had compassion on him, and came near, and bound up his strokes, and poured on them wine and oil; and he set him on the ass, and brought him to the inn, and expended his care upon him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:36
verses.text: And on the morrow of that day he took out two pence, and gave them to the innkeeper, and said unto him, Care for him; and if thou spendest upon him more,  when I return, I shall give thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:37
verses.text: Who of these three now, thinkest thou, is nearest  to him that fell among the robbers? And he said unto him, He that had compassion  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:38
verses.text: on him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:39
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Go, and do thou also likewise.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:40
verses.text: And no man dared afterwards to ask him anything.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:41
verses.text: And he was teaching every day in the temple.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:42
verses.text: But the chief priests and scribes and the elders of the people sought to destroy him: and they could not find what  they should do with him; and all the people were hanging upon him to hear him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:43
verses.text: And many of the multitude believed on him, and said, The Messiah, when he  cometh, can it be that he will do more than these signs that this man doeth? And the Pharisees heard the multitudes say that of him; and the chief priests sent  officers to seize him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:44
verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, I am with you but a short time  yet, and I go to him that sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:45
verses.text: And ye shall seek me, and shall not find me:  and where I shall be, ye shall not be able to come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 35:46
verses.text: The Jews said within themselves, Whither hath this man determined to go that we shall not be able to find him? can it be that he is determined to go to the regions of the nations, and teach  the heathen? What is this word that he said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, ye cannot come?.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:1
verses.text: Section XXXV.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:2
verses.text: And on the great day, which is the last of the feast, Jesus stood, crying out and  saying, If any man is thirsty, let him come unto me, and drink.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:3
verses.text: Every one that believeth in me, as the scriptures said, there shall flow from his belly rivers of pure  water.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:4
verses.text: He said that referring to the Spirit, which those who believed in him were to receive: for the Spirit was not yet granted; and because Jesus had not yet been  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:5
verses.text: glorified.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:6
verses.text: And many of the multitude that heard his words said, This is  in truth the prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:7
verses.text: And others said, This is the Messiah.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:8
verses.text: But others  said, Can it be that the Messiah will come from Galilee? Hath not the scripture said that from the seed of David, and from Bethlehem, the village of David, the  Messiah cometh? And there occurred a dissension in the multitude because of him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:9
verses.text: And some of them were wishing to seize him; but no man laid a hand upon him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:10
verses.text: And those officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees: and the priests said  unto them, Why did ye not bring him? The officers said, Never spake man thus  as speaketh this man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:11
verses.text: The Pharisees said unto them, Perhaps ye also have gone ,  astray? Hath any of the rulers or the Pharisees haply believed in him? except  this people which knows not the law; they are accursed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:12
verses.text: Nicodemus, one of them,  he that had come to Jesus by night, said unto them, Doth our law haply condemn  a man, except it hear him first and know what he hath done? They answered and said unto him, Art thou also haply from Galilee? Search, and see that a prophet riseth not from Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:13
verses.text: ,  And when the Pharisees assembled, Jesus asked them, and said, What say ye of  the Messiah? whose son is he? They said unto him, The son of David.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:14
verses.text: He said unto them, And how doth David in the Holy Spirit call him Lord? for he said,   The Lord said unto my Lord,  Sit on my right hand,  That I may put thine enemies under thy feet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:15
verses.text: ,  If then David calleth him Lord, how is he his son? And no one was able to answer him; and no man dared from that day again to ask him of anything.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:16
verses.text: And Jesus addressed them again, and said, I am the light of the world; and he that  followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall find the light of life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:17
verses.text: The Pharisees Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:18
verses.text: said unto him, Thou bearest witness to thyself; thy witness is not true.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:19
verses.text: Jesus  answered and said unto them, If I bear witness to myself, my witness is true; for I know whence I came, and whither I go; but ye know not whence I came, or ,  whither I go.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:20
verses.text: And ye judge after the flesh; and I judge no man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:21
verses.text: And even if I judge, my judgement is true; because I am not alone, but I and my Father which ,  sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:22
verses.text: And in your law it is written, that the witness of two men is true.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:23
verses.text: I am he that beareth witness to myself, and my Father which sent me beareth witness to  me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:24
verses.text: They said unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered and said unto them, Ye know not me, nor my Father: for did ye know me, ye would know my  Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:25
verses.text: He said these sayings in the treasury, where he was teaching in the  temple: and no man seized him; because his hour had not yet come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:26
verses.text: Jesus said unto them again, I go truly, and ye shall seek me and not find me, and ye shall die  in your sins: and where I go, ye cannot come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:27
verses.text: The Jews said, Will he haply kill  himself, that he saith, Where I go, ye cannot come? He said unto them, Ye are from below; and I am from above: ye are of this world; and I am not of this  world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:28
verses.text: I said unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: if ye believe not that I am  he, ye shall die in your sins.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:29
verses.text: The Jews said, And thou, who art thou? Jesus said  unto them, If I should begin to speak unto you, I have concerning you many words and judgement: but he that sent me is true; and I, what I heard from him is what ,  I say in the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:30
verses.text: And they knew not that he meant by that the Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:31
verses.text: Jesus Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:32
verses.text: said unto them again, When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then ye shall know that I am he: and I do nothing of myself, but as my Father  taught me, so I speak.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:33
verses.text: And he that sent me is with me; and my Father hath not  left me alone; because I do what is pleasing to him at all times.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:34
verses.text: And while he was saying that, many believed in him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:35
verses.text: And Jesus said to those Jews that believed in him, If ye abide in my words, truly  ye are my disciples; and ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:36
verses.text: They said unto him, We are the seed of Abraham, and have never served any man  in the way of slavery: how then sayest thou, Ye shall be free children? Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Every one that doeth a sin is a slave of  sin.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:37
verses.text: And the slave doth not remain for ever in the house; but the son remaineth ,  for ever.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:38
verses.text: And if the Son set you free, truly ye shall be free children.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:39
verses.text: I know that ye are the seed of Abraham; but ye seek to slay me, because ye are unable for my  word.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:40
verses.text: And what I saw with my Father, I say: and what ye saw with your father,  ye do.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:41
verses.text: They answered and said unto him, Our father is Abraham.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:42
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, If ye were the children of Abraham, ye would do the deeds of Abraham.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:43
verses.text: Now, behold, ye seek to kill me, a man that speak with you the truth, that I  heard from God: this did Abraham not do.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:44
verses.text: And ye do the deeds of your father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:45
verses.text: They said unto him, We were not born of fornication; we have one Father, who is  God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:46
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, ye would love me: I proceeded and came from God; and it was not of my own self that I came, but he sent  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:47
verses.text: me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:48
verses.text: Why then do ye not know my word? Because ye cannot hear my word.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:49
verses.text: Ye are from the father, the devil, and the lust of your father do ye desire to do, who from the beginning is a slayer of men, and in the truth standeth not, because the truth is not in him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:50
verses.text: And when he speaketh untruth, he speaketh from  himself: for he is a liar, and the father of untruth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:51
verses.text: And I who speak the truth, ye  believe me not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:52
verses.text: Who of you rebuketh me for a sin? And if I speak the truth, ye  do not believe me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:53
verses.text: Whosoever is of God heareth the words of God: therefore do  ye not hear, because ye are not of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:54
verses.text: The Jews answered and said unto him,  Did we not say well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast demons? Jesus said unto them, As for me, I have not a devil; but my Father do I honour, and ye dishonour  me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 36:55
verses.text: I seek not my glory: here is one who seeketh and judgeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:1
verses.text: Section XXXVI.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:2
verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever keepeth my word shall not see death  for ever.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:3
verses.text: The Jews said unto him, Now we know that thou hast demons.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:4
verses.text: Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, Whosoever keepeth my word shall not  taste death for ever.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:5
verses.text: Art thou haply greater than our father Abraham, who is  dead, and than the prophets, which are dead? whom makest thou thyself? Jesus said unto them, If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing: my Father is he that  glorifieth me; of whom ye say, that he is our God; and yet ye have not known him: but I know him; and if I should say that I know him not, I should become  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:6
verses.text: a liar like you: but I know him, and keep his word.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:7
verses.text: Abraham your father  longed to see my day; and he saw, and rejoiced.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:8
verses.text: The Jews said unto him,  Thou art now not fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham? Jesus said unto  them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:9
verses.text: And they take stones to stone him: but Jesus concealed himself, and went out of the temple.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:10
verses.text: And he passed through them, and went his way.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:11
verses.text: And as he passed, he saw a man blind from his mother's womb.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:12
verses.text: And his  disciples asked him, and said, Our Master, who sinned, this man, or his parents, so  that he was born blind? Jesus said unto them, Neither did he sin, nor his parents:  but that the works of God may be seen in him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:13
verses.text: It is incumbent on me to do the deeds of him that sent me, while it is day: a night will come, and no man will be  able to busy himself.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:14
verses.text: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:15
verses.text: And when he said that, he spat upon the ground, and made clay of his spittle, and  smeared it on the eyes of the blind man, and said unto him, Go and wash thyself in  the pool of Siloam.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:16
verses.text: And he went and washed, and came seeing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:17
verses.text: And his neighbours, which saw him of old begging, said, Is not this he that was sitting begging?  And some said, It is he; and others said, Nay, but he resembles him much.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:18
verses.text: He ,  said, I am he.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:19
verses.text: They said unto him, How then were thine eyes opened? He answered and said unto them, A man named Jesus made clay, and smeared it on my eyes, and said unto me, Go and wash in the water of Siloam: and I went and  washed, and received sight.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:20
verses.text: They said unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:21
verses.text: ,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:22
verses.text: And they brought him that was previously blind to the Pharisees.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:23
verses.text: And the day in which Jesus made clay and opened with it his eyes was a sabbath  day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:24
verses.text: And again the Pharisees asked him, How didst thou receive sight? And he said  unto them, He put clay on mine eyes, and I washed, and received sight.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:25
verses.text: The people of the Pharisees said, This man is not from God, for he keepeth not the sabbath.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:26
verses.text: And others said, How can a man that is a sinner do these signs? And there came  to be a division amongst them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:27
verses.text: And again they said to that blind man, Thou, then, what sayest thou of him that opened for thee thine eyes? He said unto them,  I say that he is a prophet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:28
verses.text: And the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he was blind, and received sight, until they summoned the parents of him who received  sight, and asked them, Is this your son, of whom ye said that he was born blind?  how then, behold, doth he now see? His parents answered and said, We know  that this is our son, and that he was born blind: but how he has come to see now, or who it is that opened his eyes, we know not: and he also has reached his prime;  ask him, and he will speak for himself.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:29
verses.text: This said his parents, because they were fearing the Jews: and the Jews decided, that if any man should confess of him that  he was the Messiah, they would put him out of the synagogue.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:30
verses.text: For this reason  said his parents, He hath reached his prime; ask him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:31
verses.text: And they called the man a second time, him that was blind, and said unto him, Praise God: we know that this  man is a sinner.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:32
verses.text: He answered and said unto them, Whether he be a sinner, I know  not: I know one thing, that I was blind, and I now see.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:33
verses.text: They said unto him again,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:34
verses.text: What did he unto thee? how opened he for thee thine eyes? He said unto them, I said unto you, and ye did not hear: what wish ye further to hear?  ye also, do ye wish to become disciples to him? And they reviled him, and said unto him, Thou art the disciple of that man; but as for us, we are the disciples of  Moses.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:35
verses.text: And we know that God spake unto Moses: but this man, we know not  whence he is.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:36
verses.text: The man answered and said unto them, From this is the wonder,  because ye know not whence he is, and mine eyes hath he opened.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:37
verses.text: And we know that God heareth not the voice of sinners: but whosoever feareth him, and doeth  his will, him he heareth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:38
verses.text: From eternity hath it not been heard of, that a man  opened the eyes of a blind man, who had been born in blindness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:39
verses.text: If then this man  were not from God, he could not do that.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:40
verses.text: They answered and said unto him, Thou wast all of thee born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they put him forth without.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:41
verses.text: And Jesus heard of his being put forth without, and found him, and said unto  him, Dost thou believe in the Son of God? He that was made whole answered  and said, Who is he, my Lord, that I may believe in him? Jesus said unto him,  Thou hast seen him, and he that speaketh to thee is he.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:42
verses.text: And he said, I believe, my Lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 37:43
verses.text: And he fell down worshipping him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:1
verses.text: Section XXXVII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:2
verses.text: And Jesus said, To judge the world am I come, so that they that see not may  see, and they that see may become blind.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:3
verses.text: And some of the Pharisees which were  with him heard that, and they said unto him, Can it be that we are blind? Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye should not have sin: but now ye say, We see: and because of this your sin remaineth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:4
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:5
verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever entereth not into the fold of the sheep by the door, but goeth up from another place, that man is a thief and a ,  stealer.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:6
verses.text: But he that entereth by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:7
verses.text: And therefore the keeper of the door openeth for him the door; and the sheep hear his voice: and  he calleth his sheep by their names, and they go forth unto him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:8
verses.text: And when he putteth forth his sheep, he goeth before them, and his sheep follow him: because  they know his voice.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:9
verses.text: And after a stranger will the sheep not go, but they flee from  him: because they hear not the voice of a stranger.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:10
verses.text: This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they knew not what he was saying unto them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:11
verses.text: Jesus said unto them again, Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the  sheep.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:12
verses.text: And all that came are thieves and stealers: but the sheep heard them not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:13
verses.text: I am the door: and if a man enter by me, he shall live, and shall go in and go out,  and shall find pasture.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:14
verses.text: And the stealer cometh not, save that he may steal, and kill, and destroy: but I came that they might have life, and that they might have  the thing that is better.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:15
verses.text: I am the good shepherd; and the good shepherd giveth  himself for his sheep.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:16
verses.text: But the hireling, who is not a shepherd, and whose the sheep are not, when he seeth the wolf as it cometh, leaveth the sheep, and fleeth,  and the wolf cometh, and snatcheth away the sheep, and scattereth them: and the  hireling fleeth because he is an hireling, and hath no care for the sheep.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:17
verses.text: I am the  good shepherd; and I know what is mine, and what is mine knoweth me, as my Father knoweth me, and I know my Father; and I give myself for the sheep.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:18
verses.text: And I have other sheep also, that are not of this flock: them also I must invite, and they shall hear my voice; and all the sheep shall be one, and the shepherd one.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:19
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:20
verses.text: And therefore doth my Father love me, because I give my life, that I may  take it again.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:21
verses.text: No man taketh it from me, but I leave it of my own choice.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:22
verses.text: And I have the right to leave it, and have the right also to take it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:23
verses.text: And this commandment did I receive of my Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:24
verses.text: And there occurred a disagreement among the Jews because of these sayings.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:25
verses.text: And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is afflicted with madness; why listen  ye to him? And others said, These sayings are not those of men possessed with demons.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:26
verses.text: Can a demon haply open the eyes of a blind man?  ,  And the feast of the dedication came on at Jerusalem: and it was winter.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:27
verses.text: And  Jesus was walking in the temple in the porch of Solomon.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:28
verses.text: The Jews therefore surrounded him, and said unto him, Until when dost thou make our hearts anxious?  If thou art the Messiah, tell us plainly.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:29
verses.text: He answered and said unto them, I told you, and ye believe not: and the deeds that I do in my Father's name bear witness ,  to me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:30
verses.text: But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep, as I said unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:31
verses.text: And my sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they come after me: and I give them eternal life; and they shall not perish for ever, nor shall any man snatch  them out of my hands.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:32
verses.text: For the Father, who hath given them unto me, is greater  than all; and no man is able to take them from the hand of my Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:33
verses.text: I and ,  my Father are one.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:34
verses.text: And the Jews took stones to stone him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:35
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Many good deeds from my Father have I shewed you; because of which of them,  then, do ye stone me? The Jews said unto him, Not for the good deeds do we stone thee, but because thou blasphemest; and, whilst thou art a man, makest thyself  God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:36
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Is it not thus written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:37
verses.text: And if he called those godsâ€”for to them came the word of God (and it is  not possible in the scripture that anything should be undone)â€”he then, whom the Father hath sanctified and sent into the world, do ye say that he blasphemeth;  because I said unto you, I am the Son of God? If then I do not the deeds of my  Father, ye believe me not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:38
verses.text: But if I do, even if ye believe not me, believe the deeds: that ye may know and believe that my Father is in me, and I in my Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:39
verses.text: And they sought again to take him: and he went forth out of their hands.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:40
verses.text: And he went beyond Jordan to the place where John was baptizing formerly;  and abode there.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:41
verses.text: And many people came unto him; and they said, John did not  work even one sign: but all that John said of this man is truth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:42
verses.text: And many believed in him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:43
verses.text: And there was a sick man, named Lazarus, of the village of Bethany, the brother  of Mary and Martha.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:44
verses.text: And Mary was she that anointed with sweet ointment the feet of Jesus, and wiped them with her hair; and Lazarus, who was sick, was the  brother of this woman.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:45
verses.text: And his sisters sent unto Jesus, and said unto him, Our  Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:46
verses.text: But Jesus said, This sickness is not unto death, but for the glorifying of God, that the Son of God may be glorified ,  because of it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:47
verses.text: And Jesus loved Martha, and Mary, and Lazarus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:48
verses.text: And when he  heard that he was sick, he abode in the place where he was two days.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:49
verses.text: And after that,  he said unto his disciples, Come, let us go into Judaea.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:50
verses.text: His disciples said unto him, Our Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:51
verses.text: Master, now the Jews desire to stone thee; and goest thou again thither? ,  Jesus said unto them, Is not the day of twelve hours? If then a man walk in the day, he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:52
verses.text: But if  a man walk in the night, he stumbleth, because there is no lamp in him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:53
verses.text: This said Jesus: and after that, he said unto them, Lazarus our friend hath fallen asleep; but  I am going to awaken him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:54
verses.text: His disciples said unto him, Our Lord, if he hath  fallen asleep, he will recover.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:55
verses.text: But Jesus said that concerning his death: while they  supposed that he spake of lying down to sleep.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:56
verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them plainly,  Lazarus is dead.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:57
verses.text: And I am glad that I was not there for your sakes, that ye may  believe; but let us go thither.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 38:58
verses.text: Thomas, who is called Thama, said to the disciples, his companions, Let us also go, and die with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:1
verses.text: Section XXXVIII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:2
verses.text: ,  And Jesus came to Bethany, and found him already four days in the grave.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:3
verses.text: And Bethany was beside Jerusalem, and its distance from it was a sum of fifteen furlongs;  and many of the Jews came unto Mary and Martha, to comfort their heart  because of their brother.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:4
verses.text: And Martha, when she heard that Jesus had come, went  out to meet him: but Mary was sitting in the house.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:5
verses.text: Martha then said unto Jesus,  My Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:6
verses.text: But I know now that,  whatever thou shalt ask of God, he will give thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:7
verses.text: Jesus said unto her, Thy brother shall  rise.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:8
