verses.text: Martha said unto him, I know that he shall rise in the resurrection at the last day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:9
verses.text: Jesus said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the life: whosoever believeth in  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:10
verses.text: me, even though he die, he shall live: and every living one that believeth  in me shall never die.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:11
verses.text: Believest thou this? She said unto him, Yea, my Lord: I believe that thou art the Messiah, the Son of God, that cometh into the  world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:12
verses.text: And when she had said that, she went and called Mary her sister secretly,  and said unto her, Our Master hath come, and summoneth thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:13
verses.text: And Mary, when  she heard, rose in haste, and came unto him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:14
verses.text: (And Jesus then had not come into  the village, but was in the place where Martha met him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:15
verses.text: ) And the Jews also that were with her in the house, to comfort her, when they saw that Mary rose up and went out in haste, went after her, because they supposed that she was going to the  tomb to weep.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:16
verses.text: And Mary, when she came to where Jesus was, and saw him, fell at his feet, and said unto him, If thou hadst been here, my Lord, my brother had  not died.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:17
verses.text: And Jesus came; and when he saw her weeping, and the Jews that were  with her weeping, he was troubled in himself, and sighed; and he said, In what  place have ye laid him? And they said unto him, Our Lord, come and see.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:18
verses.text: And  the tears of Jesus came.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:19
verses.text: The Jews therefore said, See the greatness of his love for  him! But some of them said, Could not this man, who opened the eyes of that  blind man, have caused that this man also should not die? And Jesus came to the place of burial, being troubled within himself.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:20
verses.text: And the place of burial was a cave,  and a stone was placed at its door.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:21
verses.text: Jesus therefore said, Take these stones away.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:22
verses.text: Martha, the sister of him that was dead, said unto him, My Lord, he hath come to  stink for some time: he hath been four days dead.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:23
verses.text: Jesus said unto her, Did not I say  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:24
verses.text: unto thee, If thou believest, thou shalt see the glory of God? And they removed those stones.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:25
verses.text: And Jesus lifted his eyes on high, and said, My Father,  I thank thee since thou didst hear me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:26
verses.text: And I know that thou at all times hearest me: but I say this unto thee because of this multitude that is standing, that they  may believe that thou didst send me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:27
verses.text: And when he had said that, he cried with a  loud voice, Lazarus, come forth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:28
verses.text: And that dead man came out, having his hands and feet bound with bandages, and his face wrapped in a scarf.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:29
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Loose him, and let him go.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:30
verses.text: And many of the Jews which came unto Mary, when they saw the deed of Jesus,  believed in him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:31
verses.text: But some of them went to the Pharisees, and informed them of all that Jesus did.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:32
verses.text: And the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered, and said, What shall we do?  for lo, this man doeth many signs.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:33
verses.text: And if we leave him thus, all men will believe  in him: and the Romans will come and take our country and people.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:34
verses.text: And one of them, who was called Caiaphas, the chief priest he was in that year, said unto them,  Ye know not anything, nor consider that it is more advantageous for us that one  man should die instead of the people, and not that the whole people perish.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:35
verses.text: And this he said not of himself: but because he was the chief priest of that year, he  prophesied that Jesus was to die instead of the people; and not instead of the people alone, but that he might gather the scattered children of God together.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:36
verses.text: And from that day they considered how to kill him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:37
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:38
verses.text: And Jesus did not walk openly amongst the Jews, but departed thence to a place near the wilderness, to a town called Ephraim; and he was there, going  about with his disciples.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:39
verses.text: And the passover of the Jews was near: and many went  up from the villages unto Jerusalem before the feast, to purify themselves.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:40
verses.text: And they sought for Jesus, and said one to another in the temple, What think ye of his  holding back from the feast? And the chief priests and the Pharisees had given commandment, that, if any man knew in what place he was, he should reveal it to them, that they might take him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:41
verses.text: And when the days of his going up were accomplished, he prepared himself that  he might go to Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:42
verses.text: And he sent messengers before him, and departed, and  entered into a village of Samaria, that they might make ready for him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:43
verses.text: And they  received him not, because he was prepared for going to Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:44
verses.text: And when James and John his disciples saw it, they said unto him, Our Lord, wilt thou that we speak, and fire come down from heaven, to extirpate them, as did Elijah also?  And Jesus turned, and rebuked them, and said, Ye know not of what spirit ye are.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:45
verses.text: Verily the Son of man did not come to destroy lives, but to give life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 39:46
verses.text: And they went to another village.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:1
verses.text: Section XXXIX.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:2
verses.text: And Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany, where was Lazarus,  whom Jesus raised from among the dead.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:3
verses.text: And they made a feast for him there:  and Martha was serving; while Lazarus was one of them that sat with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:4
verses.text: And  at the time of Jesus' being at Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, great multitudes of the Jews heard that Jesus was there: and they came, not because of Jesus alone, but Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:5
verses.text: that they might look also on Lazarus, whom he raised from among the dead.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:6
verses.text: ,  And the chief priests considered how they might kill Lazarus also; because  many of the Jews were going on his account, and believing in Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:7
verses.text: And Mary took a case of the ointment of fine nard, of great price, and opened it, and poured  it out on the head of Jesus as he was reclining; and she anointed his feet, and wiped them with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:8
verses.text: ,  But Judas Iscariot, one of the disciples, he that was to betray him, said, Why was  not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given unto the poor? This he said, not because of his care for the poor, but because he was a thief, and the chest  was with him, and what was put into it he used to bear.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:9
verses.text: And that displeased the rest of the disciples also within themselves, and they said, Why went this ointment  to waste? It was possible that it should be sold for much, and the poor be given  it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:10
verses.text: And they were angry with Mary.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:11
verses.text: And Jesus perceived it, and said unto them, Leave her; why molest ye her? a good work hath she accomplished on me: for the  day of my burial kept she it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:12
verses.text: At all times the poor are with you, and when ye  wish ye can do them a kindness: but I am not at all times with you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:13
verses.text: And for this cause, when she poured this ointment on my body, it is as if she did it for my burial,  and anointed my body beforehand.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:14
verses.text: And verily I say unto you, In every place where this my gospel shall be proclaimed in all the world, what she did shall be told for a memorial of her.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:15
verses.text: ,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:16
verses.text: And when Jesus said that, he went out leisurely to go to Jerusalem.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:17
verses.text: And when he arrived at Bethphage and at Bethany, beside the mount which is  called the mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of his disciples, and he said unto them, Go  into this village that is opposite you: and when ye enter it, ye shall find an ass tied, and  a colt with him, which no man ever yet mounted: loose him, and bring them unto me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:18
verses.text: And if any man say unto you, Why loose ye them? say unto him thus, We  seek them for our Lord; and straightway send them hither.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:19
verses.text: All this was, that what was said in the prophet might be fulfilled, which said,   Say ye unto the daughter of Zion,  Behold, thy King cometh unto thee,  Meek, and riding upon an ass,  And upon a colt the foal of an ass.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:20
verses.text: And the disciples did not know this at that time: but after that Jesus was glorified, his disciples remembered that these things were written of him, and that this  they had done unto him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:21
verses.text: And when the two disciples went, they found as he had  said unto them, and they did as Jesus charged them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:22
verses.text: And when they loosed them,  their owners said unto them, Why loose ye them? They said unto them, We seek  them for our Lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:23
verses.text: And they let them go.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:24
verses.text: And they brought the ass and the colt,  and they placed on the colt their garments; and Jesus mounted it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:25
verses.text: And most of the multitudes spread their garments on the ground before him: and others cut branches  from the trees, and threw them in the way.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:26
verses.text: And when he neared his descent from Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:27
verses.text: the mount of Olives, all the disciples began to rejoice and to praise God with  a loud voice for all the powers which they had seen; and they said, Praise in the highest; Praise to the Son of David: Blessed is he that cometh in the name  of the Lord; and blessed is the kingdom that cometh, that of our father David: Peace in heaven, and praise in the highest.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:28
verses.text: And a great multitude, that which came to the feast, when they heard that Jesus  was coming to Jerusalem, took young palm branches, and went forth to meet him, and cried and said, Praise: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord, the  King of Israel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:29
verses.text: Certain therefore of the Pharisees from among the multitudes  said unto him, Our Master, rebuke thy disciples.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:30
verses.text: He said unto them, Verily I say unto you, If these were silent, the stones would cry out.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:31
verses.text: ,  And when he drew near, and saw the city, he wept over it, and said, Would that thou hadst known the things that are for thy peace, in this thy day! now that is  hidden from thine eyes.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:32
verses.text: There shall come unto thee days when thine enemies  shall encompass thee, and straiten thee from every quarter, and shall get possession of thee, and thy children within thee; and they shall not leave in thee a stone upon another; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:33
verses.text: And when he entered into Jerusalem, the whole city was agitated, and they said,  Who is this? And the multitudes said, This is Jesus, the prophet that is from Nazareth  of Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:34
verses.text: And the multitude which was with him bare witness that he called  Lazarus from the grave, and raised him from among the dead.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 40:35
verses.text: And for this cause great multitudes went out to meet him, because they heard the sign which he did.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:1
verses.text: Section XL.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:2
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:3
verses.text: And when Jesus entered the temple, they brought unto him blind and  lame: and he healed them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:4
verses.text: But when the chief priests and the Pharisees saw the wonders that he did, and the children that were crying in the temple and  saying, Praise be to the Son of David: it distressed them, and they said, Hearest thou not what these say? Jesus said unto them, Yea: did ye not read long ago, From  the mouths of children and infants thou hast chosen my praise? And the Pharisees said one to another, Behold, do ye not see that nothing availeth us? for lo, the whole world hath followed him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:5
verses.text: And there were among them certain Gentiles also, which had come up to worship  at the feast: these therefore came to Philip, who was of Bethsaida of Galilee,  and asked him, and said unto him, My lord, we wish to see Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:6
verses.text: And Philip  came and told Andrew: and Andrew and Philip told Jesus.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:7
verses.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, The hour is come nigh, in which the Son of man is to be glorified.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:8
verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, A grain of wheat, if it fall not and die in the  earth, remaineth alone; but if it die, it beareth much fruit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:9
verses.text: He that loveth his life destroyeth it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto the life eternal.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:10
verses.text: If a man serve me, he will follow me; and where I am, there shall my servant be  also: and whosoever serveth me, the Father will honour him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:11
verses.text: Now is my soul troubled: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:12
verses.text: and what shall I say? My Father, deliver me from this hour.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:13
verses.text: But  for this cause came I unto this hour.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:14
verses.text: My Father, glorify thy name.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:15
verses.text: And a  voice was heard from heaven, I have glorified it, and shall glorify it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:16
verses.text: And the multitude that were standing heard, and said, This is thunder: and others said, An  angel speaketh to him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:17
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Not because of me  was this voice, but because of you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:18
verses.text: Now is the judgement of this world; and the  prince of this world shall now be cast forth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:19
verses.text: And I, when I am lifted up from the  earth, shall draw every man unto me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:20
verses.text: This he said, that he might shew by what  manner of death he should die.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:21
verses.text: The multitudes said unto him, We have heard out of the law that the Messiah abideth for ever: how then sayest thou, that the Son of  man is to be lifted up? who is this, the Son of man? Jesus said unto them, Another little while is the light with you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:22
verses.text: Walk so long as ye have light, lest the darkness overtake you; for he that walketh in the darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:23
verses.text: So long as ye have light, believe the light, that ye may be the children of the light.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:24
verses.text: And when certain of the Pharisees asked of Jesus, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered and said unto them, The kingdom of God cometh not  with expectation: neither shall they say, Lo, it is here! nor, Lo, it is there! for the kingdom of God is within you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:25
verses.text: And in the daytime he was teaching in the temple; and at night he used to go  out, and pass the night in the mount called the mount of Olives.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:26
verses.text: And all the people came to him in the morning in the temple, to hear his word.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:27
verses.text: ,  Then spake Jesus unto the multitudes and his disciples, and said unto them, On  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:28
verses.text: the seat of Moses are seated the scribes and Pharisees: everything that they say unto you now to keep, keep and do: but according to their deeds  do ye not; for they say, and do not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:29
verses.text: And they bind heavy burdens, and lay them on the shoulders of the people; while they with one of their fingers will not come ,  near them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:30
verses.text: But all their deeds they do to make a shew before men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:31
verses.text: And all the multitude were hearing that with pleasure.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:32
verses.text: And in the course of his teaching he said unto them, Guard yourselves from the  scribes, who desire to walk in robes, and love salutation in the marketplaces, and sitting in the highest places of the synagogues, and at feasts in the highest parts of  the rooms: and they broaden their amulets, and lengthen the cords of their cloaks,  and love that they should be called by men, My master, and devour widows' houses, because of their prolonging their prayers; these then shall receive greater judgement.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:33
verses.text: But ye, be ye not called masters: for your master is one; all ye are brethren.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:34
verses.text: Call not then to yourselves any one father on earth: for your Father is one, who is  in heaven.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:35
verses.text: And be not called directors: for your director is one, even the Messiah.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:36
verses.text: ,  He that is great among you shall be unto you a minister.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:37
verses.text: Whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased; and whosoever shall abase himself shall be exalted.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:38
verses.text: Woe unto you, Pharisees! because ye love the highest places in the synagogues, and salutation in the marketplaces.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:39
verses.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye devour widows' houses, because of your prolonging your prayers: for this reason then ye shall receive greater judgement.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:40
verses.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye have shut the kingdom of God before men.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:41
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:42
verses.text: Woe unto you that know the law! for ye concealed the keys of knowledge: ye enter not, and those that are entering ye suffer not to enter.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:43
verses.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye compass land and sea to draw one proselyte; and when he is become so, ye make him a son of hell twice as much as yourselves.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:44
verses.text: Woe unto you, ye blind guides! because ye say, Whosoever sweareth by the temple, it is nothing; but whosoever sweareth by the gold that is in the temple,  shall be condemned.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:45
verses.text: Ye blind foolish ones: which is greater, the gold, or the  temple which sanctifieth the gold? And, Whosoever sweareth by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever sweareth by the offering that is upon it, shall be condemned.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:46
verses.text: Ye blind foolish ones: which is greater, the offering, or the altar which sanctifieth  the offering? Whosoever then sweareth by the altar, hath sworn by it, and by all  that is upon it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:47
verses.text: And whosoever sweareth by the temple, hath sworn by it, and by  him that is dwelling in it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:48
verses.text: And whosoever sweareth by heaven, hath sworn by the throne of God, and by him that sitteth upon it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:49
verses.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye tithe mint and rue and dill and cummin and all herbs, and ye leave the important matters of the law, judgement, and mercy, and faith, and the love of God: this ought ye to do, and  not to leave that undone.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:50
verses.text: Ye blind guides, which strain out a gnat, and swallow camels.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:51
verses.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter, while the inside of them is full of injustice and wrong.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:52
verses.text: Ye blind Pharisees, cleanse first the inside of the cup and of the platter, then shall the outside of them be cleansed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:53
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:54
verses.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye resemble whited sepulchres, which appear from the outside beautiful, but within  full of the bones of the dead, and all uncleanness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:55
verses.text: So ye also from without appear unto men like the righteous, but within ye are full of wrong and hypocrisy.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:56
verses.text: One of the scribes answered and said unto him, Teacher, in this saying of thine  thou art casting a slur on us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:57
verses.text: He said, And to you also, ye scribes, woe! for ye lade men with heavy burdens, and ye with one of your fingers come not near those burdens.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:58
verses.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye build the tombs of the prophets, which your fathers killed, and adorn the burying-places of the righteous,  and say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we should not have been partakers  with them in the blood of the prophets.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:59
verses.text: Wherefore, behold, ye witness against  yourselves, that ye are the children of those that slew the prophets.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:60
verses.text: And ye also,  ye fill up the measure of your fathers.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 41:61
verses.text: Ye serpents, ye children of vipers, where shall ye flee from the judgement of Gehenna?.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:1
verses.text: Section XLI.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:2
verses.text: Therefore, behold, I, the wisdom of God, am sending unto you prophets, and apostles, and wise men, and scribes: and some of them ye shall slay and crucify; and some of them ye shall beat in your synagogues, and persecute from city to  city: that there may come on you all the blood of the righteous that hath been poured upon the ground from the blood of Abel the pure to the blood of Zachariah the son of Barachiah, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:3
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, All these things shall come upon this generation.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:4
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:5
verses.text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, slayer of the prophets, and stoner of them that are sent unto her! how many times did I wish to gather thy children, as  a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, and ye would not! Your house shall  be left over you desolate.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:6
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, Ye shall not see me henceforth, till ye shall say Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:7
verses.text: And many of the rulers also believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they  were not confessing him, lest they be put out of the synagogue: and they loved  the praise of men more than the praising of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:8
verses.text: And Jesus cried and said,  Whosoever believeth in me, believeth not in me, but in him that sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:9
verses.text: And  whosoever seeth me hath seen him that sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:10
verses.text: I am come a light into the  world, and so every one that believeth in me abideth not in the darkness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:11
verses.text: And whosoever heareth my sayings, and keepeth them not, I judge him not: for I came  not to judge the world, but to give the world life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:12
verses.text: Whosoever wrongeth me, and receiveth not my sayings, there is one that judgeth him: the word that I spake, it  shall judge him at the last day.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:13
verses.text: I from myself did not speak: but the Father which sent me, he hath given me commandment, what I should say, and what I  should speak; and I know that his commandment is eternal life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:14
verses.text: The things that I say now, as my Father hath said unto me, even so I say.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:15
verses.text: And when he said that unto them, the scribes and Pharisees began their evil-doing, being angry with him, and finding fault with his sayings, and harassing him  in many things; seeking to catch something from his mouth, that they might be able to calumniate him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:16
verses.text: And when there gathered together myriads of great multitudes, which almost trode Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:17
verses.text: one upon another, Jesus began to say unto his disciples, Preserve yourselves  from the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:18
verses.text: For there is nothing  concealed, that shall not be revealed: nor hid, that shall not be known.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:19
verses.text: Everything that ye have said in the darkness shall be heard in the light; and what ye have spoken secretly in the ears in the inner chambers shall be proclaimed on the roofs.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:20
verses.text: ,  This said Jesus, and he went and hid himself from them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:21
verses.text: But notwithstanding  his having done all these signs before them, they believed not in him: that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, who said,  My Lord, who is he that hath believed to hear us?  And the arm of the Lord, to whom hath it appeared?   And for this reason it is not possible for them to believe, because Isaiah also said,   They have blinded their eyes, and made dark their heart;  That they may not see with their eyes, and understand with their heart,  And turn,  So that I should heal them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:22
verses.text: This said Isaiah when he saw his glory, and spake of him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:23
verses.text: And when Jesus went out of the temple, certain of his disciples came forward  to shew him the buildings of the temple, and its beauty and greatness, and the strength of the stones that were laid in it, and the elegance of its building, and that  it was adorned with noble stones and beautiful colours.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:24
verses.text: Jesus answered and said  unto them, See ye these great buildings? verily I say unto you, Days will come, when there shall not be left here a stone upon another, that shall not be cast down.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:25
verses.text: And two days before the passover of unleavened bread, the chief priests and  the scribes sought how they might take him by deceit, and kill him: and they said, It shall not be at the feast, lest the people be agitated.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:26
verses.text: And when Jesus sat on the mount of Olives opposite the temple, his disciples, Simon Cephas and James and John and Andrew, came forward unto him, and said unto him  between themselves and him, Teacher, tell us when that shall be, and what is the sign  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:27
verses.text: of thy coming and the end of the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:28
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Days will come, when ye shall long to see one of the days of the Son of ,  man, and shall not behold.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:29
verses.text: Take heed lest any man lead you astray.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:30
verses.text: Many shall  come in my name, and say, I am the Messiah; and they shall say, The time is come  near, and shall lead many astray: go not therefore after them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:31
verses.text: And when ye hear of wars and tidings of insurrections, see to it, be not agitated: for these things must  first be; only the end is not yet come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:32
verses.text: Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom  against kingdom: and great earthquakes shall be in one place and another, and there shall be famines and deaths and agitations: and there shall be fear and terror and great signs that shall appear from heaven, and there shall be great ,  storms All these things are the beginning of travail.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:33
verses.text: But before all of that, they shall lay hands upon you, and persecute you, and deliver you unto the synagogues  and into prisons, and bring you before kings and judges for my name's sake.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:34
verses.text: And  that shall be unto you for a witness.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:35
verses.text: But first must my gospel be preached unto all  nations.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:36
verses.text: And when they bring you into the synagogues before the rulers and the authorities, be not anxious beforehand how ye shall answer for yourselves, or what ye ,  shall say: because it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:37
verses.text: Lay it to your heart, not  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:38
verses.text: to be anxious before the time what ye shall say: and I shall give you understanding and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:39
verses.text: And then shall they deliver you unto constraint, and shall kill you: and ye shall be  hated of all nations because of my name.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:40
verses.text: And then shall many go astray, and they  shall hate one another, and deliver one another unto death.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:41
verses.text: And your parents, and your brethren, and your kinsfolk, and your friends shall deliver you up, and shall ,  slay some of you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:42
verses.text: But a lock of hair from your heads shall not perish.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:43
verses.text: And by  your patience ye shall gain your souls.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:44
verses.text: And many men, false prophets, shall arise,  and lead many astray.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:45
verses.text: And because of the abounding of iniquity, the love of many  shall wax cold.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:46
verses.text: But he that endureth to the end, the same shall be saved.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 42:47
verses.text: And  this, the gospel of the kingdom, shall be preached in all the world for a testimony to all nations; and then shall come the end of all.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:1
verses.text: Section XLII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:2
verses.text: But when ye see Jerusalem with the army compassing it about, then know that  its desolation is come near.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:3
verses.text: Those then that are in Judaea at that time shall flee to the mountain; and those that are within her shall flee; and those that are in the  villages shall not enter her.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:4
verses.text: For these days are the days of vengeance, that all that  is written may be fulfilled.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:5
verses.text: And when ye see the unclean sign of desolation, spoken of in Daniel the prophet, standing in the pure place, he that readeth shall understand, ,  and then he that is in Judaea shall flee in to the mountain: and let him that is on the  roof not go down, nor enter in to take anything from his house: and let him that is in  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:6
verses.text: the field not turn behind him to take his garment.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:7
verses.text: Woe to them that are with child and to them that give suck in those days! there shall be great  distress in the land, and wrath against this nation.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:8
verses.text: And they shall fall on the edge of the sword, and shall be taken captive to every land: and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the nations, until the times of the nations be ended.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:9
verses.text: Then if any man say unto you, The Messiah is here; or, Lo, he is there; believe  him not: there shall rise then false Messiahs and prophets of lying, and shall do signs and wonders, in order that they may lead astray even the elect also, if they  be able.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:10
verses.text: But as for you, beware: for I have acquainted you with everything  beforehand.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:11
verses.text: If then they say unto you, Lo, he is in the desert; go not out, lest ye  be taken: and if they say unto you, Lo, he is in the chamber; believe not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:12
verses.text: And as the lightning appeareth from the east, and is seen unto the west; so shall be the  coming of the Son of man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:13
verses.text: But first he must suffer much and be rejected by this  generation.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:14
verses.text: Pray therefore that your flight be not in winter, nor on a sabbath:  there shall be then great tribulation, the like of which there hath not been from the  beginning of the world till now, nor shall be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:15
verses.text: And except the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh would have lived: but because of the elect, whom he elected,  he shortened those days.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:16
verses.text: And there shall be signs in the sun and the moon and the stars; and upon the earth affliction of the nations, and rubbing of hands for the confusion  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:17
verses.text: of the noise of the sea, and an earthquake: the souls of men shall  go forth from fear of that which is to come upon the earth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:18
verses.text: And in those days, straightway after the distress of those days, the sun shall become dark, and the moon shall not shew its light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers  of heaven shall be convulsed: and then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and at that time all the tribes of the earth shall wail, and look unto the Son  of man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and much glory.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:19
verses.text: And he shall send his angels with the great trumpet, and they shall gather his elect from the four  winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:20
verses.text: But when these things begin to be, be of good cheer, and lift up your heads; for your salvation is come near.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:21
verses.text: Learn the example of the fig tree: when it letteth down its branches, and putteth  forth its leaves, ye know that the summer is come; so ye also, when ye see these things begun to be, know ye that the kingdom of God hath arrived at the  door.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:22
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, until all these  things shall be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:23
verses.text: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my sayings shall not pass away.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:24
verses.text: Take heed to yourselves, that your hearts become not heavy with inordinate desire, and drunkenness, and the care of the world at any time, and that day come  upon you suddenly: for it is as a shock that shocks all the inhabitants that are on the  face of the whole earth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:25
verses.text: Watch at all times, and pray, that ye may be worthy to escape Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:26
verses.text: from all the things that are to be, and that ye may stand before the Son of  man.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:27
verses.text: Of that day and of that hour hath no man learned, not even the angels  of heaven, neither the Son, but the Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:28
verses.text: See ye, and watch and pray: for ye know  not when that time will be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:29
verses.text: It is as a man, who journeyed, and left his house, and gave his authority to his servants, and appointed every man to his work, and  charged the porter to be wakeful.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:30
verses.text: Be wakeful then: since ye know not when the lord of the house cometh, in the evening, or in the middle of the night, or when the  cock croweth, or in the morning; lest he come unexpectedly, and find you sleeping.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:31
verses.text: The thing that I say unto you, unto all of you do I say it, Be ye watchful.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:32
verses.text: For as it was in the days of Noah, so shall the coming of the Son of man be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:33
verses.text: As they were before the flood eating and drinking, and taking wives, and giving  wives to men, until the day in which Noah entered into the ark, and they perceived not till the flood came, and took them all; so shall the coming of the Son of man  be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:34
verses.text: And as it was in the days of Lot; they were eating and drinking, and selling  and buying, and planting and building, on the day in which Lot went out from Sodom, and the Lord rained fire and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed them ,  all: so shall it be in the day in which the Son of man is revealed.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:35
verses.text: And in that day, whosoever is on the roof, and his garments in the house, let him not go down to  take them: and he that is in the field shall not turn behind him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:36
verses.text: Remember Lot's  wife.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:37
verses.text: Whosoever shall desire to save his life shall destroy it: but whosoever shall  destroy his life shall save it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:38
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, In that night there shall be two on  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:39
verses.text: one bed; one shall be taken, and another left.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:40
verses.text: And two women shall be grinding  at one mill; one shall be taken, and another left.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:41
verses.text: And two shall be in the  field; one shall be taken, and another left.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:42
verses.text: They answered and said unto him, To what place, our Lord? He said unto them, Where the body is, there will the eagles ,  gather.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:43
verses.text: Be attentive now: for ye know not at what hour your Lord cometh.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:44
verses.text: Know this: if the master of the house had known in what watch the thief would come, he would have been attentive, and would not make it possible that his house should be  broken through.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 43:45
verses.text: Therefore be ye also ready: for in the hour that ye think not the Son of man cometh.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:1
verses.text: Section XLIII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:2
verses.text: Simon Cephas said unto him, Our Lord, is it to us that thou hast spoken this  parable, or also to every man? Jesus said unto him, Who, thinkest thou, is the servant, the master of the house, trusted with control, whom his lord set over his  household, to give them their food in its season? Blessed is that servant, whom his  lord shall come and find having done so.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:3
verses.text: Verily I say unto you, He will set him  over all that he hath.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:4
verses.text: But if that evil servant say in his heart, My lord delayeth his  coming; and shall begin to beat his servants and the maidservants of his lord, and  shall begin to eat and to drink with the drunken; the lord of that servant shall come  in the day that he thinketh not, and in the hour that he knoweth not, and shall Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:5
verses.text: judge him, and appoint his portion with the hypocrites, and with those that are not faithful: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:6
verses.text: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be like unto ten virgins, those that took their  lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom and the bride.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:7
verses.text: Five of them were  wise, and five foolish.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:8
verses.text: And those foolish ones took their lamps, and took not with ,  them oil: but those wise ones took oil in vessels along with their lamps.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:9
verses.text: When then  the bridegroom delayed, they all slumbered and slept.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:10
verses.text: But in the middle of the night there occurred a cry, Behold, the bridegroom cometh! Go forth therefore to ,  meet him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:11
verses.text: Then all those virgins arose, and made ready their lamps.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:12
verses.text: The foolish  said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are gone out.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:13
verses.text: But those wise answered and said, Perhaps there will not be enough for us and you: but go ye to  the sellers, and buy for yourselves.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:14
verses.text: And when they went away to buy, the bridegroom came; and those that were ready went in with him to the marriage feast: and  the door was shut.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:15
verses.text: And at last those other virgins also came and said, Our Lord,  our Lord, open unto us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:16
verses.text: He answered and said unto them, Verily I say unto you,  I know you not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:17
verses.text: Watch then, for ye know not that day nor that hour.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:18
verses.text: It is as a man, who went on a journey, and called his servants, and delivered unto  them his possessions.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:19
verses.text: And unto one he gave five talents, and another two, and another  one; every one according to his strength; and went on his journey forthwith.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:20
verses.text: He Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:21
verses.text: then that received the five talents went and traded with them, and gained  other five.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:22
verses.text: And so also he of the two gained other two.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:23
verses.text: But he that received  the one went and digged in the earth, and hid the money of his lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:24
verses.text: And after a long time the lord of those servants came, and took from them the account.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:25
verses.text: And he that received five talents came near and brought other five, and said, My lord, thou gavest me five talents: lo, I have gained other five in addition to them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:26
verses.text: His lord said unto him, Well done, thou good and faithful servant: over a little hast  thou been faithful, over much will I set thee: enter into the joy of thy lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:27
verses.text: And he that had the two came near and said, My lord, thou gavest me two talents: lo,  other two have I gained in addition to them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:28
verses.text: His lord said unto him, Good, thou faithful servant: over a little hast thou been faithful, over much will I set thee: enter  into the joy of thy lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:29
verses.text: And he also that received the one talent came forward and said, My lord, I knew thee that thou art a severe man, who reapest where thou  sowest not, and gatherest where thou didst not scatter: and so I was afraid, and  went away and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, thou hast what is thine.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:30
verses.text: His lord answered and said unto him, Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest me  that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I did not scatter; it was incumbent on thee to put my money to the bank, and then I should come and seek it with its  gains.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:31
verses.text: Take now from him the talent, and give it to him that hath ten talents.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:32
verses.text: Whosoever hath shall be given, and he shall have more: but he that hath not, even  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:33
verses.text: what he hath shall be taken from him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:34
verses.text: And the unprofitable servant, put him forth into the outer darkness: there shall be the weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:35
verses.text: ,  Your loins shall be girded, and your lamps lit; and ye shall be like the people that are looking for their lord, when he shall return from the feast; so that, when  he cometh and knocketh, they may at once open unto him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:36
verses.text: Blessed are those servants, whom their lord shall come and find attentive: verily I say unto you, that he will gird his waist, and make them sit down, and pass through them and serve  them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:37
verses.text: And if he come in the second watch, or the third, and find thus, blessed are those servants.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:38
verses.text: But when the Son of man cometh in his glory, and all his pure angels with him,  then shall he sit on the throne of his glory: and he will gather before him all the nations, and separate them the one from the other, like the shepherd who separateth  the sheep from the goats; and will set the sheep on his right, and the goats on his  left.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:39
verses.text: Then shall the King say to those that are at his right, Come, ye blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundations of the world:  I hungered, and ye gave me to eat; and I thirsted, and ye gave me to drink; and I  was a stranger, and ye took me in; and I was naked, and ye clothed me; and I  was sick, and ye visited me; and I was in prison, and ye cared for me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:40
verses.text: Then shall those righteous say unto him, Our Lord, when saw we thee hungry, and fed thee?  or thirsty, and gave thee to drink? And when saw we thee a stranger, and took  thee in? or naked, and clothed thee? And when saw we thee sick, or imprisoned, and  cared for thee? The King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, What  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:41
verses.text: ye did to one of these my brethren, the little ones, ye did unto me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:42
verses.text: Then shall he say unto those that are on his left also, Depart from me, ye cursed,  into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his hosts: I hungered, and ye fed me  not; and I thirsted, and ye did not give me to drink; and I was a stranger, and ye took me not in; and I was naked, and ye clothed me not; and I was sick, and imprisoned,  and ye visited me not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:43
verses.text: Then shall those also answer and say, Our Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, or athirst, or naked, or a stranger, or sick, or imprisoned,  and did not minister unto thee? Then shall he answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, When ye did it not unto one of these little ones, ye did it not  unto me also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 44:44
verses.text: And these shall go away into eternal punishment: but the righteous into eternal life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:1
verses.text: Section XLIV.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:2
verses.text: ,  And when Jesus finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples, Ye know that after two days will be the passover, and the Son of man is delivered up to be  crucified.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:3
verses.text: Then gathered together the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders  of the people, unto the court of the chief priest, who was called Caiaphas; and they took counsel together concerning Jesus, that they might seize him by subtilty, and  kill him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:4
verses.text: But they said, Not during the feast, lest there take place a disturbance among the people; for they feared the people.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:5
verses.text: And Satan entered into Judas who was called Iscariot, who was of the number  of the twelve.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:6
verses.text: And he went away, and communed with the chief priests, and the scribes, and those that held command in the temple, and said unto them, What  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:7
verses.text: would ye pay me, and I will deliver him unto you? And they, when they heard it, were pleased, and made ready for him thirty pieces of money.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:8
verses.text: And he promised them, and from that time he sought an opportunity that he might deliver unto them Jesus without the multitude.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:9
verses.text: And on the first day of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus, and said unto him, Where wilt thou that we go and make ready for thee that thou mayest eat the passover?   And before the feast of the passover, Jesus knew that the hour was arrived for his departure from this world unto his Father; and he loved his own in this world,  and to the last he loved them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:10
verses.text: And at the time of the feast, Satan put into the  heart of Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, to deliver him up.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:11
verses.text: And Jesus, because he knew that the Father had delivered into his hands everything, and that he came  forth from the Father, and goeth unto God, rose from supper, and laid aside his  garments; and took a towel, and girded his waist, and poured water into a bason, and began to wash the feet of his disciples, and to wipe them with the towel wherewith  his waist was girded.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:12
verses.text: And when he came to Simon Cephas, Simon said unto  him, Dost thou, my Lord, wash for me my feet? Jesus answered and said unto  him, What I do, now thou knowest not; but afterwards thou shalt learn.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:13
verses.text: Simon said unto him, Thou shalt never wash for me my feet.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:14
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, If I  wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:15
verses.text: Simon Cephas said unto him, Then, my  Lord, wash not for me my feet alone, but my hands also and my head.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:16
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, He that batheth needeth not to wash save his feet, whereas his whole  body is clean: and ye also are clean, but not all of you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:17
verses.text: For Jesus knew him that should betray him; therefore said he, Ye are not all clean.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:18
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:19
verses.text: So when he had washed their feet, he took his garments, and sat down, and  said unto them, Know ye what I have done unto you? Ye call me, Master,  and, Lord: and ye say well; so I am.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:20
verses.text: If then I, now, who am your Lord and Master, have washed for you your feet, how needful is it that ye should wash one another's feet!  This have I given you as an example, that as I have done to you so ye should do  also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:21
verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, No servant is greater than his lord; nor an  apostle greater than he that sent him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:22
verses.text: If ye know that, ye are happy if ye do it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:23
verses.text: My saying this is not for all of you: for I know whom I have chosen: but that the scripture might be fulfilled, He that eateth with me bread lifted against me his  heel.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:24
verses.text: Henceforth I say unto you before it come to pass, that, when it cometh to  pass, ye may believe that I am he.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:25
verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me; and whosoever receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:26
verses.text: Who is the great one, he that sitteth, or he that serveth? is it not he that sitteth?  I am among you as he that serveth.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:27
verses.text: But ye are they that have continued with me  in my temptations; I promise you, as my Father promised me, the kingdom, that ye may eat and drink at the table of my kingdom.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:28
verses.text: And the first day came, the feast of unleavened bread, on which the Jews were  wont to sacrifice the passover.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:29
verses.text: And Jesus sent two of his disciples, Cephas and John, and said unto them, Go and make ready for us the passover, that we may eat.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:30
verses.text: ,  And they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we make ready for thee? He said unto them, Go, enter the city; and at the time of your entering, there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water; follow him, and the place where he entereth, say  to such an one, the master of the house, Our Master saith, My time is come, and Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:31
verses.text: at thy house I keep the passover.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:32
verses.text: Where then is the lodging-place where  I shall eat with my disciples? And he will shew you a large upper room  spread and made ready: there then make ready for us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:33
verses.text: And his two disciples went out, and came to the city, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover as he had said unto them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:34
verses.text: And when the evening was come, and the time arrived, Jesus came and reclined,  and the twelve apostles with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:35
verses.text: And he said unto them, With desire I have  desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer: I say unto you, that henceforth I shall not eat it, until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:36
verses.text: Jesus said that, and was agitated in his spirit, and testified, and said, Verily,  verily, I say unto you, One of you, he that eateth with me, shall betray me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:37
verses.text: And they were very sorrowful; and they began to say unto him, one after another of  them, Can it be I, Lord? He answered and said unto them, One of the twelve,  he that dippeth his hand with me in the dish, will betray me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:38
verses.text: And lo, the hand of  him that betrayeth me is on the table.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:39
verses.text: And the Son of man goeth, as it is written of him: woe then to that man by whose hand the Son of man is betrayed! for it  would have been better for that man had he not been born.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 45:40
verses.text: And the disciples  looked one on another, for they knew not to whom he referred; and they began to search among themselves, who that might be who was to do this.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:1
verses.text: Section XLV.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:2
verses.text: ,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:3
verses.text: And one of his disciples was sitting in his bosom, he whom Jesus loved.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:4
verses.text: To him Simon Cephas beckoned, that he should ask him who this was, concerning  whom he spake.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:5
verses.text: And that disciple leaned on Jesus' breast, and said unto him,  My Lord, who is this? Jesus answered and said, He to whom I shall dip bread, and give it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:6
verses.text: And Jesus dipped bread, and gave to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:7
verses.text: And after the bread, Satan entered him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:8
verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, What thou  desirest to do, hasten the doing of it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:9
verses.text: And no man of them that sat knew why he  said this unto him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:10
verses.text: And some of them thought, because Judas had the box, that he was bidding him buy what would be needed for the feast; or, that he might pay  something to the poor.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:11
verses.text: Judas the betrayer answered and said, Can it be I, my  Master? Jesus said unto him, Thou hast said.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:12
verses.text: And Judas took the bread straightway, and went forth without: and it was still night.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:13
verses.text: And Jesus said, Now is the Son of man being glorified, and God is being glorified  in him; and if God is glorified in him, God also will glorify him in him, and straightway will glorify him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:14
verses.text: And while they were eating, Jesus took bread, and blessed, and divided; and he  gave to his disciples, and said unto them, Take and eat; this is my body.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:15
verses.text: And he Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:16
verses.text: took a cup, and gave thanks, and blessed, and gave them, and said, Take ,  and drink of it, all of you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:17
verses.text: And they drank of it, all of them.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:18
verses.text: And he said unto them, This is my blood, the new covenant, that is shed for many for the  forgiveness of sins.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:19
verses.text: I say unto you, I shall not drink henceforth of this, the juice of the vine, until the day in which I drink with you new wine in the kingdom of  God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:20
verses.text: And thus do ye in remembrance of me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:21
verses.text: And Jesus said unto Simon, Simon,  behold, Satan asketh that he may sift you like wheat: but I entreat for thee, that thou lose not thy faith: and do thou, at some time, turn and strengthen thy brethren.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:22
verses.text: My children, another little while am I with you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:23
verses.text: And ye shall seek me: and as  I said unto the Jews, Whither I go, ye cannot come; I say unto you now also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:24
verses.text: A new commandment I give you, that ye may love one another; and as I have loved  you, so shall ye also love one another.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:25
verses.text: By this shall every man know that ye are  my disciples, if ye have love one to another.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:26
verses.text: Simon Cephas said unto him, Our Lord, whither goest thou? Jesus answered and said unto him, Whither I go, thou canst not now follow me; but later thou shalt come.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:27
verses.text: Then said Jesus unto them, Ye all shall desert me this night: it is written, I  will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:28
verses.text: But after my  rising, I shall go before you into Galilee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:29
verses.text: Simon Cephas answered and said unto  him, My Lord, if every man desert thee, I shall at no time desert thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:30
verses.text: I am with thee ready for imprisonment and for death.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:31
verses.text: And my life will I give up for thee.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:32
verses.text: Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:33
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Wilt thou give up thy life for me? Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Thou shalt to-day, during this night, before the cock crow  twice, three times deny me, that thou knowest me not.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:34
verses.text: But Cephas said the more, Even if it lead to death with thee, I shall not deny thee, my Lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:35
verses.text: And in like manner said all the disciples also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:36
verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, Let not your hearts be troubled: believe in God,  and believe in me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:37
verses.text: The stations in my Father's house are many, else I should  have told you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:38
verses.text: I go to prepare for you a place.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:39
verses.text: And if I go to prepare for you a place, I shall return again, and take you unto me: and so where I am, there ye ,  shall be also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:40
verses.text: And the place that I go ye know, and the way ye know.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:41
verses.text: Thomas said unto him, Our Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how is the way for  us to the knowledge of that? Jesus said unto him, I am the way, and the truth,  and the life: and no man cometh unto my Father, but through me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:42
verses.text: And if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father: and from henceforth ye know him,  and have seen him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:43
verses.text: Philip said unto him, Our Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth  us.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:44
verses.text: Jesus said unto him, Have I been all this time with you, and dost thou not know me, Philip? whosoever hath seen me hath seen the Father; how then sayest  thou, Shew us the Father? Believest thou not that I am in my Father, and my Father in me? and the saying that I say, I say not of myself: but my Father who dwelleth in  me, he doeth these deeds.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:45
verses.text: Believe that I am in my Father, and my Father in me:  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:46
verses.text: or else believe for the sake of the deeds.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:47
verses.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever believeth in me, the deeds that I do shall he do also; and  more than that shall he do: I go unto the Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:48
verses.text: And what ye shall ask in my  name, I shall do unto you, that the Father may be glorified in his Son.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:49
verses.text: And if ye ,  ask me in my name, I will do it.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:50
verses.text: If ye love me, keep my commandments.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:51
verses.text: And I will entreat of my Father, and he will send unto you another Paraclete, that he  may be with you for ever, even the Spirit of truth: whom the world cannot receive; for it hath not seen him, nor known him: but ye know him; for he hath dwelt  with you, and is in you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:52
verses.text: I will not leave you orphans: I will come unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:53
verses.text: Another little while, and the world seeth me not; but ye see me that I live, and ye  shall live also.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 46:54
verses.text: And in that day ye shall know that I am in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:1
verses.text: Section XLVI.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:2
verses.text: Whosoever hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will  shew myself unto him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:3
verses.text: Judas (not Iscariot) said unto him, My Lord, what is the  purpose of thy intention to shew thyself to us, and not to the world? Jesus answered and said unto him, Whosoever loveth me will keep my word: and my Father will love him, and to him will we come, and make our abode with him.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:4
verses.text: But he that loveth me not keepeth not my word: and this word that ye hear is not my word, but the Father's which sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:5
verses.text: ,  This have I spoken unto you, while I was yet with you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:6
verses.text: But the Paraclete, the Holy Spirit, whom my Father will send in my name, he will teach you everything, and  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:7
verses.text: he will bring to your remembrance all that I say unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:8
verses.text: Peace I leave you; my peace I give unto you: and not as this world giveth, give I unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:9
verses.text: Let your heart not be troubled, nor fearful.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:10
verses.text: Ye heard that I said unto you, that I go away, and come unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:11
verses.text: If ye loved me, ye would rejoice, that I go away to my  Father: for my Father is greater than I.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:12
verses.text: And now I say unto you before it come  to pass, that, when it cometh to pass, ye may believe me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:13
verses.text: Now I will not speak with you much: the Archon of the world will come, and he will have nothing in  me: but that the world may know that I love my Father, and as my Father charged me, so I do.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:14
verses.text: And he said unto them, When I sent you without purses, or wallets, and shoes,  lacked ye perchance anything? They said unto him, Nothing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:15
verses.text: He said unto them, Henceforth, whosoever hath a purse, let him take it, and likewise the wallet also: and whosoever hath not a sword, shall sell his garment, and buy for himself a  sword.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:16
verses.text: I say unto you, that this scripture also must be fulfilled in me, that I should be reckoned with the transgressors: for all that is said of me is fulfilled in  me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:17
verses.text: His disciples said unto him, Our Lord, lo, here are two swords.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:18
verses.text: He said  unto them, They are sufficient.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:19
verses.text: Arise, let us go hence.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:20
verses.text: And they arose, and praised, and went forth, and went, according to their custom, to the mount of Olives, he and his disciples.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:21
verses.text: And he said unto them, I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:22
verses.text: Every branch that produceth not fruit in me, he taketh it: and that which giveth fruit,  he cleanseth it, that it may give much fruit.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:23
verses.text: Ye are already clean because of the word  that I have spoken unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:24
verses.text: Abide in me, and I in you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:25
verses.text: And as the branch of the Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:26
verses.text: vine cannot produce fruit of itself, if it be not abiding in the vine; so too ye  also, if ye abide not in me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:27
verses.text: I am the vine, and ye are the branches: He then that abideth in me, and I in him, he giveth much fruit: for without me ye cannot  do anything.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:28
verses.text: And if a man abide not in me, he is cast without, like a withered  branch; and it is gathered, and cast into the fire, that it may be burned.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:29
verses.text: If ye abide in me, and my word abide in you, everything that ye desire to ask shall be  done unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:30
verses.text: And herein is the Father glorified, that ye may give much fruit;  and ye shall be my disciples.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:31
verses.text: And as my Father loved me, I loved you also:  abide in my love.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:32
verses.text: If ye keep my commands, ye shall abide in my love; as I have  kept my Father's commands, and abode in his love.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:33
verses.text: I have spoken that unto you,  that my joy may be in you, and your joy be fulfilled.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:34
verses.text: This is my commandment,  that ye love one another, as I loved you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:35
verses.text: And no love is greater than this, namely,  that a man should give his life for his friends.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:36
verses.text: Ye are my friends, if ye do all that  I command you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:37
verses.text: I call you not now servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: my friends have I now called you; for everything that I heard from  my Father I have made known unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:38
verses.text: Ye did not choose me, but I chose I you, and appointed you, that ye also should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should  abide; and that all that ye shall ask my Father in my name, he may give you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:39
verses.text: This  I command you, that ye love one another.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:40
verses.text: And if the world hate you, know that  before you it hated me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:41
verses.text: If then ye were of the world, the world would love its own: but ye are not of the world: I chose you out of the world: therefore the world  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:42
verses.text: hateth you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:43
verses.text: Remember the word that I said unto you, that no servant is greater than his lord.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:44
verses.text: And if they persecuted me, you also will they  persecute; and if they kept my word, your word also will they keep.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:45
verses.text: But all these things will they do unto you for my name's sake, for they have not known him  that sent me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:46
verses.text: And if I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin:  but now they have no excuse for their sins.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:47
verses.text: Whosoever hateth me, also hateth my  Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:48
verses.text: And if I had not done the deeds before them that no other man did, they would not have had sin: but now they have seen and hated me and my Father  also: that the word may be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me for  nothing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:49
verses.text: But when the Paraclete is come, whom I will send unto you from my Father, even the Spirit of truth, which goeth forth from my Father, he shall bear witness of  me: and ye also bear witness, because from the beginning ye have been with me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:50
verses.text: ,  I have said that unto you, that ye may not stumble.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:51
verses.text: And they shall put you out of their synagogues: and there cometh an hour when every one that killeth  you shall think that he hath offered unto God an offering.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:52
verses.text: And they will do that,  because they do not know me, nor my Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:53
verses.text: I have said that unto you, so that  when its time is come, ye may remember it, that I told you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:54
verses.text: And this hitherto I said not unto you, because I was with you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:55
verses.text: But now I go unto him that sent me; and no  man of you asketh me whither I go.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:56
verses.text: I have said that unto you now, and grief hath  come and taken possession of your hearts But I say the truth unto you; It is better for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Paraclete will not come unto you;  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:57
verses.text: but if I go away, I will send him unto you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:58
verses.text: And when he cometh, he will reprove the world for sin, and for righteousness, and for judgement: ,  for sin, because they have not believed in me; and for righteousness, because I go  to my Father; and for judgement, because the Archon of this world hath been  judged.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:59
verses.text: And further have I many things to speak unto you, but ye cannot tarry  now.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:60
verses.text: Howbeit when the Spirit of truth is come, he will remind you of all the truth: he will say nothing from himself; but everything that he heareth, that shall  he say: and he shall make known unto you the things that are to be.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:61
verses.text: And he shall  glorify me; for from me shall he take and shew you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 47:62
verses.text: All that my Father hath is mine: therefore said I unto you, that he taketh of mine, and shall shew you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:1
verses.text: Section XLVII.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:2
verses.text: A little while, and ye shall not behold me; and a little while again, and ye shall  behold me; because I go to the Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:3
verses.text: His disciples therefore said one to another, What is this that he hath said unto us, A little while, and ye shall not behold me; and a little while again, and ye shall behold me: and, I go to my  Father? And they said, What is this little while that he hath said? We know not  what he speaketh.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:4
verses.text: And Jesus perceived that they were seeking to ask him, and said unto them, Do ye inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said unto you, A little while, and ye behold me not, and a little while again, and ye shall  behold me? Verily, verily, I say unto you, that ye shall weep and grieve, but the world shall rejoice: and ye shall be sorrowful, but your grief shall turn to joy.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:5
verses.text: For, a woman when the time is come for her that she should bring forth, the arrival of the day of her bringing forth distresseth her: but whenever she hath brought forth a son, she remembereth not her distress, for joy at the birth of a man into the  world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:6
verses.text: And ye now also grieve: but I shall see you, and your hearts shall rejoice,  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:7
verses.text: and your joy no man taketh from you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:8
verses.text: And in that day ye shall ask me nothing.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:9
verses.text: And verily, verily, I say unto you, All that ye ask my Father in my name, he will give you.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:10
verses.text: Hitherto ye have asked nothing  in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be complete.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:11
verses.text: I have spoken unto you now in aenigmas: but there will come an hour when I shall not speak to you in aenigmas, but shall reveal unto you the Father plainly,  in that day when ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I shall  entreat the Father for you; for the Father loveth you, because ye have loved me,  and have believed that I came forth from my Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:12
verses.text: I came forth from my Father, and came into the world: and I leave the world, and go unto my Father.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:13
verses.text: His disciples said unto him, Lo, thy speech is now plain, and thou hast not said one  thing in an aenigma.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:14
verses.text: Now, lo, we know that thou knowest everything, and needest not that any man should ask thee: and by this we believe that thou camest forth ,  from God.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:15
verses.text: Jesus said unto them, Believe that an hour cometh, and lo, it hath come, and ye shall be scattered, every one of you to his place, and shall leave me  alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:16
verses.text: This have I said unto you, that in me ye may have peace.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:17
verses.text: And in the world trouble shall overtake you: but be of good courage; for I have overcome the world.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:18
verses.text: This said Jesus, and lifted up his eyes unto heaven, and said, My Father, the hour  is come; glorify thy Son, that thy Son may glorify thee: as thou gavest him authority  over all flesh, that all that thou hast given him, he might give them eternal life.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:19
verses.text: And this is eternal life, that they should know that thou alone art true God, and that he  Arabic, p.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:20
verses.text: whom thou didst send is Jesus the Messiah.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:21
verses.text: I glorified thee in the earth,  and the work which thou gavest me to do I have accomplished.

verses.name: The Diatessaron 48:22
verses.text: And now glorify thou me, O Father, beside thee, with that glory which I had with thee  before the world was.
